story:
New Orleans is a city of magic, of curiosities, of mystery, of the most incredible human displays of celebration. A city steeped in flavor, tradition, performance & the beauty of serendipity. We feel indebted to her, to the gifts she continually gives us.

Interrobang Parading Krewe is a diverse group of creators; artists, builders, musicians, fire breathers, DJ’s, dancers, cooks, mechanics, engineers, and dreamers. We have different visions, different voices. 

But together we found a common goal: 

Creating large-scale kinetic art to share with the community during Carnival and beyond...


Coming into the 2016 Parading Season, we're entering the final stretch to finish our new, top-secret float. It's going to be the biggest, most imaginative creation we've dreamed up.  We will debut her during Carnival, but our long-term intent is to share her with the larger community. We want to create educational opportunities to engage, influence & inspire people of all ages in New Orleans.



Countless studies have shown that creative problem-solving improves brain function for people of all ages.  Studies also show that when you take art away from kids, their performance in Math and Science correspondingly go down.  A list of developmental benefits of art from PBS can be seen at http://www.pbs.org/parents/education/music-arts...

We want to show people of all ages that they can gather some friends, find some re-purposed materials, and build something magical.

Initially we will work with 501c3 not-for-profit Chewbacchus and Ignition Event Management LLC to create educational opportunities to engage the community.

Our intent is to later partner with some local schools and other organizations to share our project with people from the community, give a presentation about our process from design to materials and execution, and allow them to interact with and explore our creation.

As our krewe expands, our goal is to host free workshops to teach fundamental construction and crafting techniques, providing hands-on building experience that can be utilized in countless ways.  

In order to start this journey we need to have the ability to house our creation and a way to transport her to these opportunities.

And we could use your help. 


We've set up a special account to specifically cover these costs:

  • Housing solution and storage to keep our new float shielded from the elements

  • Transportation materials to increase the mobility of the float for sharing it with a wider section of the community (without having to hand-push it there!)

  • Dependable power source for light and sound (non-borrowed) 
  • Disaster fund for road bumps along the parade route

Transportation‽

The transportation capability we intend to acquire will allow us to take the float further than we can push it. We have access to a trailer capable of hauling the float, but getting her up onto the trailer and back down is a dangerous and all-day task. Raising the float 3 feet in the air using a car jack and two dozen cinder blocks, then rolling the trailer underneath is the only option we really have. Obtaining a used auto lift or a heavy duty trailer axle and tongue that we can bolt directly to the steel float frame will allow us to safely tow it.



You already know that we're capable of creating something magical. Moving forward, we want to do more than just party in the streets: We intend to share our art with the larger community. 

  • Investing in housing and transportation options will allow us to prolong the amount of time we have to share the new float with the community.

  • We intend to partner with local organizations and schools to create educational opportunities for new generations of creators. Exposing local youth and adults to Independent Mardi Gras can have broad stroke effects on the future of Carnival.

  • Interrobang is a not-for-profit, self-funded organization. With your support, we can afford to stop borrowing and improvising (and paying for repairs to the borrowed and improvised items) by investing in solid infrastructure.  



Donate, but also share our campaign. Even a one-click share can get our video in the hands of someone who is really able to help us meet our goal. 

And your donations do not have to be limited to cash! We're always in need of solid materials, used tools, and art supplies! Please contact us through our website or facebook page if you think you can help in this way. 

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR WATCHING, READING, DONATING AND SHARING!







MIKI GLASSER PENDANT : A gorgeous handmade clay necklace made by our very own Krewe member Miki Glasser, featuring an artistic rendering of this year's float!  Check out her work below, and at https://www.facebook.com/MikiGlasserArt/


INTERROBLING : Handmade 3-D Printed Mardi Gras Throw, shipped directly to your door!  Last year's throws were custom designed and printed just feet away from Gilliam while we worked on her. They include a rare earth magnet in the design for easy mounting on metal! Watch the printing process below:



Sean O'Grady and Old Moon Studio : oldmoonstudio.com
Kumasi (amazing New Orleans-based Afrobeat!) : kumasiafrobeat.com
Freddie Segro: freddiesegro.com

Jason Foster: fosterbearfilms.com


(In case you missed it above!)

story:
What is this Campaign about?

This campaign serves to support the revolutionary Awakening Arts Academy and the international group of students seeking to become certified through the Certification Program in the summer of 2016 by subsidizing the cost of tuition for the course.
All funds raised will go directly to the cost of the certification program, split between the 3 members of this campaign.


What is the Awakening Arts Academy?

‘Awakening Artists’ recognize that art has the capacity to transform consciousness- both personally and collectively.
Around the world passionate individuals are dramatically changing the face of art, culture and consciousness. The Awakening Arts Academy is at the forefront of this movement, using creative exploration as a catalyst for insight, growth, and healing, resulting in a growing sense of purpose that reinvigorates lives from the inside out.

In order to be able to offer responsible facilitation and guidance on a professional level, we need to deepen our understanding, and application of, our respective artistic modalities and become certified through a teacher and course that reflects our goals and empowers us to reach them.

As a group we have gathered from around the world to ask for financial help to do just that through the Transformative Arts Program at the Awakening Arts Academy in Assisi, Italy.

The Certification Program will serve as a springboard for us to offer the profound benefits of creativity in practical, meaningful ways such as teaching classes and leading workshops to children and adults around the world.

To learn more about the course, please visit:
http://awakeningartsacademy.com/academy/certification/


What is the Certification Program?

The Certification Program is comprised of two levels.

LEVEL ONE serves as a foundation of personal experience in the approach.  LEVEL TWO is a practitioner's training.


LEVEL ONE foundation provides a personal journey of self-discovery, healing and spiritual growth. A variety of courses expose students to the many modalities of the arts (music and dance, painting, sculpture, theater, film, etc.) and to the principles of art, creativity and consciousness. Our interdisciplinary approach uses all creative modalities as vehicles for increased self-awareness and empowerment.

LEVEL ONE is the required foundation for the LEVEL TWO Transformative Arts Certificate™.


LEVEL TWO training enables the practitioner to teach the Transformative Arts method™, to facilitate groups, to serve as a ‘creativity coach’ and to integrate transformational process into their professional practices.  Level two offers content rich intensives, personalized projects and higher level courses of theory and methodology.  In addition, students are closely mentored as they develop skills in teaching and facilitating creative process. 

Successful completion of LEVEL TWO requirements confers a Transformative Arts Certificate™

This program is an empowering aid to careers in teaching, healing arts, counseling, life coaching, organizational development and consulting, spiritual leadership and creative professions. It is especially useful for facilitators of personal growth in schools, colleges, hospitals, clinics, spiritual centers, and other institutions. Graduates are trained to lead workshops and to facilitate group process.


Who Are We?

There are 5 of us banding together from around the world through this campaign seeking financial aid to become certified through this ground breaking program:

To view some of our work Click Here: https://www.facebook.com/Awakening-Arts-Italy-1...

Deus Fortier - Vancouver, Canada

A performing artist who is involved in a variety of creative modalities both personally and professionally. A reluctant artist, his exploration of the arts began as a young adult out of a deep inner longing for a non-linear approach to self-development, personal growth, and playful expression.

Patricia Tamariz– Baltimore, USA

A passionate, multitalented artist, who by constant reinvention is committed to offering ever evolving explorations of relevance and authenticity in her life, and through her work as an artist. She passionately seeks to contribute meaningfully to her students and the world.

Shamini Naidu – New Delhi, India

Shamini is a self taught artist who has focused primarily on acrylic paintings. She draws much of her inspiration from the spiritual teachings that she practices, and attempts to convey, through her work, the deeply intimate portraits of thoughts, feelings, and insights that permeate her being from those teachings.

Dana Lynne Andersen – Portland, USA / Assisi, Italy

Dana has taught and exhibited on three continents. Her paintings have been featured on the covers of books, magazines and calendars and her artwork, as well as her visionary thinking, have been featured in newspapers, radio and television.Dana is known as a loving and inspiring teacher, a ‘vesuvius of creativity’ and as “an important visionary for the consciousness community” (Robert Mc Dermottpresident emeritus of the California Institute of Integral Studies) 

Dana received her bachelor’s degree cum laude in philosophy from Colorado College, and her Master’s Degree in the Study of Consciousness from John F. Kennedy University.

To learn more about us, please visit:
https://www.facebook.com/Awakening-Arts-Italy-1539334989695305/?fref=ts

Clarity West - Manila, Philippines​

Clarity West is a trained filmmaker and artist having studied at the Art Institute of Vancouver and the Vancouver Film School, where she went on to train over 10 years in the film industry. She has facilitated painting workshop for kids and adults across the US and Philippines, where she currently resides. Her trainings include: art, spiritual counseling, healing and yoga and meditation. She currently teaches at yoga studios in Metro Manila.


How Can You Help?

Any and all financial donations will go directly to the cost of the certification program, split between all 4 students of this campaign.

All donations made are received with the utmost gratitude and respect, and in return we will be offering back to donor’s original artistic creations as the campaign progresses corresponding to specific donation amounts.
These beautiful and unique creations will range from paintings, to handbags, rings, and many other lovingly crafted items.

All incentive gifts will be listed under specific donation amounts and will be constantly updated as the campaign progresses. Please note that certain items are only available to people located in the same area as the artist, and shipping is not included.

In addition, a great way to help us make this dream a reality is to spread the word!

Share this campaign link with friends, family, and other passionate supporters of the arts and transformative work.


Thank You!!

The arts can be used as a powerful self exploratory tool, serving as a catalyst for personal, interpersonal, psychological, emotional, and spiritual growth, while at the same time remaining a simple, joyful expression of child-like wonder and playfulness.
With your help, we will be able to take effective action to bring these benefits to the lives of others, all around the world!
We are so very thankful for all your help and support.

story:
Chimpee™ was created to shake up a century old industry and introduce a better, more flexible product.  Traditional canvas prints are so…permanent.  Chimpee™ solves that by creating, well, a not-so-permanent canvas.  

Our patent-pending frame is wrapped using a specially treated magnetic canvas.  What makes Chimpee™ unique is the removable ChangeOut™ layer that is printed with your custom photo.  ChangeOuts can be removed and replaced with almost no effort.  As the name suggests, a user can simply change out the image they have on display at any time.

Life is a gallery, display it beautifully.










Interested in writing about us? Our press kit is available for download here. Also, please feel free to email us directly at hello@mychimpee.com or give us call at 888.MY.CHIMPEE.

Wait…what is Chimpee™?
Chimpee™ has completely transformed traditional canvas into an interchangeable system which contains a ChangeOut™ that magnetically attaches to the frame. A Chimpee™ frame is our patent-pending canvas wrapped frame with a magnetic base. The ChangeOut™ piece allows you to replace your custom image as often as you’d like without having to purchase expensive frames each time.  A Chimpee™ is the easiest, most beautiful and least expensive way to display your most recent memories on canvas.  There’s no other product like it.

What is a ChangeOut™?
A ChangeOut™ is our fancy name for the customized interchangeable print that magnetically attaches to the frame.  ChangeOuts are shipped in a compact mailing tube and are an inexpensive way of replacing your canvas graphic.  Just upload a photo at mychimpee.com and redeem a ChangeOut™ whenever the mood strikes.  When you receive your ChangeOut™, simply unroll it and place it over the frame.  The magnetic attraction locks the print in place and doesn’t let go.  Kind of like Angry Birds.

When will Chimpee™ be released?
Chimpee is currently scheduled to be released in “full production mode” by Spring 2017.  We will, however, offer an Early Adopter opportunity.  These lucky few will receive their Chimpee frames before the holidays in 2016. Check out our featured perk at the top of this page!

How is Chimpee™ different from other canvas prints?
Chimpee™ is not just different, its insanely different when compared to other canvas printing companies. With Chimpee™ users don't have the stress of committing to one photo, instead they can change out their images as often as they want all while preserving that look and feel we all love from a traditional canvas print.  Think of the trees our product will save over a lifetime.  It’s a lot.  Also think of the freedom you now have when ordering canvas prints, you’ll never be stuck with one image on your wall forever, change it out as often as you’d like…kind of like your underwear.  Now snap to it! 

How much does it cost?
While pricing has not been confirmed, we can tell you that Chimpee Starter Kits (which include 1 Frame and 1 ChangeOut) will be at, or below, the current retail price of high quality traditional canvas prints!  You get a better print, a better frame and the flexibility of Chimpee for less!  The best part is that the ChangeOuts will cost less than 1/4 of what traditional canvas prints currently retail for.  Amazing you say?  We think so too.

What sizes will you have available?
Chimpee will be available in 6 standard sizes. Rectangular frames have hanging hardware on 2 sides to give you the flexibility to change from portrait to landscape.

  • 12"x12"
  • 12"x18"
  • 16"x24"
  • 24"x24"
  • 24"x36"
  • 32"x48"

How does it work? (coming Spring 2017)

  1. Simply choose a Chimpee Package. The Starter Kit includes 1 frame and 1 ChangeOut™.  You have the option to add more ChangeOuts to redeem now or in the future.  The more you buy, the more you save.  Saving money is fun, so is shopping.  So by buying more and saving money, you’re actually multi-tasking! 
  2. Pick the frame size you want (remember all rectangular frames come with mounting hardware on both sides, so you can easily switch from landscape to portrait easily)
  3. When you’re ready to redeem one (or more) ChangeOuts, simply upload your cherished photos from your phone, computer, or social media accounts.  You can edit your photos (here you can change colors, lighting, add text and stickers, even overlays and memes) and submit to print.
  4. Finish up with your billing and shipping info and you’ll get your order in a few days!

I want to work at Chimpee™! Are you hiring?
Heck yeah!  We’re glad you asked!  We are always hiring and looking for the very best talent. Send your resume to jobs@mychimpee.com and put your name + specialty in the subject line and we’ll see where you fit!

How do I stay in touch with Chimpee™?
You can Facebook, text, email, call, visit us, write a letter, hit us up on Twitter, Instagram or even SnapChat us.  We'd love to hear from you!

Are your products eco-friendly?
When the wood used is sustainably sourced, the canvas is biodegradable, the ink used is nontoxic and the very use of the product reduces tree consumption exponentially, we’d say that would suffice for being eco-friendly.  Of course, we didn’t stop there, we’ve teamed up with charitable organizations to plant a tree for every frame sold!

Will my ChangeOut™ feel like canvas?
Not only will your ChangeOuts™ feel like canvas, they will also taste like canvas.  That’s because they are canvas! Our specially formulated canvas material is used on the frame and ChangeOut™ so everything looks perfect when it's put together.

What is the frame made out of?
If we told you we’d have to roll you up like our ChangeOut™ and put you in a storage tube.  What we can tell you is that our entire framing system is made from high quality wood that’s built to last with a mixture of canvas and magnets here and there that make it all work.  Your Chimpee™ frame is safe and lead free.

How easy is it to remove or put on my ChangeOut™? Do I need to take the frame down to do this?
First you take your thumb, then you take your forefinger, pinch the edge of the graphic and pull slightly.  Magically the ChangeOut™ comes right off the frame.  No tools, no muscle, no brains required, you don’t even need to take the frame down.  Its that easy.  To put it on, read this sentence in reverse. 

How do I hang a frame when I get it?
We thought long and hard about this, finding the most innovative and technologically savvy way to make this work.  We figured it out and are working with our lawyers on getting a patent.  We’ll let you in on our secret, it involves a hammer and a nail.  We supply the nail (in fact it’s a really good one, too).  You supply the hammer and the muscle.  Your frames even come with hangers attached to the back side to keep the frame flush to the wall when hanging. 

Do I get to choose whether I want a portrait or landscape frame?
All rectangular frames come with a hanger on each side, so you can switch from portrait to landscape without hurting your neck.  

Are there any other options I can purchase for my Chimpee™ frame?
Lets see, it comes with a frame…a custom ChangeOut™…a nail…hanging hardware on the back…bumpers to protect your wall…a storage tube for your ChangeOut™…

What else do you need?!?! :)

With Chimpee™ users don't have the stress of committing to one photo, instead they can change out their images as often as they want all while preserving that look and feel we all love from a traditional canvas print.  Think of the trees our product will save over a lifetime.  It’s a lot.  Also think of the freedom you now have when ordering canvas prints, you’ll never be stuck with one image on your wall forever, change it out as often as you’d like…kind of like your underwear.  Now snap to it! How much does it cost?While pricing has not been confirmed, we can tell you that Chimpee Starter Kits (which include 1 Frame and 1 ChangeOut) will be at, or below, the current retail price of high quality traditional canvas prints!  You get a better print, a better frame and the flexibility of Chimpee for less!  The best part is that the ChangeOuts will cost less than 1/4 of what traditional canvas prints currently retail for.  Amazing you say?  We think so too.What sizes will you have available?Chimpee will be available in 6 standard sizes. Rectangular frames have hanging hardware on 2 sides to give you the flexibility to change from portrait to landscape.
12"x12"

12"x18"

16"x24"

24"x24"

24"x36"

32"x48"
How does it work? (coming Spring 2017) 
Simply choose a Chimpee Package. The Starter Kit includes 1 frame and 1 ChangeOut™.  You have the option to add more ChangeOuts to redeem now or in the future.  The more you buy, the more you save.  Saving money is fun, so is shopping.  So by buying more and saving money, you’re actually multi-tasking! 

Pick the frame size you want (remember all rectangular frames come with mounting hardware on both sides, so you can easily switch from landscape to portrait easily)

When you’re ready to redeem one (or more) ChangeOuts, simply upload your cherished photos from your phone, computer, or social media accounts.  You can edit your photos (here you can change colors, lighting, add text and stickers, even overlays and memes) and submit to print.

Finish up with your billing and shipping info and you’ll get your order in a few days!

 I want to work at Chimpee™! Are you hiring?Heck yeah!  We’re glad you asked!  We are always hiring and looking for the very best talent. Send your resume to jobs@mychimpee.com and put your name + specialty in the subject line and we’ll see where you fit!
How do I stay in touch with Chimpee™?You can Facebook, text, email, call, visit us, write a letter, hit us up on Twitter, Instagram or even SnapChat us.  We'd love to hear from you!
Are your products eco-friendly?When the wood used is sustainably sourced, the canvas is biodegradable, the ink used is nontoxic and the very use of the product reduces tree consumption exponentially, we’d say that would suffice for being eco-friendly.  Of course, we didn’t stop there, we’ve teamed up with charitable organizations to plant a tree for every frame sold!
Will my ChangeOut™ feel like canvas?Not only will your ChangeOuts™ feel like canvas, they will also taste like canvas.  That’s because they are canvas! Our specially formulated canvas material is used on the frame and ChangeOut™ so everything looks perfect when it's put together.
What is the frame made out of?If we told you we’d have to roll you up like our ChangeOut™ and put you in a storage tube.  What we can tell you is that our entire framing system is made from high quality wood that’s built to last with a mixture of canvas and magnets here and there that make it all work.  Your Chimpee™ frame is safe and lead free.
How easy is it to remove or put on my ChangeOut™? Do I need to take the frame down to do this?First you take your thumb, then you take your forefinger, pinch the edge of the graphic and pull slightly.  Magically the ChangeOut™ comes right off the frame.  No tools, no muscle, no brains required, you don’t even need to take the frame down.  Its that easy.  To put it on, read this sentence in reverse.  
How do I hang a frame when I get it?We thought long and hard about this, finding the most innovative and technologically savvy way to make this work.  We figured it out and are working with our lawyers on getting a patent.  We’ll let you in on our secret, it involves a hammer and a nail.  We supply the nail (in fact it’s a really good one, too).  You supply the hammer and the muscle.  Your frames even come with hangers attached to the back side to keep the frame flush to the wall when hanging. 
Do I get to choose whether I want a portrait or landscape frame?All rectangular frames come with a hanger on each side, so you can switch from portrait to landscape without hurting your neck.  
 Are there any other options I can purchase for my Chimpee™ frame?Lets see, it comes with a frame…a custom ChangeOut™…a nail…hanging hardware on the back…bumpers to protect your wall…a storage tube for your ChangeOut™…
What else do you need?!?! :)

story:
Summary

I never imagined that a single tree could change my life or the lives of others.

I'm Mike Pach, and I'm a photographer from Colorado Springs. I am the founder of the Colorado Photography Learning Group, and I teach photography and Photoshop classes. I also volunteer for KCMJ 93.9 FM where I have 2 shows on Monday nights (The Photo Show and 3rd Groove).

On January 11th, 2015 a storm brought ice, snow and fog to Colorado Springs. The next day, I was drawn to a tree behind my home. I couldn't help but notice how beautiful it looked, covered in snow and ice, so I photographed it from my yard.

Later that day, the idea came to me of photographing the tree every day for a year. I set a goal for myself to create a unique image of this tree each day, and I reached that goal on January 11th 2016. All of those photos can be viewed on the Same Tree, Different Day blog.

What started out as an exercise in creativity ended up being much more than a collection of photographs. I realized that my story and the story of the tree could have a huge impact on people in communities everywhere. The method I used to reach my goal and the lessons I learned throughout this project have become just as important as the photographs themselves. Contributing to this campaign will allow me to bring this story to anyone in need of inspiration.

One tree and one year is what it took for me to find my voice. I want to share this experience with as many people as possible.

What I Need & What You Get

I will need $10,000 to frame and print the photos I want to have in a gallery display. This includes my favorite images from each month, large prints that contain all the photos from each month and a large mosaic made from all of the photos I took throughout the year. I was rather shocked when I crunched the numbers, but if you are a photographer or artist, you know that framing is expensive!

In exchange for your generous contributions, I will offer prints of any photo from this project. You get to choose any photo found on the Same Tree, Different Day blog. Perhaps you'd like the photo taken on your birthday, an anniversary or another special day in your life. Prints include free shipping within the United States. I will also offer one-on-one photography or Photoshop instruction if you are willing and able to come to beautiful Colorado Springs. 

Here is the breakdown of perks:

$50 = One 10"x 15" photo print
$100 = One 12"x 18" photo print
$150 = One 16"x 20" photo print
$250 = One 20"x 30" photo print
$500 = 4 hours of one-on-one photography or Photoshop instruction
$1000 = 8 hours of one-on-one photography or Photoshop instruction

If I do not reach my entire goal, I will still use the money to print and frame some photos, but the work will have to be done in stages. I will also look to get funding from grants through organizations like the Colorado Tree Coalition.

The Impact

As someone who deals with 3 disabling illnesses (fibromyalgia, depression and chemical sensitivities) I strongly believe that this project has the power to inspire others to achieve their goals and live lives full of awareness.

If one tree can have this much of an impact on me and those who become aware of this project and its lessons, imagine what 1,000 trees or 1,000,000 trees could do to change our world in a positive way.

Your contributions will help bring the messages of this project to more people and inspire others to create similar projects with their own positive messages.
This project and the slideshow I created with all of the photos from the year were debuted on April 15, 2016 during an Arbor Day event that I hosted at Library 21c in Colorado Springs. The event was a collaboration between myself, the Trails and Open Space Coalition, the Council of Neighbors and Organizations, the Colorado Springs Conservatory, the Therapeutic Recreation Program of Colorado Springs, the Pikes Peak Library Distrct and Jay Billup's Creative Magazine.

Here's what people had to say about the presentation:

"This was a wonderful evening. Very thought provoking and inspiring. Mike, your insights into your journey with this project were profound. Thank you for sharing it with us. I loved the quote you showed at the beginning of the program and will make a point to follow it each day and remind myself to be open and really see the beauty that is right in front of us. Thank you also to the emcee and the library and all those who helped make this presentation possible. Well worth the drive from Golden." Rosalyn

"Thank you Mike for sharing your voice and encouraging all of us to find ours. It was amazing to see all the various people and organizations you brought together for this project. There truly is beauty all around us in the people and places of our lives. Thank you for lifting up this simple truth in such a beautiful and artistic way :)" Jon Sargent - Seeing the presentation inspired Jon to write a blog post and a poem.

"I really enjoyed your presentation Mike. I too have Fibromyalgia and have gone through a process of learning to motivate myself and stay positive while living with a disability. Creativity and discipline have helped me a lot. Thank you for the inspiration." Ayomi Meadows

"Awesome presentation Mike! What a commitment - every day for a year. The project was inspirational but your journey was the best part. Thanks so much for sharing so much about yourself, this journey and the impact it had on you! It is evident! Congrats on such a great turnout!" Marti Harvey

"Beautiful evening - enjoyed by all. Thank you, Mike." Sandy V.

"Great presentation Mike! Love the story of your project and of the pictures! Thank you for the inspiration!" Sabine

"Fabulous presentation. Well thought out and appreciated by all who attended." Olin Jones

"Very cool project and well presented." James Van Hoy

"Outstanding presentation. Appreciated the honesty and sincerity with which you shared your story, Mike. And the emcee did a fine job as well. The library was a wonderful venue for the event, and it was nice that Sovereignty Wines and Bristol Brewing provided cocktails. Very nice event. Hope to attend more such things!" Brianne

"Excellent job Mike. That was a fantastic presentation!" Rick Randall

"All the kudos go to you for making such a wonderful event a reality. I loved the presentation, and we are thinking about how you can continue to show it to other groups. Great job, Mike." Eileen Healy, Trails and Open Space Coalition

"Mike, we enjoyed the event. You had a great turnout and excellent program. Here’s hoping you get the opportunity to share it widely." Susan Davies, Executive Director, Trails and Open Space Coalition

"What a great show! Congrats Mike, well done!" Laurel Prudhomme, Colorado Springs Downtown Parntership

"We enjoyed the evening, you deserved such a wonderful event. I hope good things come out of it for you." Tim Board, KCMJ Music Director

"Great work, Mike!"  Bobby Irwin, Cumulus Media

"Great job!" Jeff Cloutier, Godec's Photo Supply

The project has also been given some good press:

Image Resource

Sean Cayton's Blog on the Colorado Springs Independent

The Cheyenne Edition

The Woodmen Edition

Our Town with Sarada Connors (scroll to my segment on 4/9/16)

Jay Billup's Creative Magazine
Voices and Views

I have also appeared on The Culture Zone on KCME and My Mountain Country's Morning Show 107.3 FM.

Risks & Challenges

I have spoken to several local gallery owners and curators who would like to put my photos on display and share this project within the community. Without the funds to produce and frame the prints, I've had to decline their offers for now. I want to place myself in a position to accept any opportunity to show this work. One curator in a downtown gallery has an international show coming up this fall, and she wants to include some of my work. I can't say I'll participate unless I know I have the money to cover my costs.

I am a well-respected member of the local arts community, and these gallery owners are willing to be patient with me, however, they will continue to fill their exhibit schedules with other artists. The longer it takes to produce prints, the further behind I get placed in the waiting line.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute dollars, you can still help in the following ways:

  • Share this campaign with those who would be willing to support it financially. Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • You can support this campaign if you can contribute your printing or framing services.
  • Contact me if you belong to an organization that would be interested in having me lecture about this project and share what I've learned.
  • Contact me if you're a curator and would like to display images from this project in your art gallery. 
  • Contact me if you know of any grants available that I can apply for.

story:
Hello Darlings! Welcome to the Moxy Movement!

The Moxy Movement is a movement studio that offers various classes in Pole Fitness, Yoga, Lyra and various Dance for adults of all ages. We believe in the mind/body/spirit connection, and advocate for empowerment and expression through movement. We offer Massage Therapy and Structural Integration in house, as added catalysts to promote alignment and balance. We are passionate about the personal discovery that is a result of physical work and expression. 

With this studio, we aim to create a community of creatives and pioneers. Performance excellence, in the studio or on the stage, is something we strive for. We explore what that concept means, and search to find the unique gifts each person brings to a creative space. 

Safety and quality is of the upmost importance to us. With this campaign, we ask for funding to help us supply the space with the safest, highest quality grade equipment and support. We ask for the financial support to give us an initial stage to share with the world our community’s passions, talents, hard work and skills. 

And, we want to remind people of our overall mission - that expression through movement is something that anyone can benefit from. You do not need to be a dancer, or have certain experience with anything prior to this. Anyone can start in this endeavor of exploration, expression and discovery through movement. 

We invite you to please create the movement with us! 

#dare2move #moxymovement #moxymagic #livingroomsorcery #moxymonday

What We Need 

  • Poles -  We will be purchasing 8-10, 45mm poles and an equal number of mats from Lupit Pole Company http://www.lupitpole.com/ 
  • Lyras - Our lyras will be custom made for us by a local Salt Lake metal enthusiast.  We will purchase 2 single point, 2 double point, and 2 tabless lyras 
  • Rigging equipment
  • Yoga and meditation equipment - blocks, wheels, mats, straps, blankets and bolsters
  • Stall bars 
  • Mirrors 
  • Sound and lighting equipment
  • Paint 
  • Decorations and furnishings
  • Office equipment  

    Other Ways You Can Help

    As we build out the space, we need your help to spread the word. The movement is coming!!  

    Share with us your own moxy movement! We'd love to gather videos, photos, and stories of how movement has impacted your life. Tag us on Instagram, Facebook, or send us an email at info@moxymovement.com.  

    #dare2move #moxymovement #moxymagic #livingroomsorcery #moxymonday

story:
My Story

I am a independent author. I have been writing for as long as I can remember. It has always been about love. It has always been about someone finding their way to it on a path very unique to them. This book follows that formula. It differs because this is not about two people destined to be together stopped by fate. It is two people who don't know if they belong together, deciding if they do.

It took me over a year to write this labor of love. Now I need to share it with the world. The Harlem Book Fair is the perfect place to do it. A book written by an African-American woman, about an African-American woman and her struggle to find the kind of love she's always wanted.

What's Needed & What You Get

The Harlem Book Fair 2016 is an amazing opportunity for me. I need funds for:

  • The entrance fee
  • Travel expenses
  • Purchase books to sell

What you could win:

Three levels for Angel Donors

  • Level One $100 you will receive a personalized signed copy of the book.
  • Level Two $200 you will receive a personally signed copy and an invitation to a reception with me, the author, upon my return.
  • Level Three $500 you will get to travel with me to the Book Fair and take in all that is the Harlem Book Fair!

If I don’t reach my entire goal, funds will go toward a book signing in Charlottesville, Virginia or Washington, D.C. later in the summer.

Your Impact

As you know it's hard to be an independent artist. Without a huge machine behind you creating buzz and marketing campaigns, it's hard to get your work noticed on a level that can sustain you. Your contribution will:

  • Help me increase the visibility of this book and my other works.
  • After a successful run at Capital Fringe in 2014 with my play Desire Moments, I'm stepping to a bigger stage.
  • Your contribution, no matter the size, can put Book Ends, and me, on the map.
It's never easy to be a working artist. Our brains aren't geared towards business sense, so it's hard for us to make that transition and demand monetary gain. I'm no different. It's taken me a long time to realize how much my art is worth, and even longer to ask for it. After being unemployed for almost four years, my savings is destroyed, and I'm starting from ground zero.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, you can still help.

  • Forward the campaign to your contacts. The more people that know, the more possible my goal becomes.
  •  Indiegogo makes it easy to share!

Thank you so much!

story:
WHO WE ARE

See What Sticks is a free, monthly workshop with an audience where artists of all disciplines can  present work at any stage in a blackbox theater. We offer the stakes of a deadline, the legitimacy of an audience, and the collaborative freedom of a workshop environment.

 

As we enter our second year, we would love your support to keep renting our theaters at the Complex Hollywood, pay for extra features like microphones, music stands, projectors and more, and to keep our workshops free to the public! 

 

OUR GOAL

We are trying to raise $1000! This campaign will help fund the future of See What Sticks.

 

Thank you!

We offer the stakes of a deadline, the legitimacy of an audience, and the collaborative freedom of a workshop environment. As we enter our second year, we would love your support to keep renting our theaters at the Complex Hollywood, pay for extra features like microphones, music stands, projectors and more, and to keep our workshops free to the public!  OUR GOALWe are trying to raise $1000! This campaign will help fund the future of See What Sticks. Thank you!

story:
Whimsikids was born out of the desire to make every child feel valued, knowing that their ideas & creativity matters & that their unique individuality is so important in this crazy world. It is a safe place for people of all ages to come dream & create whatever is in their heads with the provided materials. In a world where individuality & creativity get lost along the path of growing up- we hope to equip, encourage, & empower each child to keep their unique spark of creativity. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for a base of $10,000 for the start up of our first of (hopefully) many locations! The graphic below will explain in more detail where your dollars will be going.


We have a few levels of perks available to our backers. There will be a limited number of rewards & each will be either hand-crafted or exclusive to this fundraiser.  These perks will not be available to the general public after this fundraiser ends. 

We're believing that with your help we will reach the full goal- BUT if we don't make it... the money will be stretched but still used in the best way possible!

The Impact

By supporting Whimsikids you are impacting the next generation of creatives both now & in the future. By giving to this start up you are saying that individual creativity is important to you, regardless of the person's background or ability. Each child deserves the freedom to dream & create- by giving & spreading the word you will help in making this a reality! 

Risks & Challenges

The only risk we foresee is that of unmet expectations when it comes to opening our doors to the public. If we do not receive the entire amount, Whimsikids will still open- it just may be later than the projected timeline. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that not everyone will be able to make a monetary contribution. We still appreciate you so much for stopping in & learning about Whimsikids. We would LOVE for you to share the vision & fundraiser on all of your social media platforms. You never know who you know (that we don't yet) that may be in need of finding Whimsikids (& us finding them).

THANK YOU x A MILLION! YOUR SUPPORT MEANS MORE THAN YOU KNOW!

story:
Preface:  The Perks

We urge you to choose the most appropriate perk for your support for this interdisciplinary art project space. We acknowledge that it may be a little confusing if you want two rewards in a perk at the same time. Just to let you know, you can choose more than one perk to increase your support and your rewards as well. We thank you in advance for your contribution towards making Vernacular Art Laboratory a reality, not a fantasy.


VERNACULAR ART LABORATORY IS AN INTERDISCIPLINARY ART SPACE FOR CONTEMPORARY ARTISTS IN AFRICA AND INTERNATIONAL ARTISTS

Vernacular Art Laboratory – (VAL, Lagos) is a non-profit artist initiative, founded in 2015 in Lagos as a space where artists cohabit to exchange ideas and co-create works with uncommon flair. As a non-commercial art space, the collaboration of contemporary artists with literary artists is our main focus.

Our space is located in one of the biggest slums in Lagos - Onisemo Village, Sogunro community in Iwaya, which shares its border with Makoko Community on the Waterfront that overlooks the 3rd Mainland Bridge. Our educational plans includes art programmes for youths, artist seminars, workshops, and community partnerships with schools as well as collaborations with other arts organisations both in Nigeria and abroad. 

THE SPACE IS A PIECE OF LAND: 30 FEET BY 60 FEET = 9. 144 METERS BY 18.288 METERS

The space is presently being cleared for construction work to begin. We anticipate commencement of projects and programmes hopefully in February 2016, but we can only achieve this with your support.

Your generous contribution will be used to pay for materials and labour to:

Build a storey wooding-structure and storage areas
Build a Standard Gallery Space 
Build an Audio-Visual Studio space (without equipment)
Build conducive rooms for our Artist In Residence projects
Build a moderate Library
Build walls to enclose the working area.
Build our Website
Add soundproofing to work areas.


DO WE STILL EXPECT YOU TO DONATE EVEN AFTER WE REACH OUR $15,000 TARGET?

SURE!  It will help to buy equipment and other materials needed for the centre. The fund we seek here can only see us through the building of Vernacular Art Laboratory. We also have plans for two major digital studios: Sound Studio and Video Studio. We also plan to have an Audio-Visual Library. Sure, any extra support on the top of our campaign will help us a great deal.

YOU WANT TO HELP OUR CAUSE BUT ARE NOT FINANCIALLY BUOYANT AND YOU CARE TO HELP?

Please help SPREAD our news!  Post on your Facebook, Tweet about it, or take a picture and post it on your Instagram page. The more individual donors we get, the more likely it is Indiegogo will publicize our campaign...which will lead to a bigger audience and more money-- so even a five dollar donation will help us! Also, you can create a signpost and stand on a street corner and be a sign spinner.  Your support is appreciated!

story:
La vélotente :

Quel vélocycliste n'a jamais contemplé tout son matériel de camping sur le sol, après une épuisante route faite de kilomètres d'érintantes côtes, décôtes et cahots, tout en se disant intérieurement : «attends....je suis raqué de partout, et maintenant faut vraiment que je monte ma tente, que j'installe les sacs de couchage et que je fasse la cuisine ?», puis de croiser le regard résigné de sa compagne de voyage semblant dire «allez, courage plus vite on commence plus vite on se mettra au lit...».

Pareillement, quel campeur peut dire qu'il n'a jamais étiré la grasse matinée du lendemain, abattu à l'avance de devoir tout replier, ranger, rempaquetter ?!

Avec la vélotente ce cauchemar n'est plus !

Imagine une remorque à vélo contenant une tente toute repliable et des rangements pour que tout reste à sa place en tout temps !

Pas de piquets, pas d'armatures à enfiler dans un ordre défiant la logique du plus tordu des meubles en kit...

Déplie en 3 étapes, replies sans rouler tes sacs de couchage....installe-toi n'importe où, et paye toi le luxe de ne plus avoir besoin de te déplacer avec ton fier rouleau de papier toiliette au plus proche bloc sanitaire (situé en général à 2km de ton emplacement de camping...true story)!

Mais comment ça se fait que personne avant n'a eu cette idée, franchement !

J'ai besoin de vous pour construire un prototype d'ici la fin de l'été, ensuite je ferai un prériple d'essai pour voir si ça va bien....ensuite peut-être que dans un futur plus ou moins lointain, la vélotente sera disponible dans tous les bons Canadian tire !

Risques et défis :

Pour l'instant il s'agit de construire un prototype, afin de voir les défauts, et les améliorations possibles...pour cela d'ailleurs je requiers également votre aide, sous forme de commentaires, suggestions, idées, etc.

Le défi principal est le poids, et de jouer avec le compromis confort sur la route / confort pendant les stations. Le voyage d'essai permettra de mettre en lumière ce point !

Conclusion :

Allez, les gens, la vélotente n'attend que votre coup de pouce pour voir le jour ! (sans compter les somptueuses récompenses que je vous ai concoctées...)

À bientôt sur les pistes cyclables !

;-)

story:
Bee and  I would like to introduce you to the world of Body Artistry. I love this form of art because it is so momentary. You can not frame it or hang it on you'r wall. It's there , It's beautiful - and then you wash it all off. 

If I get to Austria, I would be the second South African to enter the World Body Painting festival EVER. 

This where we need you'r help, we need between R30,000-R50,000 to make it to Austria. This would cover Flights, accommodation,paints and props.

As a Thank You we will be giving unique hair accessories,Make - Up vouchers and 3 Indigo Child Tracks in exchange for pledges. 

Thank you for helping us to make beautiful momentary art

story:
We travel currently Turkey, Georgia and Iran and the whole trip is based on hitchhiking, couchsurfing and the contact with people.

Our experiences should be made visible in a MAGAZINE.

This magazine includes travel experiences, tips and tricks for travel out of comfort zone, insider infos from the countries etc. Presented with images, photography, illustrations, poems and thought we have on our travels.

We want to open the eyes from others and inspire the people in the different cultures. In our opinion traveling is changing your mind all the time and we want to share this with others.

With this project we want to support people that dream of traveling but have not made this step so far. And also to support locals and those we met on out trips.

story:
hi,

     thanks to everyone who has supported The Sixth Son over the past couple years*  I've been working to capture documentary footage of my creative life while recording my upcoming full-length on Records Ad Nauseam, & I recently brought my camera equipment with me to document my first tour of Europe.  very unfortunately, my camera-bag got lost in the transit back to Los Angeles, & despite my efforts to recover the equipment, it remains lost.  I have created this campaign to help recoup the cost of that gear.

     the financial goal of this campaign is $1200 which accounts for the contents of the camera-bag:

  • Nikon D5100 value pack $600
  • ZOOM H4N (2) $400
  • DeadCat windscreen (2) $100
  • 32 GB SD Cards (3) $100

     I have really enjoyed documenting the process of recording & touring because I have been looking forward to sharing this footage with all of you.  in the past I had thought about reaching out to ask for a bit of help with bringing the album into the world, but I ultimately elected to take the slower, quieter road of financing the album myself.  however, now & again life gives us some unexpected twists and it takes a bit of help to make it through.  I have been putting all of my resources into making this album, & so once again I am brought back to asking you for this help.

     financial contributions would be so wonderful, but there are all sorts of ways to help with this campaign other than financially.  spreading the word to others who might be in a better place to help a young artist would be fantastic.  cheering me on would make me feel good too, so don't be shy*   around here you'll see the list of rewards I have to offer in return for your benevolence. :)  this is a very exciting time for me & I can't wait to share what I've been working on with all of you.  thank you very, very much.  see you out there soon~

--NM

story:
Hello everyone! GOT FRAMED is exciting and playful art installation we can bring to Burning Man this year! Picture this - an 12ft tall picture-frame for people to dress up with their friends and play in while someone captures the moment from outside. Swing and hang from monkey bars across the top, climb up the side ladders and jump in the center! Snap a pic from outside and the moment lives as a souvenir forever. The highly interactive design promotes community participation, encouraging PEOPLE to BE THE ART. Inspired by my Grandmother, whose 91 years have been spent living in the moment, Got Framed invites you to do the same!

  • Got Framed Prototype & 2D Plans
  • Got Framed Concept on the playa

What’s more, the unfinished walls inside of the frame allows people to write a message, leave a signature or share their favorite memory for others to enjoy reading. Bringing community together is the idea that fuels this project. By contributing to Got Framed, you will add life to the city, inspire creativity, self expression and allow people to snap a pic and keep that moment forever. The initial vision for Got Framed occurred to me while driving back from Burning Man in 2013. 

The idea spurred from the thought of my addiction to taking pictures but never framing them. The act of framing a memory adds another level of significance to it. Take a second to think of a moment in time that you feel deserves to be framed, whether in your past or present. Got Framed provides the opportunity to frame these memories, while truly appreciating and enjoying the present! We live in a society where we often forget to live in the moment. Got Framed brings us back to the pure joy of now, connecting us with friends, family, and strangers to cherish this moment with or without a camera. I need your help to create this inspiring piece of art! Once Burning Man is complete, I will bring itback to Los Angeles for you and the entire community to enjoy! The funding will cover all tools, materials, professional labor and consulting, space rentals for building and transportation. From someone who chooses to celebrate his birthday volunteering (for 6 years in a row) and invites friends to join, there are additional ways for you to help and get involved! Please feel free to approach me, sign up on our VOLUNTEER list and have fun with us!

My name is NiNO, I was born and raised in Puerto Rico. Attracted to American culture via TV, I had to figure out a way to move. I joined an exchange program my sophomore year and transferred to IPFW in IN where I finished my B.A. in Graphic Design, with a minor in Performing Arts. After graduation I moved to LA. In the last 10 years, I've been art directing and set designing for stage, film & TV, including a team member of the Design Producer Crew for NBC's reality show American Dream Builders. Recently I had an awakening and a change of path of wanting to pursue my talent as an artist again. It started with painting a nursery mural as a gift tofriends. After that, I created several more murals. I found myself feeling a different satisfaction for big canvases and enjoying the freedom to imagine in a bigger scale. 

  • Black light mural: Just In Time To Fly

Most recently, I was part of the art team for Carlson Arts LLC to install the permanent Pae White’s art installation “Woven Walk” at the Los Angeles Tom Bradley International Airpot Terminal. (LAX)

  • South corridor at LAX

Currently, I'm art mentoring and professing at Academia Avance in Highland Park, Los Angeles with the wonderful non-profit organization; Ruckus Roots. Bringing creativity to schools without art in their curriculum. Empowering inner-city 8th and 9th graders through art.

  • Art mentoring for the Art Installation Project that will be placed in the LA River area.

Utilizing my TV/Film set design, art direction and production background as well as a talented network of experienced builders, Got Framed would be made of recycled/reclaimed materials with baroque style and rose motif. It would include a stage foundation with short ladders on either side. The participant could be inside the frame at all times. It is designed to be approximately 11' high x 14’ wide x 2' deep.

The possibility of a creation that brings my community together is what I’m most attracted to about this project. To be part of the city, to provoke a conversation, to stimulate brain cells to not just have an opinion, but better yet, to inspire others to continue creating and dreaming big. That would be my ultimate goal.

  • Friends Volunteering at the Farm Sanctuary - My Birthday Celebration 2013

The exterior frame design is inspired by my Abuela, Rosamelia, in Puerto Rico who turns 91 last year. Baroque style, gold/bronze, beveled frame, 91 roses for Rosamelia, identical on either side, with small cutouts arounnd the detail for light distribution. If you like to see the fun video we created for her birthday, here is my gift to her with the kind help for my sweet friends:

  • Friends Volunteering on video for My Grandma's 90th - My Birthday Celebration 2014

This piece is an opportunity to acknowledge the incredible support that I am so grateful to have had growing up and to pass it on. To inspire self expression...to call up the performer, the artist, the brown sheep and the nut. I imagine the joy and laughter that will happen as a result of Got Framed to be a mirror of my Grandma's gifts to us.

  • Yes, this is my Grandma!

Gracias very much for your consideration and support.

Forever grateful, 

NiNO & the Fabulous "Got Framed" Build Team

possibility of a creation that brings my community together is what I’m most
attracted to about this project. To be part of the city, to provoke a
conversation, to stimulate brain cells to not just have an opinion, but better
yet, to inspire others to continue creating and dreaming big. That would be my
ultimate goal.

Friends Volunteering at the Farm Sanctuary - My Birthday Celebration 2013


The exterior frame design is inspired by my Abuela,
Rosamelia, in Puerto Rico who turns 91 last year. Baroque style, gold/bronze,
beveled frame, 91 roses for Rosamelia, identical on either side, with small
cutouts arounnd the detail for light distribution. If you like to see the fun
video we created for her birthday, here is my gift to her with the kind help
for my sweet friends:

Friends Volunteering on video for My Grandma's 90th - My Birthday Celebration 2014
This piece is an opportunity to acknowledge the incredible support that I am so grateful to have had growing up and to pass it on. To inspire self expression...to call up the performer, the artist, the brown sheep and the nut. I imagine the joy and laughter that will happen as a result of Got Framed to be a mirror of my Grandma's gifts to us.Yes, this is my Grandma!
Gracias very much for your consideration and support.Forever grateful, 
NiNO & the
Fabulous "Got Framed" Build Team

story:
The Shakespeare Series as conceived by Actor, Writer, Director and Producer, Gregory Mikell, is a non-profit effort derived out of Gregory's newly found passioin of the bard more than 15 years prior. "Its the language and the poetry that awakens the romantic in me that I'm driven to share."

Shakespeare, an artist and rebel in his time and even ours is still the platform upon which many give voices of resistance to politicians, wars, economic disparity, and we must preserve and pass along this legacy of learning to our youth, all youth, no matter what the class, creed, race, gender, religion. Shakespeare and his peers, Moliere, Wordsworth, Chekhov, they all left us a legacy of learning through their words.

story:
Cerulean Arts

Cultivating an appreciation for art by presenting exhibitions, offering unique decorative and fine art for sale and providing art instruction for personal fulfillment. 

We love art.  It’s at the core of our lives.  Art has the power transform your life.  It transcends class, education, income level, and bridges geographic and language barriers.  Art is what makes us human.  We share our passion for art through our gallery, Cerulean Arts.

Our Vision

Cerulean Arts opened on September 15, 2006 in a renovated storefront at 1355 Ridge Avenue, Philadelphia.  Needless to say, opening an art gallery in a transitional neighborhood right before the economic crash wasn’t the best timing.  But we believed in what we were doing and persevered. 

From the start we knew we wanted Cerulean Arts to be more than a traditional commercial gallery.  We wanted to create a warm, inviting place where all people feel welcome.  Offering something for everyone, Cerulean Arts provides an engaging experience for both our artists and customers – one that keeps them coming back for more!

Our Campaign

Over the last nine years, Cerulean Arts has become an art destination, attracting visitors throughout the city and beyond.  We have produced over 75 exhibitions, displaying the drawings, paintings, sculptures and original prints of hundreds of artists.   

Our impact, however, is limited by our gallery’s size – not quite 600 square feet.  When the adjacent property became available, we jumped at the opportunity with the future in mind.   Our neighborhood is now experiencing a surge of development, a true revival.  Now is the perfect time for Cerulean Arts to expand! 

Our plan includes building additional gallery spaces for exhibiting art and a classroom on the first floor plus six artists’ live/work studios on the second and third floors. 

With our expansion, we will create a dynamic arts community with artists living, working, exhibiting, teaching, learning and interacting with our customers from the surrounding neighborhood and beyond.

What We Need

The building is basically a shell waiting to be transformed.  This means all new electrical, mechanical, plumbing and sprinkler system in addition to the new walls, windows and stairs.  Most of the cost for our expansion will come from a small business loan.  While we can borrow up to 90% of the costs, we must provide the rest ourselves.   We have some savings,  but we still need $35,000 which we hope to raise through this campaign. 

What you Get

We know that we wouldn't be where we are without all our supporters!  It's really amazing how many people we've met over the last nine years who have cheered us on.  We have a few perks lined up to show our appreciation - take a look!

Any contribution would be so greatly appreciated - every dollar truly counts!  But even if you are unable to make a pledge, you can still help.  Please tell your friends, family and colleagues - through the power of crowd funding, we have a chance to reach our goal.  Thank you so much!  Tina & Mike

story:
Aloha!

Hello everyone, Ben Revord here! I'm an independent artist from Pittsfield, Massachusetts. I'm in the process of re-booting my business in the state of Hawaii. Recently, I transplanted from the bay area of California, to Kailua, Oahu. I own and operate a 40 Watt Full Spectrum Laser Engraver/Cutter/Etcher, and am equipped to take on a large variety of projects. I've been in operations since February of 2014, but have only been able to casually make and sell my creations. Initially, I was an artist with only a pencil, paper, and drafting tools. Now I am striving toward the bright horizons of graphic design, precision pyrography, and the commodification of my arts. I have a developing focus of working with eco-friendly, sustainable, green, rescued, and/or recycled materials. My dream is to be able to lean fully on my arts as a source of income and inspiration for others. I've gotten my feet wet in the vending circuit over the years and want nothing more than to dive in deep. But first I need stock/inventory/materials.


Here Are Some Examples Of My Work:

           

    

Check out this Facebook page for more of my artistry: https://www.facebook.com/REVisionLaserArtist?ref=hl

I have begun working with WorthyLLC, which is an Eco-sustainable clothing and apparel company that is just about to launch itself:  https://www.facebook.com/Worthyllc


However, Oy!

I have exhausted my personal resources and monetary cushion, and have few connections here on the island. With your help, even the smallest of contributions will propel me toward my goal. As we all know, it can take money to make money; and having little to none can really be a struggle. Any contribution will aid me in an almost limitless way. 


How you're helping me:

Once I have more funds to work with I can: 
A. Register my business as an LLC in the state of Hawaii
B. Purchase materials to work with to turn personal profit
C. Put food in my belly
D. Rent a studio to live and work out of
E. Launch a website for my business
F. Have more time to create 
G. Get my arts into retailer locations
H. Help pay for vending fees and insurance at markets and fairs
I. Legally protect myself, my business, and my arts

The Impact

With success in this campaign, I can propel myself into the grand market place and tourism within Hawaii. You've heard the saying "Its a small world", well here in Hawaii it can be even smaller, and harder to find quality and originality in products as a consumer. With the capabilities of my machine, anything is a blank canvas, and I can bring a whole new level of customization to every day items. Aside from customization, I can work with a wide variety of recycled/rescued materials: leather, fabric, wood, paper, cork, plastic, acrylic, glass, mirrors, metal, stone, rubber, and other natural materials. The detail and precision of this machine, is impeccable! With art made from and with sustainably sourced materials, I will turn the heads of many. I hope to teach and encourage others to use the resources and materials we have at hand, to respect the Earth, and reduce our ecological footprints. 

I have loads of creative ideas on the back burners, and blossoming relationships with other like minded, eco-friendly, artists, carpenters, clothing designers, apparel makers, and home decorators. Together we can all turn on the rest to a cleaner and safer future for us all.

story:
About Lawrence

I am Lawrence Koh Choon Teck. I am the author and illustrator of the book, Growing Up with Lee Kuan Yew (GUWLKY).

 

I came from a disadvantaged family background and nearly ended up on the other side of the law when I was young. My mother's love for me made me resolve to turn into a new leaf. As you may not have known, I failed my 'O' levels twice. However, along the way, many people from all walks of life helped me, including recognizing my strength in art as well as supporting and encouraging me to pursue my Master of Fine Art in Animation and publish my book GUWLKY.

Without their support, I won't be who I am now. I am working with Josef Lee of Mojo Studio and PowerQ Consulting on a short SG50 animation film funded by SG50 Celebration Fund. I am a full time lecturer teaching 3D Interactive Media Technology at a polytechnic and recently my book "Growing Up with Lee Kuan Yew (second edition)" had received the first prize in Popular Reader’s Choice Competition.

 

Why I want to do a 10 min animation?

Honestly, I had the dream to turn my book into animation since the 1st edition GUWLKY was published in 2000 after I graduated from NAFA. I shared with many people. Many laughed. Some shook their heads and said it was very expensive and impossible. Then I knew nothing about animation.

I went around talking to different studios and publishers to ask if they were interested. I received no positive reply. It was just a wild dream then.

Subsequently, I decided to pursue a degree in animation on scholarship. After I completed my master in animation in 2007, I started to ask for support, be it sponsorship or grant/funding in my animation project again. As you may have guessed, there were no positive replies again.

Opportunities knocked, but in a different way. I decided to write and illustrate the second edition of "Growing up with Lee Kuan Yew" in 2013. This second edition was well received and became the bestseller. This motivated me to apply for the SG50 Celebration Fund. This time round, I received its approval. While SG50 Celebration Fund supported me with 50% of my project expenditure, I am going to raise the remaining 50% of the remaining project expenditure.

 

Why on Nation Building?

I was on a scholarship to pursue my degree in animation in US. I was almost gunned down then while I was moonlighting as a street artist at Savannah River to make ends meet. Hence, I do appreciate the safety in Singapore. I appreciate the affordable enrichment classes, piano class, violin class, swimming class, Taekwondo class that my 7 years old daughter and 5 years old son are having. I do not own a car but appreciate that I just need to wait for 2 minutes for our MRT train though I feel it is as packed as Japan and we should learn more train etiquette.

I wish the young generation like my kids to remember the contributions of our pioneer generation in transforming Singapore from a fishing village to a modern city, giving us what we have now.

I want to give back as much as I can what Singapore has given me.

I want to be proud of my country.



 

How the Fund is Allocated?

Total Project Expenditure: USD30,000

Animation Production: 62%

Outreach Campaign: 38%

 

How Much Fund Has Been Achieved?

50% of the project expenditure is supported by SG50 Celebration Fund while I hope to raise the remaining 50% through crowd-funding campaigns.

For the excess fund raised through this crowd funding campaign after my project expenditure is met, I will donate this excess amount to other SG50 projects that require fund support. Full allocation details of fund raised through the campaign will be reported and can be accessed by the public.

 

Final words

It took me 2 years for my 1st edition of GUWLKY to be published and we sold about 7000 copies in Singapore in 2 years.

14 years later, It took me 1 year to publish the 2nd edition of GUWLKY and we sold 10 000 copies in 6 months in Singapore and Malaysia.

It took my 14 years to get very close to my next 'crazy' dream to produce an animation on Nation Building for Singapore.



 

My dream can only come true with your support in this fundraising campaign.

From my heart - thank you very much. 非常感谢. Terima Kasih.  बहुतबहुतधन्यवाद. どうもありがとうございました.

 


For more information, media & press inquiries, interviews, or sponsorship opportunities, and partnerships, please contact me at lawrencekoh2014@gmail.com.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Nikolai Berrones, and I am a 24 year old artist and the founder and co-editor of Nikolaos Magazine. I have recently been gifted the chance to travel around the world and it is my wish to turn this opportunity into my best, and most ambitious project yet:

  • In each city that I visit, I will be creating a zine (mini magazine) about that city, and at the end of my trip I will be editing and compiling all of these zines into a "MEGA-ZINE", whith each city-zine becoming it's own chapter. 
  • Each zine will feature all original artwork, writing, and photography by myself, and people that I meet along the way. 
  • Topics will range from food, architecture, and culture, to nightlife, music, and interactions with the locals. If it can be experienced, it will be drawn, photographed, and written about.
  • I will also be attempting to dive into the music scenes of each city, and bring back at least a song or two from each one, to be compiled into a "World Music" compilation that comes with the "Mega-zine".
The result will be the "Nikolaos World Tour", a book/cd package between 50-100  pages, in full color, detailing and showing the entire experience as it happened.

The Plan So Far...

My journey starts on March 1st, when I land in Taipei. There, I will be staying with the co-editor of Nikolaos Magazine, Kelly Miles, and her father Lynn, who has been living and working in Taipei as a human rights activist for many years (should be a massively interesting way to begin the story). Then, on March 14th, I head to  Amsterdam, where I have ever-so-luckily secured a flat courtesy of my uncle (who I won't name yet, as he is a customs agent, and I want to get a story out of him for the book). This is where my assured plans end...

  • The tentative plan is to travel from Amsterdam through Belgium, into Germany, down to Switzerland, further south and through Italy to Greece, up and around through France and into Spain, and then into Morocco where I will either find the perfect ending to my book, or decide to continue on to...
  • I am getting my bar tending license and I am also looking into au pairing (being a live-in manny) in Morocco, Spain, or London, which would happen after a Morocco zine is made, and provide me with a stable place to do my editing and production, as well as provide a little bonus material in the form of a au pair or bar tender experience-based zine. 
  • I will be updating everyone on the process at nikolaosmagazine.tumblr.com, which is also where those who are receiving perks will get to preview and choose which options they want to go with in their respective bundles.

Your Impact

As stated earlier, my flight to Taiwan/Amsterdam was a surprise Christmas gift from my good friend Damien. Because it was such a shock, and is coming up so soon, I have very little time to save up for the many expenses that are coming. Here are a few of the ways your donation will help create the best product I possibly can, which is my minimum goal.

  • Help pay for train and bus tickets to get to more cities to make more chapters.
  • Lengthen my stay in each city and keep the experiences interesting.
  • Provide film for my cameras, which are all analog. 
  • Increase the production value of the final product by increasing the quality of paper, printing and binding services. 

Challenges

Rest assured, I will be doing everything in my power to keep the costs low, and the adventure interesting, so that the effectiveness of your donations are maximized. This includes, but is not limited to:

  • Staying in the free-est and/or cheapest possible, but still relatively safe couches, hostels, and Airbnb's.
  • Eating and drinking frugally, unless there is reason to splurge for the cause of experiencing the culture and/or providing content for the zine. 
  • Finding everything from odd jobs to au pairing to keep the money flowing and the adventure going and the book growing. 

I'm going to be completely honest with you...

This project is as much about...

  • fully realizing my writing and artistic style as it is about... 
  • producing the best possible product for others to enjoy as it is about...
  • creating an undeniable portfolio for when I get home and need to re-join the world as it is about...
  • raising money prolong and intensify the adventure I have always dreamt about.

So there are a couple of selfish reasons in there, sure, but each one of these goals only serves to increase the effort of realizing the others, and I have no doubt in my mind that the growth seen in me from the first page to the last will be just as interesting to see as any drawing, photograph, or story found within. 


Other Ways to Help

No one understands better than I do right now that sometimes you just can't part with a dollar. If this is the case, hopefully you can be of other assistance...

  • If you know of anyone in Europe that would be willing to let me stay at their place for free/cheap/cleaning services, regardless of where they are, or what the sleeping arrangement is, I would love to add another stop to my journey.
  • Help me get the word out and I'll definitely remember it when it comes time to sell the final product.
  • If you have been to any of these places and have recommendations, I would love to hear them, or if there is somewhere you think I absolutely must visit, let me know and let me know why.
