I will be updating everyone on the process at nikolaosmagazine.tumblr.com, which is also where those who are receiving perks will get to preview and choose which options they want to go with in their respective bundles.

   Your Impact As stated earlier, my flight to Taiwan/Amsterdam was a surprise Christmas gift from my good friend Damien. Because it was such a shock, and is coming up so soon, I have very little time to save up for the many expenses that are coming. Here are a few of the ways your donation will help create the best product I possibly can, which is my minimum goal.  Help pay for train and bus tickets to get to more cities to make more chapters.
Lengthen my stay in each city and keep the experiences interesting. Provide film for my cameras, which are all analog.  Increase the production value of the final product by increasing the quality of paper, printing and binding services.  
   Challenges Rest assured, I will be doing everything in my power to keep the costs low, and the adventure interesting, so that the effectiveness of your donations are maximized. This includes, but is not limited to:  Staying in the free-est and/or cheapest possible, but still relatively safe couches, hostels, and Airbnb's.
Eating and drinking frugally, unless there is reason to splurge for the cause of experiencing the culture and/or providing content for the zine. 
Finding everything from odd jobs to au pairing to keep the money flowing and the adventure going and the book growing. 


I'm going to be completely honest with you...
This project is as much about...



fully realizing my writing and artistic style as it is about... 


producing the best possible product for others to enjoy as it is about...


creating an undeniable portfolio for when I get home and need to re-join the world as it is about...

raising money prolong and intensify the adventure I have always dreamt about.
So there are a couple of selfish reasons in there, sure, but each one of these goals only serves to increase the effort of realizing the others, and I have no doubt in my mind that the growth seen in me from the first page to the last will be just as interesting to see as any drawing, photograph, or story found within. 
   Other Ways to Help
No one understands better than I do right now that sometimes you just can't part with a dollar. If this is the case, hopefully you can be of other assistance...  If you know of anyone in Europe that would be willing to let me stay at their place for free/cheap/cleaning services, regardless of where they are, or what the sleeping arrangement is, I would love to add another stop to my journey.

Help me get the word out and I'll definitely remember it when it comes time to sell the final product.

If you have been to any of these places and have recommendations, I would love to hear them, or if there is somewhere you think I absolutely must visit, let me know and let me know why.

story:
What is it like to be an artist without an outlet? 

Hi, my name is Ashley. I attended Michigan State University and changed my major a million times during the process of pursing a degree. I always wanted to achieve something big, so I dabbled in various subjects. I have many interest and hobbies. 

I once thought I would create the first agriculture education mobile application, and I did. Currently the content of the app is empty. Maybe from an artistic stand point I felt like the mobile app would not be used by youth in city's also known as food desserts. 

Urban Organicz: http://tiny.cc/aapuo

My dream is to be a well known Hip Hop Artist, and after promoting my first album, reach out to youth in communities aka Food Desserts and speak to youth about careers, health and opportunities in Agriculture. As you may know, Agriculture is a lesser known subject to be discussed, let alone pursued by youth in City's. 

My goal is to have fun being who I am  (An Artist) and also make a difference in my spare time. My dream is cynical but, Id like to create music that is industry standard and give back to the community. Sadly according to my previous efforts, without some sort of celebrity status, traction from such a project was very low. The key is youth in City's have never been exposed to the Organic Hip Hop Movement so anything of the subject matter if not presented in a relatable format gets ignored. 

This campaign is important to me because I finally figured out what I am good at and what Id like to do. By making a contribution, you help me get discovered by a major record label and in exchange for selling something most people want to hear, I will be able to fund a side passion. 

Each contributor, will be featured in the hip hop video and credited on the album (if they would like to participate).

What We Need & What You Get

The funding we get will go towards studio time, rented space for dance practice,  JUICE the Mascot (one of my original creations) will come to life as a real mascot. 

Funding will also be used for printing posters and CD's for the initial promotion and social media campaigns. 

The Unique perks:

All donors will receive autographed gear, a free download of the album upon completion. Top tier donors will be featured in the Official Video for the HIT Single. In addition, each donor will receive a custom JUICE the Mascot made by Build-A-BEAR. 

The Impact

This is a valuable campaign for the following reasons;

1. Undiscovered talent will be discovered. 

2. Unlike some rappers who just want to rap, I went to school and although my lyrics will be explicit, I do have a plan in motion for giving back. 

Risks & Challenges

Well, most people will view this project and think its a stupid idea to try and wrap Hip Hop and Agriculture together. I speak for the youth in the city's who don't have the access to what most suburban and rural kids have access to. I think Hip Hop is something fun that people of all backgrounds enjoy, and I love creating music. My passion though, is to see more urban kids pursuing careers in Agriculture. Which is why I created JUICE the Mascot to go along with the first Agriculture Education Mobile app. I hope that as a professional Hip Hop Artist, I will meet others who have the means to support the cause. Food access in the city is a big issue, youth making healthy eating choices is another issue. Overall, Id like to see more youth from city's knowledgeable and maybe even thinking about pursing a career in Agriculture. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not contribute, please pass this campaign along!

story: I
story_txt: I

story:
VERONICA LYNN HARPER

Visionary . Entrepreneur . Cultural Development

Digital & Traditional Artist . Sculptor . Educator


PLEASE SHARE/ INVITE FRIENDS
~ SUPPORT ARTISTIC DEVELOPMENT & COMMUNITY PROJECTS

Thank you everyone for the ongoing support in my transition to develop art, travel, and build platforms for community projects fulltime. Launching this fundraiser and your contributions are a strong force/ kickstart in support of this journey.

With years of developing platforms for human expression Im now in need of personal sponsorship to start new larger scale community projects & personal visual development. Im at a point of a major transition to develop art and projects fulltime. In the last 4 years Ive started an underground movement with now over 200+ contributing members ~ Sketch Cabarets platform each month promotes the local arts as well as traveling members for festivals and workshop across the globe. Sketch Cabaret is a strong leader in personal/artistic development, and human expression as a whole. 10years before Ive dedicated to working in the VFX Animation industry for Video Games - Art directing projects, asset creation and managing teams... Im now ready for a new horizon and in need of your support -Thank you

SPONSORSHIP TOWARD AN ARTISTIC JOURNEY
~ traveling across the US & Abroad
~ research & studying art in cultures and communities
~ collecting data on artist retreats & residency programs
~ documenting my lifestyle while studying & sharing insight
~ public art and community projects across the globe
~ blogging & sending sketches to supporters along the way

SELECT A "PERK" FROM THE CATEGORIES: receive an original art piece!


_______________FUTURE/PATH_______________________

I’ve spent the last 10years of my artistic practice in the VFX Animation Industry, personal unique art style development, and hosting large & intimate scale community events for cultural artistic advancement. As of the summer of 2014 I made a transition into personal studies of the visual development behind character illustration in a contemporary unique style through painting, sculpture, and drawing. I am now positioned to dedicate full-time to my personal art, community practice, documentation, research, and development. I host workshops, lectures, and events in Utah and across the nation. My style of art: illustration tells a story; stories hold lessons, inspiration, and dreams- I plan to take this next chapter to reside in Utah, travel across cities and develop public art pieces which enlighten lives, the imagery and style is designed to connect with every age of our society. Your contributions  are a strong force in supporting this journey, not only for myself, but for the artistic community projects.




 

VISIT MY FACEBOOK ARTIST WEBPAGE : www.facebook.com/veronicalynnharper




_______________BACKGROUND_______________________
A visual artist with a background of traditional art, vfx animation, and immersive artistic event directing.

VISUAL ARTS

Ethereal atmosphere & flowing shapes evolve around the endless dance of balance in the forms and architecture of a piece. Mediums of oil color, pencil, and clay are the basic tools which allow depictions of nature, abstract visions, and character driven emotion. Veronica artwork is displayed in galleries, homes, and facilities across the US and internationally. She makes appearances as a live painter & speaker at various large scale and intimate events such as; Lightning in a Bottle, Sundance, ComicCon, and Ted Talks.


GAME & FILM INDUSTRY

A multifaceted visionary with 10+ years experience in the video game industry. Veronica led several departments at studios Sony SCEA, NBC, Electronic Arts, Nickelodeon, BottleRocket Entertainment, roles as Art Director, Producer, Brand & Marketing Agent, Art Lead and Character Artist. Veronica shines a light on mentoring artists, developing fast tract art pipelines, strong communication across all departments art and programming, studio cultural development and proper milestone planning. She is able to create and successfully implement a unique art style under a tight deadlines and platform restrictions. Veronica guides and empowers teams to problem solve and grow as developers by assessing individual talent and giving them responsibilities that accompany their strengths. She encourages teamwork and communication keeping tasks manageable and streamlined. Her communication and easily approachable demeanor helps bring the art teams together to develop excellent games.


COMMUNITY CULTURAL DEVELOPMENT

Veronicas passion is to lead programming and the development of large scale as well as intimate projects of artistic culture in communities for the past 7years. She has assisted various communities with the transformation of creative expression and connectivity. Her company Sketch Cabaret in Salt Lake City Utah carries over 230+ contributing members. Sketch Cabaret is a catalyst for conscious events. Our valley has an abundance of creatives, Sketch Cabaret provides a home each month for networking, discussions, showcase, and a strong future in the evolution of creative human expression.

story:
WHO, WHAT & WHY

My name is Makar Malinouski. I'm an artist from Belarus (Eastern Europe). Recently I graduated from an art college in the US, but having unpaid fees, cannot get my diploma, which creates some obstructions for me to move on. I need to pay back $1,245, so I will be able to conclude my undergraduate studies by receiving the official document, the Bachelor of Fine Arts Diploma. I'm reaching out for help to everyone. Any amount will count, and I will be glad to give back what I have.

WHAT YOU CAN GET

In return I will present you with my work of art. You can look at the different options available in "Perks", read the comments which describe the work in few words, while seeing the images in the "Gallery" section corresponding to the perks (if you are using mobile, see the images on cargocollective.com/mmalinouski). In addition, on the gallery page you can see there a short video with a peek into my studio, where all the work was made. If need arise, you can e-mail me, or leave a private comment on the campaign page. 

All the art in the list was made during the last year in college, so it was a culmination of all my work at the time, and it indeed felt so. They will be a reminder of my gratitude to you, and possibly more than that.

OTHER INFORMATION

The rest of the money raised will go to pay off the campaign, which will consist of making, printing and shipping of art, paying the necessary percentage to Indiegogo, etc. 

All the finished works offered as perks are stored in Sarasota, Florida, so if you are around, it'd be great if you could pick up your piece yourself; contact me. Otherwise, it will be shipped to you after the campaign is over, either as it is, or unstretched, depending on the distance, and money available.

In case we go over the goal, or if anything is left after I paid for the campaign, I will spend the money to ship the work that is left home, from the US to Belarus. 

THANK YOU! 

PS Please, share the campaign on your social networks.


/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////


ХТО, ШТО І ЧАМУ

Мяне завуць Макар Маліноўскі. Я мастак з Беларусі. Нядаўна я скончыў мастацкі вышэйшы каледж у ЗША, але маючы неаплачаныя рахункі, не магу атрымаць дыплом, што стварае пэўныя цяжкасці для мяне, каб працягваць працу. Я павінен заплаціць $1245, і тады змагу атрымаць афіцыйны дакумент: дыплом бакалаўра выяўленчых мастацтваў. Прашу ўсіх пра дапамогу. Любая колькасць будзе скарыстана, і я буду рады даць тое, што я маю.

ШТО ДЛЯ ВАС

У адказ я адашлю Вам сваю мастацкую працу. Паглядзіце розныя прапановы "perks" на цяперашняй старонцы кампаніі, прачытайце кароткую інфармацыю пра працы, гледзячы рэпрадукцыі ў галерэі "Gallery" (калі Вы на мабільным, альбо Вам патрэбен пераклад інфармацыі з "perks" на беларускую, паглядзіце іх на сайце cargocollective.com/mmalinouski). Таксама ў галерэі Вы можаце знайсці кароценькае відэа з аглядам маёй студыі, дзе ўсе працы былі створаны. Калі будзе патрэба, можаце даслаць мне е-мэйл, альбо пакінуць камернтар на старонцы гэтай кампаніі ў спасылцы "Comments". Калі вы знаходзіцеся ў Беларусі, ці ў недалёкім замежжы, ёсць больш магчымасцяў, каб зрабіць працу на заказ. Звяртайцеся! Гэтыя працы будуць нагадваць Вам пра маю ўдзячнасць, а магчыма і нешта большае. 

ІНШАЯ ІНФАРМАЦЫЯ

Астатнія грошы пойдуць на аплату кампаніі, у тым ліку выраб, друк і адпраўка мастацтва, а таксама аплата працэнтаў Indiegogo і інш.

Усе скончаныя працы, што прапаноўваюцца, знаходзяцца ў ЗША, таму яны павінны будуць знятыя з халста для перасылкі ў Еўропу. 

Калі мы перавысім мэту, альбо калі застануцца грошы пасля аплаты кампаніі, яны пойдуць на тое, каб пераслаць мае працы дадому, у Беларусь.

ДЗЯКУЙ!

PS Калі ласка, распаўсюджвайце гэтую кампанію на вашых старонках сацыяльных сетак.

story:
Funding application for course fees and maintenance 2015/6

My name is Cliford Zulu and I am the Curator at a gallery in Zimbabwe, Bulawayo 

I have been offered a place at Kingston University in London, this September 2015,  

Faculty of Art Design and Architecture

Course: MA in Curating Contemporary Designin partnership with the Design Museum United Kingdom

Year of Entry: 2015/6

http://www.kingston.ac.uk/postgraduate-course/curating-contemporary-design-ma/fees-and-funding.html

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Across Zimbabwe, there is a shortage of professionally trained visual arts curators. Whilst there have been a number of positive developments in the exhibiting of art in Zimbabwe, it nevertheless remains the case that there is still much to be done, to create a network of professionally-trained curators and art administrators, able to carry forward the project of ensuring that art in Zimbabwe becomes an ever-greater part of the culture of our nation. Developing curatorial expertise in Africa and across Zimbabwe in particular is a key part of this step forward. I am confident that this opportunity, to study in London, will further equip me to carry forward my commitment to art in Zimbabwe and the project of gaining ever-greater respect for the fantastic work that our artists make.

Since 2005 Kingston University has developed a growing relationship with the National Gallery of Zimbabwe through Raphael Chikukwa, an alumnus of the programme.  In 2012 we welcomed 3 members of staff from Kingston University to help deliver a project brief with basket makers in Lupane.  During this visit I was fortunate enough to work closely with these people and saw first-hand the ways in which professional training of curators can have such a wonderful and beneficial effect on so many aspects of art and culture. I had the opportunity for an interview with Professor Catherine McDermott, the Kingston University course director and we both feel confident that London and its connections with international art will offer an invaluable experience for me that will not only enrich my own professional life, but will also make major and long-lasting contributions to art and culture in Zimbabwe, and the institutions established to support creativity in our country.

The international profile of Zimbabwean Art was raised enormously through the inaugural Zimbabwean Pavilion in 2011 at the Venice Biennale. One of our greatest challenges is to build on this triumph by increasing the pool of professional curators who are able to represent Zimbabwe, both within and beyond the country. It is for this reason that I am keen to avail myself of the opportunity to study at this important London College.

My experience as a curator includes being assistant and supporting intern at the 54th international Venice Biennale 2011. This was a fabulous opportunity that enabled me to further consider the ways in which the curator can make no end of important contributions, on so many different fronts.

In May 2012, I spent a week with other emerging African curators from countries such as Kenya, Burundi, Uganda and Angola, in the 10th Dakar Biennale, the Continent’s most established large-scale international exhibition. I am ready to further acquire much needed skills and qualifications, to enable me to better serve Zimbabwean artists.

In September and October of 2013 I travelled to the London and Wales for a 10 day curatorial and artists’ workshop. The UK presented a great opportunity to visit galleries and exhibitions that took place around the UK

Outside my curatorial work, I chair the Visual Artists Association of Bulawayo, a body of artists that meets and decides how the arts in the region should be administered. I have created partnerships with the National Gallery in Bulawayo and other galleries in South Africa and Botswana. I served in various creative sector committees like the Culture fund of Zimbabwe Trust, Limpopo Spatial Development Committee Creative sector and give advice to Mzilikazi Art and Craft centre and the Bulawayo Poly Art School.

The experience I gain from studying in London will be invaluable. I intend to work on developing professional curatorial practice that will see the appreciation of contemporary curating through the delivery quality of exhibitions facilitation of workshops and network lines throughout the country and the region especially in countries like Botswana, Zambia and Malawi. I intend to hold workshops in the gallery on curating/ work with the course to create a legacy and connections with London and Kingston that will support my work and the work of colleagues in Zimbabwe. The country’s policy on freedom of expression has been a challenge to an affective creative sector and the regional politics should inspire new engagements and interrogations. In February 2013 the NGZ will be organising the first curatorial workshop in Zimbabwe and Bulawayo will host the workshop.

In 2014 I participated in the 35day ASIKO International Art School in Dakar Senegal through the Centre for Contemporary Arts of Lagos Nigeria (CCA, Lagos) run By Bisi Silva. The 4th edition was titled “A History of contemporary arts in Dakar in 5 weeks” the ASIKO school was held alongside Africa’s contemporary art space, the 11th edition of the Dak Art Biennale.

………………………………

Cliford Zulu

Skype: cliford.zulu

Cell: 00263 772896508 

Email: cliffzuluus@gmail.com

story:
My Glass Journey

My name is Megan, and my passion is art. In High School I was in a 3-D Art concentration class for two years, and I found that I was really able to express myself, have fun, and make amazing works of art. One medium of work really stuck out to me, and something that I loved working with, was glass. Working with glass in anyway possible, it was a calling that I would sorely miss after graduating.

 

I've created a large window hanging or my own design, incorporating Kanji from the Japanese language, with an included Copper Repousse piece in the middle. I've also designed and constructed a glass and mirror vase, with a design influenced by the shape of a handheld harp. For a Hispanic Heritage project I constructed a stained glass necklace, that doubles as a decorative piece, and a functional piece of jewelry. And something that I use everyday, still, is a mosaic coffee table, made from a wooden coffee table that was going to be discarded.

With this campaign I'd like to raise the funds to make a studio so i can start working with glass again. There's no design to out there, no idea too hard, I want to experiment and to make, to give a little beauty to the world. I want to keep learning about more glass techniques, like glass blowing, glass fusing, bead making.


What are the Goals?

What will your donations will help me accomplish? Let me show you.

  • Glass Cutting Equipment - $150 (encompasses all glass mediums)
  • Glass Grinder - $240 (includes different grinding bits, and protection supplies)
  • Light Box for Patterns and Piecing - $80
  • Soldering Iron - $70
  • Foil and Solder for glass - $95 (includes tools related)
  • Storage and Organization items - $95
  • Sheets of Glass -$200
  • Misc/Maintenance  required - $70
What happens if I'm able to supply my studio? I'll be able to do what I love, I can make glass wares that everyone can enjoy. Glass suncatchers, mosaic garden balls, windchimes, custom pieces, selling my stuff at craft/art shows all over the state, and eventually expanding my reach, and selling online to my Etsy store as well. I'm lucky enough to have a studio space available to me at no cost. It's a dedicated space, with lighting, ventilation, and heat control when need be. There is no design that I won't attempt, and if I don't know how to do it at first, I will research and experiment until I have mastered a technique. I can also specialize in popular media, creating designs based on movies, Video Games, TV shows, and so much more. There are no boundaries.


Stretch Goals!
  • $1250 - I'll be able to take a 4 week Glass Blowing class
  • $1400 - I'll be able to take both a Glass Blowing, and Glass Fusing class

Perks!

For helping this campaign, for helping more creativity in this world, you won't go empty handed.

  • $10 - Personal Thank You in a Youtube video giving a tour of the studio
  • $20 - A specially created 3 inch x 3 inch glass container (made of 1-2 colors)
  • $30 - A specially created 6 inch x 6 inch glass container featuring a simple design on one or all sides
  • $60 - Small outdoors/indoors windchime (1-2 colors, simple design)
  • $100 - Medium outdoors/indoors windchime (custom design)
  • $150 - Window piece measuring roughly 12 inches x 12 inches of a custom design
For all perks, an email correspondance will take place discussing colors and designs to ensure satisfaction. (Pictures of what each piece will look to be uploaded soon.)

Unfortunately, due to the price of certain materials needed, perks can only be offered to be made and shipped if the campaign raises an minimum of $300. Thank you for understanding.


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? That's okay! You took the time to come to this campaign, and I appreciate that. There are others ways you can help, though. You can share this campaign with your friends and family and associates! Share it on Facebook, on Twitter, Tumblr, even through E-Mail.  For everyone to see I have put all materials that I'll need, that I feel are essential to a professional home studio, on an Amazon Wish List.

Amazon Wish List

story:
·  Have you ever tried to find our Armenian national epic online as an e-book? 

·  Have you ever thought of our national epic when trying to buy one of the first fairy tale books for your children?

·  Have you ever thought how powerful our national epic is and how could it actually change our children's mindset?

A very simple, yet very powerful and impactful project - to publish the 1st fully illustrated print book and the first ever e-book of The Daredevils of Sassoun in Armenian and in English, both as a hardcover/paperback book and an e-book.  We have done an extensive research on all the publications of the Armenian national epic and here is what we found out:

·  There is no e-book,

·  There is no edition that would have a full list of illustrations (for 4 chapters) with characters that could inspire children and make them believe in the power of the Armenian "dyutsazunner".

So why not to revive the soul of the often forgotten heroes from our national epic for thousands of children in Armenia and abroad? 

Back in 1990s our father, Khoren Hakobyan, thought of this (he is children's book illustrator and he has illustrated more than 100 books).  So he created probably the first and the only full series of illustrations, covering the entire story - every character and every episode. This was a result of over 10 years of dedicated work. 

Today, on the threshold of our father's 70th anniversary, our family  (David Hakobyan, the son, Anna Hakobyan and Rebecca Hakobyan, the daughters) would like to fulfill our father's dream: TO BRING THE DAREDEVILS OF SASSOUN CLOSER TO CHILDREN AND HAVE THEM INSPIRED WITH THE ARMENIAN EPICAL HEROES. We want to publish the 1st fully illustrated edition of the epic that would help our children see our national epic in vibrant characters from the beginning to the end.

Investment Needs

Today we are fundraising for the entire cycle of print and e-book publication, as well as for marketing costs that would help us spread out the word about this special and unique edition of the Armenian national epic.  

·  USD 6500 will be required to print 1000 copies of the books.

·  USD 2000 will be dedicated to design, programming, text editing and other miscellaneous production costs.

·  USD 2000 will be streamed towards on-site and online marketing (i.e. posters design and printing, FB ads, web banner design and web advertising on targeted websites, etc.)

In case we are not able to reach the targeted funding, we will use the available funds primarily for production costs and printing (the quantity would depend on the available funds). 

Reporting

We would like to assure that we are ready to be very transparent and to report to our  contributors about the expenses and project progress on regular basis. Should you be willing to receive progress reports and final report of this project, please send a short message to daredevilsofsassoun@gmail.com.

Benefits for Investors

We will highly appreciate any invested amount. Furthermore, we are delighted to provide a wide range of benefits to our potential investors, including special sponsorship packages with exclusive rewards.  

THANK YOU!

We would like to thank you for your interest and shared enthusiasm.  We would greatly appreciate if you could share the information about this project via Indiegogo share tools, social media or in any other format. 

Thank you once again!

“Daredevils of Sassoun” Project Team

story:
La Marcha de las Putas Ecuador hace una re apropiación del insulto "puta", con su carga de condena dedicada a las mujeres y otras feminidades, a fin de denunciar y subvertir esa carga; demanda la no culpabilización de las víctimas de violencia sexual como “provocadoras” de su propio maltrato, coloca a la erradicación de la desigualdad y la violencia de género como requisito sine qua non de cualquier agenda política de justicia social y afirma los derechos sexuales y reproductivos, los derechos de las personas trans y los de las personas que ejercen el trabajo sexual

La "Marcha de las Putas" nació en Canadá en abril de 2011, a raíz de las declaraciones que diera el policía Michael Sanguinetti durante una conferencia sobre seguridad ciudadana en la Osgoode Hall Law School de Toronto. El policía aseguró que “las mujeres deben evitar vestirse como “putas” para no ser víctimas de violencia sexual”. The "Slutwalk" (como se denominó la primera marcha) es una denuncia pública en contra de todas las formas de violencia hacia las mujeres y de la estructura social e institucional que reproduce y justifica esa violencia. La propuesta ha recorrido, hasta el momento, más de 60 países, con particular fuerza en América Latina.

En el caso ecuatoriano, La Marcha de las Putas se ha constituido en una plataforma permanente de pensamiento y acción feminista (de tal modo que llevan el mismo nombre el colectivo permanente y el evento anual). La plataforma convoca a mujeres, hombres y personas de diversa condición sexo-genérica alrededor de procesos de formación, cabildeo político en pro de políticas de igualdad, denuncia pública de la violencia de género y, por supuesto, la organización de la Marcha anual, que parte desde el Arco del Parque del Ejido hasta la Plaza Foch y termina en el “Festival Emputado”.  

La plataforma Marcha de las Putas Ecuador, compuesta por activistas feministas, quiere destinar 600 dólares a la producción del Festival Emputado. Como plato fuerte de la Marcha de las Putas, el Festival Emputado se ha llevado a cabo por tres años consecutivos y su calidad ha crecido enormemente: este el cuarto año que lo estamos organizando. El escenario se instalará en la Plaza Foch de Quito, lugar en el que se congregarán finalmente las cerca de 7000 personas que se espera que marchen este próximo sábado 21 de marzo de 2015. Tendrá una duración de 18h30 a 22h00. Como todos los años, mujeres y personas trans animarán la tarima y se presentarán bandas, artistas y artivistas feministas. Tradicionalmente, hay una fuerte presencia de hiphoperas feministas del sur de Quito. El Festival Emputado podría definirse como una gran fiesta feminista en la que se difunden mensajes contra la violencia de género y a favor de la libertad estética, sexual y de género, se interpela a las instituciones públicas responsables de implementar políticas contra la violencia de género y por la igualdad, y se lee colectivamente el Manifiesto de la Marcha de las Putas. Cada año, el Festival trae a una artista invitada de otro país. Este año la invitada será la hiphopera vasca “Furia Soprano”. Por tratarse de un esfuerzo militante de la sociedad civil que no cuenta con apoyos institucionales, los costos de la tarima, equipos y sonido deben ser sufragados por las activistas. Este crowdfunding pretende cubrir parte de estos costos.

...................................................................................................................................

SlutWalk Ecuador re appropriates the insult "slut," with its loaded meaning as an insult dedicated to women and other femininities, to expose and subvert the burden that it carries. In doing so, we demand an end to the practice of blaming the victims of sexualized violence for "provoking" their own abuse. We demand that our call for the eradication of inequality and gender violence be a requirement to any and all political and social justice agendas. We affirm the sexual and reproductive rights of transgender people and people who engage in sex work.

"SlutWalk" was born in Canada in April 2011, following the statements of police officer Michael Sanguinetti during a conference on public safety in the Osgoode Hall Law School in Toronto. The officer said that "women should avoid dressing like "sluts" to avoid being victims of sexual violence." The "Slutwalk" (as the first march was called) is a public denouncement of all forms of violence against women, as well as the social and institutional structure that reproduces and justifies such violence. The movement has reached more than 60 countries so far, with particular strength in Latin America.

In Ecuador, the SlutWalk has become a permanent platform for feminist thought and action (thereby bearing the same name and permanent collective annual event). The platform brings together men, women and people of all of different sex-gender identites to engage in trainings, political lobbying on policies surrounding equality, public actions to denounce gender violence and, of course, the organization of the annual Slutwalk, which begins in El Parque del Ejido and ends in the Plaza Foch with the “El Festival Emputado” or, "Slut Festival".

The feminist activists of Slutwalk Ecuador are seeking to raise $600 for the production of the festival. The main highlight of SlutWalk, “El Festival Emputado” has been carried out for three consecutive years and each year the quality of the festival has grown enormously. Our fourth festival will take place on Saturday March 21st 2015.

Costs

We are installing a stage in Quito’s Foch Plaza, where we are expecting nearly 7,000 people to gather after the march. Like every year, women, trans people will fill the stage as feminist bands and artists preform. Traditionally, there is a strong presence of feminist hip hop artists from southern Quito. El Festival Emputado is a feminist party where we denounce gender-based violence, and celebrate aesthetic, sexual, and gender freedom. We hold public institutions responsible for implementing policies that promote equality and prevent against gender-based violence. We collectively read from our self-written Slutwalk Manifesto. Each year, the Festival brings a guest artist from another country. This year's guest is the female hip hop artist Vasca “Furia Soprano.” Because we are a militant feminist movement, we do not receive any institutional support. For this reason, and the costs of the stage and the sound equipment is raised solely by activists. This crowd funding page is our way of helping to cover some of these costs.

The "Slutwalk" (como se denominó la primera marcha) es una
denuncia pública en contra de todas las formas de violencia hacia
las mujeres y de la estructura social e institucional que reproduce y
justifica esa violencia. La propuesta ha recorrido, hasta el momento,
más de 60 países, con particular fuerza en América Latina.

En el caso ecuatoriano, La Marcha de
las Putas se ha constituido en una plataforma permanente de
pensamiento y acción feminista (de tal modo que llevan el mismo
nombre el colectivo permanente y el evento anual). La plataforma
convoca a mujeres, hombres y personas de diversa condición
sexo-genérica alrededor de procesos de formación, cabildeo político
en pro de políticas de igualdad, denuncia pública de la violencia
de género y, por supuesto, la organización de la Marcha anual, que
parte desde el Arco del Parque del Ejido hasta la Plaza Foch y
termina en  el “Festival Emputado”.  La plataforma Marcha de las Putas
Ecuador, compuesta por activistas feministas, quiere destinar 600
dólares a la producción del Festival Emputado. Como plato fuerte de
la Marcha de las Putas, el Festival Emputado se ha
llevado a cabo por tres años consecutivos y su calidad ha crecido
enormemente: este el cuarto año que lo estamos organizando. El
escenario se instalará en la Plaza Foch de Quito, lugar en el que se
congregarán finalmente las cerca de 7000 personas que se espera que
marchen este próximo sábado 21 de marzo de 2015. Tendrá una
duración de 18h30 a 22h00. Como todos los años, mujeres y personas
trans animarán la tarima y se presentarán bandas, artistas y
artivistas feministas. Tradicionalmente, hay una fuerte presencia de
hiphoperas feministas del sur de Quito. El Festival Emputado podría
definirse como una gran fiesta feminista en la que se difunden
mensajes contra la violencia de género y a favor de la libertad
estética, sexual y de género, se interpela a las instituciones
públicas responsables de implementar políticas contra la violencia
de género y por la igualdad, y se lee colectivamente el Manifiesto
de la Marcha de las Putas. Cada año, el Festival trae a una artista
invitada de otro país. Este año la invitada será la hiphopera
vasca “Furia Soprano”. Por tratarse de un esfuerzo militante de
la sociedad civil que no cuenta con apoyos institucionales, los
costos de la tarima, equipos y sonido deben ser sufragados por las
activistas. Este crowdfunding pretende cubrir parte de estos costos....................................................................................................................................
SlutWalk Ecuador re appropriates the insult "slut," with its loaded meaning as an insult dedicated to women and other femininities, to expose and subvert the burden that it carries. In doing so, we demand an end to the practice of blaming the victims of sexualized violence for "provoking" their own abuse. We demand that our call for the eradication of inequality and gender violence be a requirement to any and all political and social justice agendas. We affirm the sexual and reproductive rights of transgender people and people who engage in sex work.
"SlutWalk" was born in Canada in April 2011, following the statements of police officer Michael Sanguinetti during a conference on public safety in the Osgoode Hall Law School in Toronto. The officer said that "women should avoid dressing like "sluts" to avoid being victims of sexual violence." The "Slutwalk" (as the first march was called) is a public denouncement of all forms of violence against women, as well as the social and institutional structure that reproduces and justifies such violence. The movement has reached more than 60 countries so far, with particular strength in Latin America.
In Ecuador, the SlutWalk has become a permanent platform for feminist thought and action (thereby bearing the same name and permanent collective annual event). The platform brings together men, women and people of all of different sex-gender identites to engage in trainings, political lobbying on policies surrounding equality, public actions to denounce gender violence and, of course, the organization of the annual Slutwalk, which begins in El Parque del Ejido and ends in the Plaza Foch with the “El Festival Emputado” or, "Slut Festival".
The feminist activists of Slutwalk Ecuador are seeking to raise $600 for the production of the festival. The main highlight of SlutWalk, “El Festival Emputado” has been carried out for three consecutive years and each year the quality of the festival has grown enormously. Our fourth festival will take place on Saturday March 21st 2015.
Costs
We are installing a stage in Quito’s Foch Plaza, where we are expecting nearly 7,000 people to gather after the march. Like every year, women, trans people will fill the stage as feminist bands and artists preform. Traditionally, there is a strong presence of feminist hip hop artists from southern Quito. El Festival Emputado is a feminist party where we denounce gender-based violence, and celebrate aesthetic, sexual, and gender freedom. We hold public institutions responsible for implementing policies that promote equality and prevent against gender-based violence. We collectively read from our self-written Slutwalk Manifesto. Each year, the Festival brings a guest artist from another country. This year's guest is the female hip hop artist Vasca “Furia Soprano.” Because we are a militant feminist movement, we do not receive any institutional support. For this reason, and the costs of the stage and the sound equipment is raised solely by activists. This crowd funding page is our way of helping to cover some of these costs.

story:
Short Summary

Mattie is a story of a young girl's life abruptly disturbed by the discovery of the new found gifts of seeing what others can not. This, along with being raised within a tumultuous and unstable family only serves to heighten her struggle, causing the weight of her choices to be even the more unbearable. When a tragic murder occurs, Mattie is spun into a spiral leading to both grace and evil.

Will there be redemption? Only time and everything she sees, can tell.

We are asking for your help to tell her story by donating all you can, and by sharing this with everyone you know. One of the things we are most excited about, is the films our script has been compared to...inspiring to say the least. 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell Everyone...REPEAT 

Also, if you can donate Red Cameras, Sound Equipment, or have expertise to be on the team (production, post or otherwise) contact us and let us know how you can contribute. 

Thank you, thank you, thank you!

story:
100% of all money raised through this campaign will go toward paying the tuition fees, which are £20k. This pays for two years’ full-time study. I am covering my living costs, which I predict to be in the region of £25k for two years.

I have included images here from various recent projects of mine.

One of the stipulations of this campaign is that I offer “perks” to donors. This actually fits well with my art practice, which is collaborative and participatory. In previous projects I have entered the homes of strangers, gifted and installed artworks in their homes and then had a conversation with them about art, arts function and arts value.

 

I would like to use this idea for this campaign. If you donate £1000 or more, I will produce an artwork for you and for those of you who live in Sheffield or London, I would like the opportunity to visit your home to present and install the artwork. For those of you living elsewhere this may be tricky but I’m open to discussing an alternative. Other great perks are available for smaller donations.

I believe that my time and my skills are best spent making and sharing art. After starting out in a career that wasn’t suited for me, I have finally found something that I’m passionate about and that I want to do for the rest of my life. Art has enriched my life with so much meaning.

It’s important for me to say that I’ve already worked extremely hard to get to where I am now. I’ve worked night shifts while attending my foundation course during the day. I’ve worked every holiday and every summer to fund my last four years at university. As a masters student, there are now much fewer funding options. Getting your support will mean so much to me and I absolutely will make the most of the opportunities it will give me.

In the last five years I have exhibited internationally in the UK, France, Norway, Turkey, Thailand and China. I have taken part in art residencies in the UK, Norway and China. I have also worked as an assistant to four artists and designers. I have just held my first solo exhibition in my hometown of Sheffield, for which I produced and curated 62 new artworks and managed my own publicity. This exhibition is a springboard for this crowdfunding campaign. I’m enthusiastic, proactive and I want to continue the momentum that I currently have and take it to the Royal College of Art, one of the most challenging and stimulating learning environments in the world.

 

Any support you can give is appreciated. If you cannot donate, you can still help in a big way by sharing this campaign on social media. Thank you very much for your time.

 

 

Harrison Moore (b. 1986, Sheffield, UK) lives and works in London. He graduated with a Diploma in Professional Study and a BA in Fine Art from Central Saint Martins, UAL London (2012- 2016), undertaking his Erasmus placement at Mimar Sinan University of the Fine Arts, Istanbul (2013-14). He is due to begin his MFA in Contemporary Art Practice: Public Sphere at the Royal College of Art, London (2016-2018). Solo exhibitions include Sheffield: You Were History, Gallery 35, Sheffield (2016); The Art of Letter Writing, CSMSU, London (2013). Group exhibitions include ActØ, By Other Means Gallery, London (2016); All Exclusive, The Old Police Station, London (2016), New York, New York, BYGDA 2.0, Stokkøya, Norway (2016), Show 1, Central Saint Martins, London (2016), <src code = people>, 17 Fielding Street, London (2016), Shared Insight, Kentish Town Health Centre, London (2016), Hix Awards, Cock & Bull Gallery, London (2014), Silhouette in Six, Black Maria, London (2013), In Between States, Mile End Art Pavilion, London (2013), MMXIII, Mile End Art Pavilion, London (2013), F, Blake College, London (2012) and Sister Cities, International Museum of Tianfu Square, Chengdu, China (2012). He has participated in residencies including Stokkøya Collaborative Residency, Norway (2016), Outside In Residency, UK (2016), Sister Cities Residency, China (2012) and has worked as a studio assistant for artists John Underwood, Thailand (2014), Frances Scott, London (2013), Florence Dent, London (2013) and Leena Chauhan, London (2013).

story:
Bridget Bishop Presents: The Salem Bitch Trials

Please help the Haus of Bishop team as we embark on our Off-Broadway premiere. Originally created as a work for Jared Rubin-Sprowls' undergraduate thesis, The Salem Bitch Trials is an experimental means of adapting drag culture for a conventional theater audience with no water added. We'll get our hands dirty with issues of authenticity and identity -- but we're also going to dish out the fun and serve up the shade, all to the tune of Donna Summers' greatest hits. This play hopes to give crucial visibility to LGBTQ issues, as well as show you an exciting new side of theater that you never even knew you needed.

Thanks to a grant from The Araca Group, we have the space -- but now we need the $$$ to make the show happen.

What We Need & What You Get

We're a scrappy show -- but we want to do right by the people who believe in us. We believe the arts should be accessible to all, and that the people making the art are our most valuable asset -- so we're paying our actors a living wage to put our money where our mouth is. Approximately 85% of our budget will go to the salaries of the actors as well as the creative team. Here's the rest of the breakdown:

7%: Set pieces and Sound/Lighting rentals

1.5%: Marketing

1.5%: Concessions

5%: Travel

We will put on this show no matter the budget, but 5,000 is what we need in order to fulfill our financial obligations and pay our artists what they deserve. 

There are some perks!

$10 and higher: A personalized thank you note from the producers.

$25 and higher: A personalized thank you note with a little somethin' special from our team.

$50 and higher: A personalized thank you note with a poster with a signature and the smooch from the cast. 

$100 and higher: A personalized thank you note, a signed poster with a smooch, AND a meet and greet with the queens prior to the show.

$250 and higher: You will not only be reserved front-row seats, but you will also receive a personal invitation to our fundraiser, where a QUEEN will lip sync a song of your choice! In addition, you will get to meet the queens and you will receive a signed poster with a smooch as well as a personalized thank you note.

$1000 and higher: A personalized thank you note, a a signed poster with a smooch,  a meet and greet with the queens prior to the show, AND an executive producer title.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have money to spare? We totally get it, neither do we. You can still:

- Volunteer a space for us to do auditions. We are looking for FREE spaces to hold our rehearsals as another means to cut down on costs. If you have a free room, let us know!

- See the show!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
in silence    静けさに    w ciszy

Haiga book-portfolio and film
 

Artists:

Lidia Rozmus – internationally published haiku poet, author, painter, and international exhibitor, lecturer, and speaker, www.lidiarozmus.com

Jan M. Zamorski – Independent cinematographer and photographer www.youtube.com/user/janzam51

Iwona Biedermann – Photographer, and independent curator of DreamBox Gallery, www.iwonabiedermannphotography.com

Nanae Tamura and Ikuyo Yoshimura – Translators

Matsanobu Hoshikawa – Calligrapher, www.hoshikawaonline.com
 


Brief Description:

Haiku by Lidia Rozmus is the starting point of the project in silence.  It includes a limited edition of 90 portfolio books.

The book’s composition includes 18 folders with three versions of haiga in each. Eighteen of Lidia Rozmus’s haiku will have three versions: an English version including photography by Iwona Biedermann and Lidia Rozmus; a Japanese version with “classic” sumi-e by Lidia Rozmus and calligraphy by Masanobu Hoshikawa; and a Polish version with colored pencil on black cardboard by Lidia Rozmus. 

The film, produced by Jan M. Zamorski, will present the four seasons, with haiga selected from the book. The 18 folders and the film will be placed in a handmade box.
 

 
Objectives:

 • To promote cultural exchange and unity through poetry and art by focusing on Japan’s rich tradition of literary and art aesthetics

 • To increase visibility of haiku and haiga to international audiences

 • To share the beauty of life and nature in its simplicity

 • To invite the public to a dialog about poetry and art, regardless of whether participants are knowledgeable about them 

 • To encourage not only the contemplation of beauty, but the necessity for silence and peace in our lives during chaotic political and economic times
 


Financial Goals

• Cost of printing and production of limited edition book-portfolio in silence: $7000

• Production of DVD: $500

• Advertising, translations: $2500

 We hope to raise $5000, which will cover part of the cost of the project. 
 

Time and Place of Implementation:

• The Polish Museum of America, Chicago, Illinois –Spring 2017

• Haiku North America Conference, Santa Fe, New Mexico – Summer 2017

• Museum Manggha – Kraków, Poland –Fall 2017

• ArtZona – Kraków, Poland – Fall 2017

• Warsaw University, Warsaw, Poland – Fall 2017

• Jagiellonian University, Kraków, Poland – Fall 2017

• KUL University, Lublin, Poland – Fall/Winter 2017-18

• Haiku Society of America Annual Conference, Mineral Point, Wisconsin – Summer 2018

• Additional places: We will show the film and book at haiku meetings in Japan, including those at Kyoto, Tokyo, Matsuyama, and Gifu in 2018, and at other international poetry gatherings.

 Target Audience:

• The project will have a diverse and international audience with presentation in the U.S., Poland, and Japan. Since the project will be in three languages—Polish, English, and Japanese—the audience will feel interconnected in knowing at least one of them.

• Copies of the book-portfolio will be donated to cultural institutions, including: Museum “Manggha” in Kraków; Museum of Haiku in Tokyo; The Haiku Society of America Archives at California State University in Sacramento; and prestigious libraries of American & Polish universities offering Japanese Studies.

• The project will be promoted with exhibitions and film presentations, as well on social media and through press releases.

 Why This is Important

About a year ago, I had the thought: What is the best, most precious gift we can give to one another? One of the answers was silence—the peace of silence. Why? Because we live in very challenging times and personal moments of silence, solitude, and quiet are essential to our well-being.

There are many kinds of silence, and everyone experiences them differently.  Personally, I experience it in the three lines of a haiku, in one or two brush strokes, or in a few lines drawn by a colored pencil. These are the silences we share with you in the book-portfolio in silence. You can also experience it the photography of Iwona Biedermann, in the simplicity of her white cloud images, and with Jan M. Zamorski’s short film of nature in four seasons.

These fleeting moments of silence and the experience of nature’s beauty inspire us to create, and we hope they will inspire you, too!

silence
I hide in
for a moment

There are 54 reproductions of haiga (short poetry of haiku combined with the image). In English, the haiku are combined with photography; in Japanese with sumi-e (brush and ink on rice paper) and calligraphy; and in Polish with colored pencil drawings on a black board. Through these different languages and media, you can experience the same silence, but with variations. 

In addition, the film (on DVD) adds yet another experience of silence.

The reason for doing this project in three languages is that I want to share it with the people living in these three countries that are so dear to me: America, my home; Japan, my spiritual land; and Poland, my homeland.

Our message is simple: In the middle of the opacity and noise of everyday life, the clarity of silence is attainable within.

in silence
no beginning no end
in silence
 


Other Ways You Can Help

Let’s get the word out.

Please share this information with your Friends!      .

Facebook, emails and blogs; it's all helpful.

To share on social media click on the share tools.

Thank you; we feel the deepest gratitude for your consideration and support.

Zamorski – Independent cinematographer and photographer www.youtube.com/user/janzam51Iwona Biedermann – Photographer, and independent curator of DreamBox Gallery, www.iwonabiedermannphotography.comNanae Tamura and Ikuyo Yoshimura – TranslatorsMatsanobu Hoshikawa – Calligrapher, www.hoshikawaonline.com Brief Description:Haiku by Lidia Rozmus is the starting point of the project in silence.  It includes a limited edition of 90 portfolio books.The book’s composition includes 18 folders with three versions of haiga in each. story:
Heavy Music Artwork launches world’s first and only metal and rock art magazine - Issue two

Heavy Music Artwork has evolved into a leading online publication for heavy metal and rock art. The site is widely visited and highly regarded for its outstanding work in promoting heavy metal and rock as art and culture.

As it stands, the site has reached terminal velocity in its rapid ascension to where it is now, in terms of size and popularity. It’s now time to transcend into a more professional sphere of media and use its potential greatness to benefit everyone involved in the site, including record labels, bands, artists, publishers, promoters and our faithful readers.

We are now devoting the same care and attention to a premium quarterly print and digital magazine. Focusing on the creative disciplines, music, art, design, illustration, photography and video making. Showcasing the most talented and renowned artists and musicians with interviews, anecdotes, opinion pieces and insights.

Heavy Music Artwork print edition:
Printed on high quality uncoated stock, which gives texture and earthy feel
Ethically sourced and FSC approved and using vegetable based inks
Limited edition of 666 units hand numbered and stamp embossed
Perfect PUR binding on 250gsm (cover) Offset Paper
100 pages (approx)
2200 Copies printed

What We Need
Your contribution will help Heavy Music Artwork launch the magazine and secure future releases. HELP US get this magazine off the ground. We are only looking to raise £5,000. This gets the first issue off the ground and some breathing room to get issue 2 going.

Each issue will have a different theme, starting with Dark Nouveau, Folklore, Flesh & Blood and so on. This is an estimate of our costs and where the funds will go towards:

  •   30% Production costs
  •   20% Marketing
  •   18% Overheads
  •   25% Printing costs
  •   7% Campaign fees

Our awesome perks
Our perks are simple and includes something for everyone, please see side panel

Vision & Mission
Provide the heavy metal community and industry with outstanding resources, material, information, news and updates
Promote graphic artists, music artists, record labels and agencies through interviews, biographies, artworks and in-depth profiles
Entice people to explore and experience life within the arts
Examine through music, art and literature all aspects of the human condition

The Impact
Your impact will not only benefit us as a publisher but the artists and the metal community as whole
We are dedicated to place the magazine in places where you wouldn't normally see a metal magazine like art galleries and museums
Our work has helped young artists getting the attention they deserve as well as getting paid jobs from bands
Heavy metal is one of the most relevant and influential art form and it must be celebrated as such. Heavy Music Artwork is the first to make this statement

Since our launch www.heavymusicartwork.com has enjoyed great popularity, reaching yearly 1 million page views, and 25,000+ monthly visitors. Promoted via all HMA social networks 80K+ Followers. Newsletter to 5K HMA email subscribers.

Labels and PRs that helped us along the way
Agonia Records, Century Media, Debemur Morti Productions, Earache, Indie Recordings, Lifeforce Records, Lion Music, Mascot Group, Massacre Records, Metal Blade, Napalm Records, Nuclear Blast, Peaceville, Pitch Black Records, Relapse, Season of Mist, Snapper Music, Southern Lord, SPV, Universal, Spinefarm, Warner Music, Svart Records.

Adrenaline PR, Asher Media, Audacious PR, Clawhammer PR, Cosa Nostra, Devil PR, Dewar PR, Domino Media, Duff Press, Earsplit, Factory Music, Fly PR, Future PR, I Like Press, Noble PR, Noise Cartel, Old Empire, Perfect Storm PR, Pioneer Music Press, Publicity PR, Rarely Unable, Red Sand PR, Savage Gringo, Scream Promotion, Silverblack, Stampede Press, Speakeasy PR, Stereo Sanctity, Team All About The Music, Visible Noise, Wilful Publicity and Work Hard PR.

What are the risks?
As with any project, there are risks involved in releasing a publication. We might not be able to deliver the end product on time, or we might run into problems with the printing and shipping. Our team has over 15 years in delivering creative projects of all sizes and shapes. The 1st issue is ready to go to print, so any problems are very unlikely.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Ask your fellow metal head to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign
Please share and make the world know that metal is art in all its forms

story:
Who we are 

Meez:
Bay Area native Omeez Jones is a well known Lifestyle Photographer and Cinematographer at Creative Key Co. He has taken well over 250,000 photos, from Portraits, Landscapes, and Products. Omeez’s photography has been featured on Hypebeast, Highsnobiety, ThoseRebels and numerous blogs. He has captured content for Nike, New Balance, Bow’s & Arrows, Rare Panther, ISO, and more brands. He has over the past 4 years Meez has also organically grown a social media following of about 11K according to Niche (Niche.co/iamomeez) In 2012 Omeez was invited to go to Vienna, Austria with Recording artist Ryan Leslie to be the cinematographer for Ryan's mini-documentary for his Black Mozart album. The mini-doc has been viewed by greats like Kanye West, Jay-Z, Fabolous, ASAP Rocky, ASAP Ferg, and many others. The visual got over 500,000+ views with great reviews. In the spring of 2013, Omeez embarks on an 8 week Nationwide tour in the US with country singer Kate Earl along with Matchbox Twenty and Goo Goo Dolls. In the Fall of 2013, he heads out on another tour. This time an 8 week tour in Europe along with Keoni Mars to cover visuals for Ryan Leslie. Meez has shot for numerous artists such as Fabolous, SchoolBoy Q, Ab-Soul, Kate Earl, Trinidad James & Waka Flocka and many more just to name a few. Omeez is a quick shooter who has an eye of his own. His photos capture moments and finds it everywhere in his surroundings. He transfers his photographic style into his videography by capturing each frame like a photograph of his own.
www.iamomeez.com 

Nicole:

As a dedicated event producer and professional, with almost a decade of experience in youth development and event planning in Oakland, Nicnak built her career in a variety of roles. The on-going creation of her independent event production company Nicnak Productions is centered in her desire to create, showcase artists, and build community. 

Nicnak is deeply connected to a city filled with culture, creativity, and art waiting to be showcased. With experience as the primary Event Producer for Nicnak Productions, she brings a common experience and genuine understanding of the overall urban landscape community that is required to foster both an intentional and collaborative working environment for artists all around.

Nicnak also took on a role as Iamomeez’s current Manager taking on a journey with Meez as his career and his talents flourish.  Nic and Meez plan on bringing Meez’s talents from city to city, hosting showcases for his work and introducing him to new cultures and different people. Aside from showcasing Meez’s work we plan on cultivating a new generation of artists through photography by becoming an idol for many children who aspire to be whom they want to be.

The Campaign:

We are here to bring our community together, Whether it be with everyday people to creatives of all sorts. We plan to expand our views on how people should come together in a safe and friendly open environment where you're able to be yourself. We understand it is important to shift the public perception on up and coming creatives in the area who need the support to strive and keep creating.
Contributors:
We appreciate every dollar that we will be receiving. Every dollar made will be contributed to expanding our vision to more creatives as well as open up new opportunities for creative to grow in the community. We plan to create a Non-Profit that way we can open up a space for the community to come and express their Art with everyone and also give back to our youth. This will be a huge milestone for future funding because we plan to give every dollar back to a community that doesn't give a voice to many of its amazing creatives. WE PLAN TO CREATE THAT OUTLET with all of your help.

What We Need & What You Get

Majority of the fund will be going into locking in a venue for August, Also to get a bundle pack of Exclusive 1 of 1  24'x26' Canvas Prints that iamomeez has taken from all over from various collections. Here is our estimated cost break down.

Canvases: 24x36" 1of1 Exclusive Prints from various collections - $2,200

Venue: Venue cost $1000 Max (3-5 Hours)

Table Book: 20 exclusive Table Books - $400

Food & Beverages: $200

Insurance for venue: $200

We don't plan to keep any of the money everything collected is going into cost for what was listed above. We would really appreciate to get most of it covered so we didn't have to come out of pocket for the whole event. These events are always free and full of great vibes and people as well. The majority of funds will go back into making these events happen on a regular basis, the money will not be touched until we make that a reality.

You get exclusive prints that iamomeez has not yet released from your choice of a handful of picked images from various collections. Also many many more perks. The biggest satisfaction is that these two give back to the Creatives and Community we all care for. That would mean more to us than any amount of money we're asking for or receiving.

The Impact

We believe in our community and what it has to offer to us. We merely just want to give back and show our youth and community that we together can make great things happen. With all of our contributions it goes to show that people do still believe in our youth and creative abilities to bring people together in a very well put together place.

Our last event brought out about 200 people for it being our very first event. It was great to see everyone admire the work that was placed on all parts of the City Of Paris Studios walls. To have the City mayor Libby Schaaf come to the event located in West Oakland, CA was a huge accomplishment. To have small and big individuals in one place says a lot about the energy we can bring to an event, It was very powerful to see that.

Risks & Challenges

Nothing ever comes easy, But we have worked very hard to make our awareness present. When the youth have lack of resources to go to we both want to be that safe haven they can come to and get the help they need. The challenge has always been funding and education but we believe in our whole structure so much that we took a leap of faith to reach out to the people we know and also people we may have never met to make a stand to help us achieve our goals. Together we can bring what is needed to all walks of life. We both have been finding every solution to better and expand our vision to one day actually bring a central place in local communities where we all can enjoy it together, Thats the bigger picture we plan on creating and ultimate goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

We would love for you to share with Friends and Family, Or just genuine people trying to help a great cause. We know that every contribution is appreciated and will be treated as such. Please use our indiegogo share tools to post this campaign to your social media outlets. Thank you so very much for your support.

Regards,

Nicole & Meez

story:
The Project 

I’m honored to have been offered an artist residency at Muong Studio just west of Hanoi, Vietnam in November 2016, with the support of the Indochina Arts Partnership as the sponsoring agency. I’ll be working with local artisans to transform small compositions based on my “vines” series into large-scale sculptures made from local bamboo, an abundant and natural material in that region. I plan to experiment with both scale and material in creating these sculptures. There’s also a dialogue and a narrative within these works I’m looking to explore in the context of both the ethnic Muong culture as well as that of contemporary Vietnamese. 

Another project I’ll be doing there builds on my recent experiences at residencies at MassMOCA (N. Adams, MA) and SpreadArt (Detroit). I’ll be creating a performance with Vietnamese choreographers and dancers. This will combine images of my artwork with movement, music, and culminating in a staged performance in the Hanoi area. Some of the bamboo sculptures may remain in Vietnam, and the performance will be for the benefit of their local community and cultural programs. For more on my recent work and how it relates to the forthcoming project, please visit my website. 

Why Vietnam?

I was still in art school in NYC, barely out of high school when I found myself in uniform as a U.S. soldier in Vietnam. It was 1968 and while the protests back home against the war were growing, I was struggling to make sense of it all and survive. The level of destruction to the Vietnamese and to populations in adjoining countries was horrific. The loss of American lives and the experience has haunted me ever since. 

It is both humbling and exciting to be able to return to Vietnam as an artist. It’s an amazing opportunity for reconciliation and starting a new journey. Several Vietnamese I met and connected with in developing this project have already extended their warm welcome to me, embracing my visit and collaborative art projects. I hope you’ll contribute to my effort and be part of this exchange of ideas and reconciliation. 

What is needed and what you get

The funds raised in this campaign will help me with the costs of supplies and paying wages to local artisans who will assist in building the bamboo sculptures. The funds will also pay for a choreographer, dancers, and musicians for a performance in Hanoi. I’m also responsible for paying my travel, room and board at the residency and in Hanoi for up to six weeks to complete my goals. I hope to be able to hire a videographer to document the construction of the sculptures as well as to create a short film of the dance performance. Any additional funds raised beyond my expenses will stay in Vietnam to support the furthering of arts programs and cultural exchanges via the Indochina Arts Partnership, a nonprofit with three decades of history working with Vietnamese artists. 

All donations from the $25 level and up will be rewarded with my recent artworks. From photo art prints and silkscreen prints, to sculptures. Top reward levels include a selection of artwork, a tour of my Hudson Valley studio and meals for two at my home prepared by my wife, vegan cookbook author, Nava Atlas. If you’re planning to be in Hanoi while I’m there, dinner and a visit to the Muong Studios and local artists can be one of the perks for a contribution. 

Additional perks for other than the above list can be arranged through a studio visit. Contact Harry at Tabak@Tabakart.com

How you can help
Please spread the word about this campaign to anyone you think may be interested. Forward the link via e-mail or post it to your social media. This fundraiser is flexible, which means that all contributions can be used for this project, even if the goal isn't reached. All contributors receive the perks offered. Any additional funds raised beyond the goal will benefit the arts community in Vietnam. 

Here's a sampling of some of the perks:
