story:
Hello, 

my name is Anastasia and I'm an artist and mom of 1 year old beautiful girl, I finally have time to get back to art.  


These are the dolls I made before I took a brake:



And these are my latest acrylic paintings:



 I'm going to create a new collection of hand-made decorative dolls of different colors... Their characters will be taken from this miniatures above, they will be unique and one of a kind... Just choose your favorite!

Hope you will love them and would like to have one of them!

They will make your life brighter and happier, I promise!                                                                            

What's the doll made of?

  • Body - 100% cotton by authors 
  • patterns and darkened 
  • with coffee and vanilla
  • 7 characters as 7 rainbow colors      
  • Hair - colored merino wool
  • Outfit - best fabric 
  • Face - acrylic art
  • Doll - unique artist style   



Contributions:

-Greeting card - print from original painting-please email me color desired
-Doll - choose the character from 7 paintings and let me know
Thank you for keeping this project alive, please share!

story:
Making my dreams and dreams of many young artists come true.

Hello everyone!

I'm Blažka. I'm a 16-years-old girl and I live in Slovenia. I am currently a student of  I. Gymnasium in Celje which is a type of school with a strong emphasis on academic learning, and providing advanced secondary education. After I finish this school, my wish has always been enrolling to the University of Arts in New York, but the tuition there is very high. (it costs 36,282 US Dollars)

But that's not the only problem. To have greater chances of being accepted I need some references and an art related project.

So this is what came across my mind.

To build an art gallery.

I've been passionate about art since I was little. I always loved drawing and creating. Years have gone by, my passion grew and so did my drawing abilities. I became pretty good at drawing and I have to admit that I became pretty good about dreaming too. 2 years ago I found this university of Arts in New York and I fell in love with it. It would give me so many new opportunities for my future career and I think it's the best thing that can happen in my life.

Now let's get down to why I need your help.

As I said, I need an art related project. I know how hard it is for a young artist to get a drawing / painting / art in general  into the art gallery. And I also know, how hard it is, to keep the work in there and how many connections you need to have. And this is why I want to build an art gallery. I want to give opportunity to many young artists, to show their work to the world and try to make their dreams come true.

First I need money to buy a place and renovate it. I have found a cheap old local for a really good price, but it's in a quite bad condition and in need of renovation. 

I have calculated everything and it will cost me around 7000 euros. I have been saving every euro that I got for the past year and a half because I knew that I want to do a project like this. I have saved up a good amount of money, but I still need 3000 euros and I have to start with my project in March 2016. The deadline is getting closer and closer and I won't be able to collect those 3000 euros by myself. I need your help.

All the collected money will be spend for the purchase and renovation of the gallery. People / artists who will help me with renovation will get a space in the gallery for their art work for free. 

As I said I want this art gallery to help other, unknown, young artists. Because I need to also collect money for my tuition I'll charge every artist that will want a space in the art gallery 5 euros per month. I think that this is quite a low price but I'm sure that I'll be able to collect those 36,282 dollars this way and I'll be saving up for my tuition, taking care of the art gallery expenses and I will be helping young artists to get noticed. I also will charge 2 euros for adults to see the art exhibitions, while children and teens under 18 years will have free entry.

If you want more information about my project feel free to contact me via email:

zeleznik.blazka@hotmail.co.uk


Every single euro counts. I am really in desperate need of your help.

I'll be also sending out a thank you card with an a5 format illustration (it can be an illustration of your choice) to EVERY SINGLE DONOR at the end of each month. (example you donate in November, you get my thank you gift in the end of November, you donate in October, you get my thank you gift in the end of October)


Person who will give the biggest donation will have the opportunity to name the art gallery. (It must be art related)


Thank you so much for reading this. I will deeply appreciate every single donation that will be made. 


Let's give opportunity to us, young artists, or young at heart. Because, we deserve it. :) ♥


Thank you.

Blažka

story:
Hi there! We are Blue Sphere Toys and we make art toys and collectibles.
We are trying to reach the funding necessary to make our "Hedge Hog" character a reality. He is 100% hand made in Columbus, Ohio. By pledging to our project you not only support the arts in Columbus, but you also get an adorable little pal who always has a grin.

If we are able to reach our goal of $750 we will be able to bring the Hedge Hog to life. The goal covers the cost of design and development, materials, and equipment necessary to make each figure.

The Design Process

Here's the digital illustration of the Hedge Hog.

We then made a reference sheet of what he would look like in 3D.

He was the sculpted and a mold was made so we could cast duplicates our of plastic resin.


Backer Rewards

We will have the Hedge Hog available is three main options to start:

  • Blank Do-It-Yourself
  • Original Colorway (Gloss or Matte finish)
  • Glow-In-The-Dark


Should we not reach our main goal the funds pledged will go towards the equipment and materials necessary to get us as close as we can to bringing the Hedge Hog to life.

Stretch Goal
Once we reach our starting goal we will begin working on our first stretch goal, the Garden Snail Mini Planter.
He will be unlocked at $1,250 and will be half figure/half functional planter. We will also be available in:
  • Blank Do-It-Yourself
  • Original Colorway
  • Glow-In-The-Dark

Future Goals
We hope to get both the Hedge Hog and Garden Snail figures funded and hopefully available online and in local retailers early 2016. We also hope to make more figures within the next year.

Risks & Challenges

The only risk involved with this project is not getting our main goal. This will make it impossible for us to make the figures as we won't have all of the required materials. We will do our best, but with the support of awesome people like you we shouldn't have any trouble.

If you are unable to pledge to your project then helping to share it around to others you think might enjoy it as well is also incredibly helpful. 

Your help and support means a lot to us and we promise to do our very best to provide not only great figures, but great fun too!

story:
My name is Mandy Poje.

I am 35 years old. I am married (14 years) and we  have 4 beautiful children. Two daughters ages 14 and 13, and two sons ages 8 and 10. We live on Vancouver Island in Beautiful British Columbia in Canada! 

MY very hard working husband recently lost his job and we are going to have a hard time making ends meet,

 I decided to start dying and spinning my own yarns as it was easier on my hands than crocheting. I have been dying and spinning for about 2 years now and feel confident that my product is very nice and in demand. 

I do have some health issues, I fell a few years ago and hurt my hip and lower back, so I have a hard time standing to long or sitting to long to hold a proper job, without relying on pain medication every day. 

I currently can only order the  minimal amount of fibers and dyes and materials needed to have enough sales to basically get more fiber and dye. If I was able to buy a Larger amount of fiber and dye at a time I would have enough stock to be able to have an online store and actually start making a profit :) 

To raise 1000$ would help out immensely. To raise $2500 would be life changing!!!

We own a mini van from 1994, we rent a 3 bedroom home because it's in our budget, we don't own a single credit card which means we can only spend money we actually have, and we do live within our means. 
It would be so nice to change this, a new reliable vehicle, a bigger home, perhaps own something one day. We have moved no less than 16 times since we met, and to be able to buy simple things like new clothes when they are needed! ALL THIS will happen if i had this business going! 

We aren't so much asking for a hand-out but more of a hand-up. 

Thank you for considering even a 5$ donation, every penny counts. And please don't forget to share :) 
Thank you

story:
.............................................................................................................

..................................................................................................

>>>>>>>   <<<<<<<

As a lifelong artist, designer, tea drinker, and outdoor enthusiast I am driven to create and operate Chariot Tea in parks, beaches, trailheads, and vistas in the Santa Cruz area. I find artistic inspiration in natural settings and I love to be physically active. Oftentimes, when I am on a beautiful beach staring at the ocean or on a damp mossy trail in the woods, I think to myself 'This is wonderful, but I really wish I had a cup of tea or chocolate'. It is this desire to add to the sensory experience of truly being present and enjoying a poignantly beautiful moment or outdoor space that has driven me to create Chariot Tea.

 

.....................................................................................................................

...............................................................................................................

 

>>>>>>>   <<<<<<<

This campaign is an effort to achieve funding to purchase a used USPS Truck from a postal service source in California.  Once the vehicle has been bought and tuned-up, I will begin converting the USPS truck into a mobile tea shop with separate funding.  

The first leg of funding the fabrication of Chariot Tea (this campaign) will cover the following costs:

1. The purchase of the USPS vehicle (I have a great affordable source at a secret location in CA)

2. CA Licensing, Insurance, and Registration costs

3. Mechanical tune-up

 

>>>>>>>   <<<<<<<

As a visual artist and designer, my goal is to fund this initial purchase of the USPS truck with limited edition fine-art prints of my drawing work from my current on-going drawing series called "Earth Body" as well as originals from the same body large-scale body of work.  Drawings from this body of work have been published, collected, and exhibited nationally.  The prints and drawings will be hand selected by me for each individual backer.

 

.................................................................................................................

.................................................................................................................

 

>>>>>>>   <<<<<<<

Once Chariot Tea is up and running.  The focus on conducting business at parks and outdoor settings will promote the use and appreciation of natural settings and outdoor community spaces. In addition to Chariot Tea’s mission to highlight the importance of public outdoor areas in Santa Cruz and beyond, Chariot Tea will also be a green-focused business.

The mobile café will be run on “Go Power!” 3000-watt solar panels. The trailer will also have a self-contained filtered water unit from a local water distributor, compost all organic tea leaves at an offsite compost facility, offer compostable beverage cups, incentivize reusable beverage containers, and offer a drink discount for customers who bring their own to-go cup.

 

.........................................................................................................

...................................................................................................

 

>>>>>>>   <<<<<<<

The work that I have done between freelance display installation and as a barista in cafes has honed practical daily operational experience on how to successfully run a cafe and has fine-tuned my tea and specialty beverage knowledge to offer the best cafe experience in line with industry standards.

Through the work that I have done as an artist, designer, installer, and fabricator I have gained professional experience on how to design and execute both interior design and installation in corporate and boutique retail environments and museum and gallery settings.  I would like to use these professional skills and my personal sense of aesthetics as a fine-artist to execute my unique design and brand for Chariot Tea's mobile cafe and coinciding visual materials.

 

............................................................................................................

...................................................................................................................

 

>>>>>>>   <<<<<<<

Thank you for taking the time to read over my campaign story and materials for funding the purchase of a USPS truck for Chariot Tea's mobile cafe.  

If you are not able to contribute this time around but would like to help bring Chariot Tea to fruition, you can help by sharing this campaign with others via word of mouth or social media.

I am looking forward to bringing great tea and wellness drinks to beautiful natural settings and sharing my journey with you all!

I am looking forward to bringing great tea and wellness drinks to beautiful natural settings and sharing my journey with you all!

story:
Hello my name is David Graziano. I am an industrial designer and entrepreneur. I spent the last 25 years of my life designing hospitality venues and businesses. I have a love for sculpting and my passion is centered around creating concepts for people to enjoy. Burningman has had a very strong impact on my desires to contribute to the art world. What I find most interesting about the art at Burningman is the ability to share it with so many people on an interactive platform. Balanceville was an idea that started nine years ago.

The original concept was to build a beautiful art car that could move across the playa and raise way into the air giving its guest a different perspective of the playa and BM. So I set out on a quest to purchase the largest scissor lift available and began developing a sort of Willy Wonka Dr. Seuss sleigh that could carry people into the sky.

The process has been evolving over eight years.  Ninety-five percent (95%) of all the metal used for Balanceville has been hand bent without the use of heavy machines.  Balanceville has been a sculpture project that is constantly evolving each year it returns to the playa. After five years of driving Balanceville with its original scissor lifts chassis at a painstakingly slow speed of 2 miles an hour, I decided we needed to incorporate a new vehicle with the scissor lift that would allow Balanceville to drive the speed limit of 5 miles an hour on the playa. This new idea of merging the scissor lift with another vehicle was also designed to allow Balanceville to pack up and be street legal on the highway, thus saving thousands of dollars in transportation each year. So my great friend Tom Toulec, who has been helping me build the car from its inception, suggested using a fire engine truck chassis. This was absolutely perfect, the fire engine truck already comes with its hydraulics, as well as, a chassis designed to hold large amount of weight. So three years ago, we purchased a 1990 fire engine truck. We completely dismantled the fire engine truck and cut the back axle so we could drop the scissor lift crane into the mainframe of the fire engine truck making both vehicles into one vehicle. The following three years of this large mechanical undertaking has been a sculpture project to change the frame of the original fire truck into a completely new vehicle that will complement Balanceville's original sleigh frame. The result has been incredibly rewarding. Balanceville now has a portion of the Vehicle which raises 52 feet into the air, and then once lowered, it nests perfectly into the base chassis, creating an illusion, when down, that the car is just one vehicle.

Balanceville is a project designed to deliver an incredibly unique experience to every guest who boards vehicle. Myself and the few very dear friends of mine have been building Balanceville every year since 2009. We have put a lot of love and care into building Balanceville with the hope that each year at Burningman we can inspire, and share many magical experiences with the beautiful people of the playa. I have personally witnessed so many incredible moments of joy over these past seven years of attendance at the Burn. There have been weddings on Balanceville, engagements, first kisses, jaw-dropping facial expressions, and many other amazing emotions from the view atop.  Many people who enter the vehicle for the first time are completely unaware that the sleigh portion of the vehicle raises five stories in the air. It isn't until after a very slow movement upward, that the guests begins to realize that they have changed their altitude as the sleigh portion of the vehicle slowly rises. I believe very much in the power of art and how art can be so inspirational. Balanceville's goal is to capture the imagination of anybody who encounters the vehicle through its whimsical and playful design. Balanceville and its hard-working team members want to see your smile, your joy while you rise above the playa for a view of like no other, come ride with us at Burning Man 2018.

Education teachersIt's been an amazing educational  journey building Balanceville. Constructing an art car of this size with so many mechanical parts does not come without its challenges. Just to store and move Balanceville safely each year is quite a large undertaking. When we first started building Balanceville we took off 1600 pounds of steel that was the railing and steel plate floor for the lift. Next we were going to build a new decorative frame made up of steel tubing to replace the factory steel railing and extended floor plate. One of the challenges was that we were going to redistribute the weight on the lift. We had to make sure that we balanced the sides, as well as, so that we did not create an uneven weight distribution for the lift, which can lift about 15 people at a time. There is a tremendous amount of safety awareness that needs to constantly be thought of while building Balanceville.  Every piece of metal we add to the vehicle we need to calculate its shape and weight distribution so that we don’t offset the vehicles balance. It's hard to explain in words how many parts both sculptural and mechanical need to be taken apart and put back together each year for the vehicle to be ready and safe for the playa. The good news is the team that has been working on Balanceville has been the same team for most of its life.  This certainly helps with all aspects of operating and building Balanceville. Just to pack the vehicle up from its workshop to the time it gets fully assembled at Burningman is about two weeks with four people working around the clock.

Now that Balanceville is a 52-foot scissor lift and a full-size fire engine truck chassis, its home during the months between Burningman needs to be a large enough space to work on the vehicle.  So obviously the cost associated with just storing, maintaining and operating the vehicle during Burningman has become a large responsibility and expense each year. This does not include the expense of finishing Balanceville’s decorative framework each year, which we hope to finish in the next two years. The support we are looking for this year is not for the sculptural part the car. That expense is being covered by myself and a few friends. The financial support we’re looking for is just to cover the cost of storage, maintenance, transportation, and for its operational team during Burningman.

In the end, it is important for me to express my immense joy for this yearly project.  After sharing experiences on the car, I find it really gratifying to say, at the end of each Burningman, three things that usually don’t go together - “I’ve never spent so much money, worked so hard, and been so satisfied all at the same time.”

story:
Looky Here Art Space: Community Risograph 

Looky Here is a multi-functional Art space serving the community of Western Massachusetts and Southern Vermont. We support artists living in the community by providing affordable used and donated art supplies and music equipment. Our programming, including workshops, events and gallery shows seeks to cultivate interest and appreciation of the arts, as well as build skills, confidence and relationships needed to sustain a creative life.

Part of our mission is to host equipment in our space that provides artists access to mediums which otherwise require a large investment. In response to expressed interest, we are planning a collective rental of a Risograph printing machine, which visual artists and bookmakers revere for its high quality image reproduction. Risos are dynamic art making machines, and we polan to host workshops by expert Riso-artists, as well as train and pay a monitor to help people use the Riso during open hours. This project will serve the artists in a 50 mile radius of Greenfield by offering access to a high quality art and book reproduction, and providing space for artists to meet, exchange and collaborate.

The Risograph:

A Risograph printer is an affordable, eco-friendly digital duplicator that works in a similar way to a xerox printer but produces an image closer to a screenprint. Risograph is a form of Mimeograph printing, which utilizes a rotating ink filled drum that lays an impression onto a piece of paper. Riso prints individual colors at a time using a rice bran oil based ink, which produces a monotone image that can include values. Multi-color prints are made by sending the paper through the machine multiple times and switching out the ink drum, when the colors overlap the translucency of the ink blends together to produce wider range of color options. Riso comes in a variety of color options that will blend and layer to turn your image into a beautiful art print.

After purchasing an old broken model, we are now interested in leasing a new SF5130 duplicator from Riso Inc. in Boston. This model features:

  • 4 different color drums (which must be changed between prints)
  • scanning bed with job/color seperation functions
  • ability to print 130 copies per minuite
  • ability to print 13lb to 110lb paper including: paper stocks, construction paper, newsprint, postcards and envelopes frpm 4"x6" to 8.5"x 14"

The Financing Plan

The Risograph costs $187.29 per month to lease. This includes the first 4 color drums and roll of masters. We estimate that our annual expense for the machine, and new inks and masters would total $2,400.

While Looky Here is currently run by the Board of Directors on a volunteer basis, it is part of our mission to employ area artists. To hire one staff member to run the Risograph, as well as work our resale store, for 7 hours a day, 5 days a week at $15 an hour, we would need to ensure $30,000 for their annual stipend.

This means that we hope to be pulling in about $2,700 a month.

While we plan to take custom orders for a fee, our vision is to create a community of artists who all have access to unlimited printing. This would mean creating a membership program that would divide and share the cost of leasing and staffing the Community Risograph. 

IMPORTANT NOTE FOR INTERESTED MEMBERS!

Membership has potential to work in many ways, and as investors in this Community Risograph project, your input on membership plans is important, as we are trying to make this as affordable as possible. While paying a staff member is one of our long term goals, we recognize the strain it puts on the membership fee, and our Board is willing to continue to volunteer, as well as accept volunteer work to make this happen.

The monthly or annual membership fee will differ depending on how many members enroll. 

At $2,700 a month, including the employee stipend:

the monthly membership fee would be $54, if 50 members join.

However, if 25 members join, the monthly fee would be $108

To understand if leasing the Risograph will be a financially stable investment for Looky Here, we are asking potential members to contribute to the cost of an annual membership if possible. 

If membership is desired, pease specify in your donation comments, and we will calculate the cost divided by members once our monetary goal is met, and make up the difference if necessary.   

Talk to us!

If you have any questions about this campaign, membership, Risograph printing, Looky Here or anything at all, you can contact us at LookyHereGreenfield@gmail.com

story:
ALUNA

Aluna is a structure that sits on its own reflection and stands as a unified entity on the Playa. Upon entering, two pairs of seesaw swings hang from the ceiling, inviting you to find counterweight in a partner, who will collaborate and engage with you in a game of balance and trust. Prehispanic melodies converge with experimental sounds and techniques to accompany the breath and silence of the Black Rock Desert. You will be sonically immersed in an ever-oscillating universe reaching for balance. As dusk approaches, Aluna will be illuminated by hundreds of LED lights that line its frame and body, reflecting and challenging the sounds of Aluna, creating a complete interactive experience for participants.

Aluna is the Arhuacan word for the spirit of the Sierra Nevada, and is designed to create awareness about two subjects. First, the importance of trust and reciprocity in building and preserving the balance the world needs to function harmoniously. Second, the relevance of balance as a ruling principle of the world. With this installation, we want to express that in the same way as with physical forces, this universe is made of inherently different beings that have an obligation to give and cooperate with each other in order to succeed and so, reach equilibrium.

 

Aluna is an incredible opportunity for its artists and audience members. As the first Burning Man Project from Colombia, we have an important international window through which we can share with audiences a message of coexistence and harmony,  an often unseen part of our culture and the doctrine of a community whose entire purpose is to preserve our reciprocal relationship with the planet. Just as taking care of the earth requires purposeful energy, Aluna demands that audiences actively engage with the installation while offering a unique immersive experience.

The Inspiration

Aluna is inspired by the wisdom of the Arhuacos, an indigenous community living in the Sierra Nevada of Santa Marta, Colombia, the highest littoral mountain chain in the world. This community sees the plane and world we live in as the innermost of eight different levels of the universe. The four upper levels represent the enlightened, visible part of the universe, its highest values. The four lower levels represent the negative, invisible but darkest portion of the universe.

The Arhuacos and the other three communities living in the Sierra Nevada of Santa Marta (koguis, wiwas and Kanquamos) work together to preserve “The Black Line”, a territory in the form of a triangle, 100 miles on each side which connects 54 sacred points of the Sierra Nevada and works as its spiritual boundary. The spiritual leaders of these communities, the Mamos, have made journeys through the Black Line for centuries, making offerings to mother nature as payment for all of its gifts to humanity. They are active caretakers of the environment and natural resources of Colombia.

 

 

The Team

 

Team Aluna is made up of a core of 10 passionate individuals: architects, engineers, musicians, and designers. The diversity of our team symbolizes the message our project has to offer. We combine our vast set of skills and approaches to bring the dream of Aluna to life.

Juan David Marulanda, lead artist and creator of Aluna, is a Colombian architect who received his education from the National University of Colombia. Marulanda is the Director of Design for the Lehoucq Architects. He made his graduate thesis dissertation about the architecture of the Arhuacos and the current public housing policies in 2009. Since then, Marulanda has collaborated as the editor of two books aimed to preserve the oral tradition of the Arhuacos community.  Through his work, Marulanda is interested in sharing a message of civic duty, social consciousness and the importance of collaboration.

 

Brayan Orjuela,  our structural engineer, has collaborated with Marulanda in the construction of cultural spaces for vulnerable Colombian communities for more than five years. They are both members of the Arquitectura Expandida collective, which recently built the first community cinema in Colombia: “El Potocine” http://arquitecturaexpandida.org/

Camilo Montilla, our  music producer, is the owner of Sonica, one of the two authorized recording studios by Dolby in Colombia.

aLma.MaddR, our team of sound artists and composers, is lead by Anabel Romero, Christina Ward and David Aguila, a Los Angeles based interdisciplinary arts collective dedicated to the creation and presentation of new works.

Lauren Sego, our lighting director and designer, is based out of Los Angeles. Sego has headed projects  with world renowned artists such as Janelle Monáe, Jidenna and Ingrid Michaelson among others.

María Paula Martínez, our fundraising manager, photographer and graphic designer, is documenting and sharing the Aluna journey. Additionally, Martinez is first Secretary of Cultural Matters in the Department of State of Colombia.

Rebeca Victoria, our production manager, is a fashion and costume designer and one of the founders of Nuvula, a sustainable cutting edge brand that collaborates and participates in diverse productions for fashion, music videos, performance and film.

María del Pilar Sandoval, our project manager, is an economist and political scientist working for the Colombian National Procurement Agency, an organization dedicated to the transformation of public procurement in the country.

Additionally, we will be receiving assistance from our wonderful volunteers on the Playa which include: Christhoper Govers, Mauricio Moncada, Sebastian Moncada, Gordy Dust .

 

Help us make Aluna a reality!

HOW?

  1. You can donate to our campaign and receive some amazing perks!
  2. Share our campaign on social media. Give us the chance to tell our story. We are full of things to tell: behind the scene experiences, who we are, where we came from and how we got here. Our project’s successes that you help make possible!

Help us bring Aluna to Burning Man, and share this beautiful message and immersive experience with audiences from all over the world!

 

Featured Thank You Gifts

story:
So Who is the Messenger Crew?

     We are a team of recent converts to the mind-blowing experience that is Burning Man.  After participating in the festival largely as spectators last year, We feel deeply inspired to bring the most important, moving work we can to share with the many 100,000's of individuals that make up this creative, global community.

What is our campaign about?

Our campaign is about bringing Sacred Space to Burning Man this year to enhance the theme of "Radical Ritual".  We hope to touch thousands of lives in a way that will inspire individuals to stop and consider what they truly are "Here to do" on our little, shared planet.

What your financial help means to us:

Your contribution, in whatever amount, will give us the funds we need to transport this 11oolb sculpture cross-country and build a meaningful, sacred space in which it may be experienced.  

What is our Campaign Goal and where will the money go?

We have set a goal of $4300!  Your contribution will go towards:

*3 week Rental of a Heavy duty towing vehicle to haul 5,000 pounds of pure Messenger Shrine love across the country and back! ~$1850

 *Gas to Power this Tow Vehicle (yes, we know--not a zero-carbon footprint campaign here unfortunately)  ~$1100

*Building Materials! While we scavenge and repurpose what we can, structural materials for the shrine must be strong and Fasteners (lag screws, nails, etc) newly purchased. ~$900

*Propane delivery system to power the flame in the Shrine's heart ~$300

*Other shrine elements including lamps and lamp oil and LED lights ~$150

IF WE GO OVER OUR GOAL, MAYBE WE CAN EVEN AFFORD A SOLAR PANEL AND BATTERIES TO POWER SOME ADDITIONAL LIGHTS!

What can WE offer to YOU as a THANK YOU?

  • In addition to the lovely perks we are now offering, anyone who donates to our campaign can contact us to have their personal message written and burned in the heart of The Messenger Shrine.
  • Donations of $50+ will receive a hard copy 5x7 photo of The Messenger Shrine and Crew at Burning Man .
  • Donations of $100+ in the Central Virginia area will have the opportunity to attend a magical "thank you" brunch upon our return, where we will regale you with tales of the Shrine's Journey while our talented crew chefs indulge your gourmet palette

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially at this time, you can still help!!

  • Share and Like our Campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Indiegogo and elsewhere!  Spread the Word!
  • Loans of other important material items for our Camp are greatly needed and appreciated!  At this point, at the top of our wishlist are:  a small solar power array/generator; a 2 burner propane cook stove; a 10x10 pop-up tent WITH built in sides; 2-3 large heavy duty coolers; a mini-fridge; 4 season tents (i.e. no mesh--dust storms can be bad!)
  • If you are in/around Virginia and have a line on either a 16ft trailer or vehicle rigged/rated to tow 6,000lbs+ please let us know!  We are looking to Rent, but if the price is right we would consider buying as well!
story_txt:
So Who is the Messenger Crew?
     We are a team of recent converts to the mind-blowing experience that is Burning Man.  After participating in the festival largely as spectators last year, We feel deeply inspired to bring the most important, moving work we can to share with the many 100,000's of individuals that make up this creative, global community.
What is our campaign about?
Our campaign is about bringing Sacred Space to Burning Man this year to enhance the theme of "Radical Ritual".  We hope to touch thousands of lives in a way that will inspire individuals to stop and consider what they truly are "Here to do" on our little, shared planet.
What your financial help means to us:
Your contribution, in whatever amount, will give us the funds we need to transport this 11oolb sculpture cross-country and build a meaningful, sacred space in which it may be experienced.  
What is our Campaign Goal and where will the money go?

We have set a goal of $4300!  Your contribution will go towards:
*3 week Rental of a Heavy duty towing vehicle to haul 5,000 pounds of pure Messenger Shrine love across the country and back! ~$1850
 *Gas to Power this Tow Vehicle (yes, we know--not a zero-carbon footprint campaign here unfortunately)  ~$1100
*Building Materials! While we scavenge and repurpose what we can, structural materials for the shrine must be strong and Fasteners (lag screws, nails, etc) newly purchased. ~$900
*Propane delivery system to power the flame in the Shrine's heart ~$300
*Other shrine elements including lamps and lamp oil and LED lights ~$150
IF WE GO OVER OUR GOAL, MAYBE WE CAN EVEN AFFORD A SOLAR PANEL AND BATTERIES TO POWER SOME ADDITIONAL LIGHTS!
What can WE offer to YOU as a THANK YOU?

In addition to the lovely perks we are now offering, anyone who donates to our campaign can contact us to have their personal message written and burned in the heart of The Messenger Shrine.
Donations of $50+ will receive a hard copy 5x7 photo of The Messenger Shrine and Crew at Burning Man .
Donations of $100+ in the Central Virginia area will have the opportunity to attend a magical "thank you" brunch upon our return, where we will regale you with tales of the Shrine's Journey while our talented crew chefs indulge your gourmet palette


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute financially at this time, you can still help!!

Share and Like our Campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Indiegogo and elsewhere!  Spread the Word!
Loans of other important material items for our Camp are greatly needed and appreciated!  At this point, at the top of our wishlist are:  a small solar power array/generator; a 2 burner propane cook stove; a 10x10 pop-up tent WITH built in sides; 2-3 large heavy duty coolers; a mini-fridge; 4 season tents (i.e. no mesh--dust storms can be bad!)
If you are in/around Virginia and have a line on either a 16ft trailer or vehicle rigged/rated to tow 6,000lbs+ please let us know!  We are looking to Rent, but if the price is right we would consider buying as well!

story:
UN PROGETTO INTERNAZIONALE DI SCIENZA, FILOSOFIA ED ARTE

Nel 2012, il team del Prof. Ferdinando Boero dell' Università del Salento compie una ricerca sensazionale nel campo della biologia marina, scoprendo un essere dalle dimensioni microscopiche - 4-5 mm circa - che dimostrava l'abilità di ovviare ai processi d'invecchiamento, e di ritornare allo stato fetale. Questo essere, nella forma di una medusa - la turritopsis nutricula - ha pertanto assunto il nome di 'Medusa Immortale', uno cnidare quasi totalmente formato da acqua - il 99% della composizione totale - che ha tenuto silente, nel relativo 1% di composizione organica, il sofisticato complesso dell'immortalità.

Ad oggi, scienziati italiani, giapponesi, americani e russi, insieme ad intellettuali e curiosi di tutto il mondo hanno preso il caso della turritopsis come motivo d'ispirazione per approfondimenti scientifici, accademici ed artistici. Fra questi, il Prof. Shin Kubota dell' Università di Kyoto sembra aver coltivato un vero e proprio credo, ripromettendosi, come confida in alcuni studi, "di trovare la chiave dell'immortalità." Il Prof. Kubota, però, ci svela alcune teorie in fase di definizione che renderebbero l'immagine della turritopsis ancora più mitologica.

"Alla base dell'albero dell'evoluzione", ci spiega, "ci sono gli Cnidari", la famiglia a cui appartengono le meduse, incluse la turritopsis. Secondo le teorie del professore, gli esseri umani proverrebbero dagli Cnidari e lo dimostra anche la composizione del DNA, "molto più simile", secondo le sue ricerche, "rispetto a quello d'insetti o vermi."

Se pertanto alla base dell'evoluzione l'uomo ha radici comuni con le meduse, quando e perchè questi ha perso il dono dell'immortalità mantenuto dalla turritopsis? Allo stesso modo, con un approccio più critico e tautologico, se l'evoluzione di per se indica il miglioramento, la crescita e il progresso, può, l'evoluzione umana dirsi compiuta e riuscita se meno sofisticata, in termini di durata, rispetto a quelli di una medusa?

Queste, ed altre domande, verranno esplicitate per mezzo di una performance e un video-documentario dello storico dell'arte Giosuè Prezioso, attualmente coinvolto in un prestigioso programma della casa d'aste Christie's, Londra.

Con la partecipazione di scienziati internazionali e addetti al settore dell'arte, la filosofia e del cinema, questo progetto proporrà un elaborato che porterà a riflettere su scienza, logica, tautologia, esistenza ed entropia.

 

***

 

FONDI PER OPERATORI, TALK E ATTIVITA' DI DIFFUSIONE

Considerata la multidisciplinarità e il riverbero internazionale del tema, il progetto in-hirritance - che parte come una performance, e allo stesso tempo come una campagna di studi scientifico-umanistici - i fondi aggregati per l'operazione serviranno a compensare la collaborazione di diversi professionisti e/o le azioni che si sono prospettate per il progetto.

Rimanendo in una dimensione realistica - ma ambiziosa - gli attori e gli oggetti del funding saranno:

- Traduttore italiano, inglese, giapponese per i contenuti di diffusione, sottotitolaggio ed esplicazione via speaker dei video;

- Operatore filmmaker per la creazione, montaggio, editing e finalizing del materiale video del progetto;

- Ricompensa simbolica ai partecipanti scientifici (Prof. Boero, Piraino e Kubota) in caso di partecipazione;

- Fee artista;

- Costi di prenotazione sala per proiezione lancio del progetto.

 

***

 

ARTISTI, TECNICI E SCIENZIATI PER UN PROGETTO UNIVOCO

Pensato dallo storico dell'arte Giosuè Prezioso, attualmente in un programma presso la prestigiosa casa d'aste londinese, Chrisite's e attivo sul fronte dell'insegnamento, curatela, scrittura, traduzione ed interpretariato, questo progetto prevede la collaborazione di speaker professionisti madrelingua italiano, inglese e giapponese per la creazione dei contenuti informativi ed esplicativi del materiale, nonchè un filmmaker professionista per la creazione, editing e finalizing dei contenuti video; scienziati specializzati nell'area di ricerca (università del Salento e Università di Kyoto) e un artista per la creazione di contenuti di contorno del progetto.

story:
I mille volti di San Nicola

Bari è la città di San Nicola. Qui, dal 1087, si trovano le sue reliquie che ancora oggi richiamano devoti da tutto il mondo. Portano il suo nome chiese, strade, quartieri, strutture d’ogni tipo, perfino lo stadio cittadino. Eppure molti baresi sembrano non conoscere del tutto l’identità del loro santo patrono. Anche fuori dalla città, sono pochi quelli che collegano la figura di San Nicola a quella di Santa Claus, il santo più famoso del mondo. Il vescovo di Myra, nell’attuale Turchia, divenuto nei secoli protettore dei commercianti, dei marinai, dei farmacisti, dei sarti, dei birrai e di innumerevoli altre categorie, è sempre stato prima di tutto protettore degli innocenti e, in particolare, dei bambini. È questo che ha permesso al suo culto di diffondersi ovunque, sopravvivendo a riforme, controriforme e rivoluzioni. Questo ci ha spinto a dar vita, nel 2014, alla Fondazione Myrabilia, per la promozione di attività culturali/pedagogiche incentrate sulla figura del Santo dei Bambini. La nascita del MUMBAM, rappresenta una tappa fondamentale del nostro progetto: dotare la nostra città di una mostra-museo-laboratorio permanente, interamente dedicata a San Nicola dei Bambini.

 

The many faces of Saint Nicholas

Bari is the city of San Nicola, and it is here, ever since 1087, that his relics have been attracting devotees from all over the world. Churches, streets, neighborhoods, various types of facilities and even the city’s football stadium have all been named after him. Yet many people from Bari don’t even seem to know exactly who their patron saint was. And even outside the city, few people connect the figure of St. Nicholas to that of Santa Claus, the most famous saint in the world. The bishop of Myra, in modern-day Turkey, who over the centuries became the protector of traders, sailors, pharmacists, tailors, brewers and countless other categories, was always mainly a protector of the innocent – and of children in particular. That is what led to him having devotees worldwide, surviving various reforms, counter-reforms and revolutions. And that is also what led us, in 2014, to set up the Myrabilia Foundation, to promote cultural and educational activities around the figure of the Children’s Saint. Founding MUMBAM was a key step in our plan to give our city a permanent exhibition-museum-workshop, entirely dedicated to St. Nicholas and the Children.

 

Che cosa Ti aspetta nel MUNBAM?

Ospitato nel Castello Svevo di Bari, un monumento imponente per dimensioni e importanza storica, MUNBAM conterrà oggetti da tutto il mondo, provenienti da collezioni private come quelle dello storico barese Nino Lavermicocca, del Reverendo inglese James Rosenthal, dello svizzero Hans Peter Rust, del belga Marcel Janssens, dell’olandese Marcus Vankan. Ciascuna delle sue cinque sale sarà allestita seguendo una precisa traccia narrativa/interattiva:

 

What to expect at MUNBAM? 

Hosted at the Swabian Castle in Bari, a monument whose sheer size and historical importance set it apart, MUNBAM will contain objects from around the world, from private collections like those of Bari historian Dino Lavermicocca, of English Reverend James Rosenthal, of Hans Peter Rust from Switzerland, Belgium’s Marcel Janssens, and Dutchman Marcus Vankan. Each of the five rooms will have its own narrative/interactive track:

 

“Ti Ascolto” è la sezione dedicata alla storia di San Nicola e alle sue storie, ai suoi miracoli e alle leggende tramandate nei secoli.

“I listen to you”is the section on the history of St. Nicholas and the stories, miracles and legends that have been handed down over the centuries.

 

“Ti leggo” verrà riservata alle “tradizionali letterine” con promesse e desideri dai bambini di tutto il mondo

“I read you” will be reserved for the traditional “letters” to the Saint containing promises and desires from children all over the world

 

“Ti mangio” riguarderà le tradizioni culinarie tipiche delle feste dedicate al santo

“I eat you” will cover the culinary traditions typical of festivals dedicated to the Saint

 

“Ti gioco” avrà per tema giochi e giocattoli delle feste di San Nicola

“I play you” will be based on the theme of toys and games associated with Saint Nicholas festivals

 

“Ti re-invento” sarà infine la parte più creativa del museo. Un laboratorio in cui bambini di diverse età saranno liberi di esprimersi e di dare la loro versione di San Nicola sotto la guida degli animatori.

Finally, “I re-invent you” will be the most creative part of the museum. A workshop where children of different ages will be free to express and to present their own version of St. Nicholas, under the guidance of the animators.

 

Che cosa otterrai sostenendo il MUNBAM? 

Fare una donazione al donatore per antonomasia non è certo un’occasione che capita tutti i giorni. Anche perché San Nicola non ama essere ricompensato in alcun modo per la sua generosità, che è per definizione anonima e gratuita. Ce lo ricorda uno specifico episodio della sua vita, dal quale deriva il simbolo delle tre sfere dorate. Ognuna di esse rappresenta infatti il dono fatto dal Santo alle tre figlie di un padre caduto in miseria. Per tre notti Nicola, erede di una grande ricchezza, gettò di nascosto nella loro in casa un sacco di monete d’oro. Ciascuna delle fanciulle ebbe così la dote per maritarsi, sfuggendo alla miseria e alla prostituzione. Scoperto dal padre ansioso di ringraziare il suo benefattore, San Nicola gli fece giurare di mantenere il segreto finché fosse rimasto in vita. Nacque così la figura del misterioso dispensatore di doni che s’intrufola nottetempo nelle case per fare felici i bambini. Per essere coerenti con i suoi principi, non ti offriremo alcun vantaggio tangibile in cambio del tuo sostegno al MUNBAM. Possiamo invece dirti quel che diventerai: un aiutante di San Nicola in piena regola, con tanto di attestato che ti verrà consegnato dall’associazione Myrabilia. E insieme a questo, naturalmente, riceverai un immenso grazie da parte nostra, dei piccoli e grandi visitatori del MUNBAM e in ultimo, ma non per ultimo, di San Nicola o, se preferisci, di Babbo Natale.

 

What will you get by supporting MUNBAM? 

Donating to the donor par excellence is certainly not an opportunity you get every day. That’s also true because St. Nicholas doesn’t like being rewarded in any way for his generosity, which is by definition anonymous and gratuitous. There is a specific episode from his life that reminds us of this, and was the origin of the three golden spheres he is associated with. Each sphere represents the gift which Nicholas gave to the three daughters of a man who had fallen on hard times. For three nights, Nicholas, who was heir to great wealth, secretly threw a bag of gold coins into their home. Each of the girls thus had a dowry to get married with, thus escaping poverty and prostitution. Discovered by their father, who couldn’t wait to thank his benefactor, St. Nicholas made him swear to keep the secret as long as he lived. That gave rise to the legend of the mysterious dispenser of gifts who sneaks into houses at night to make children happy. In compliance with his principles, we won’t be offering you any tangible benefits in exchange for your support for MUNBAM. However, we can assure you that it will make you a full-blown St. Nicholas’s assistant, as proven by a certificate that will be sent to you by the Myrabilia association. And together with this, of course, you will be receiving many thanks on our part, from visitors young and old to MUNBAM and last but not least, from San Nicola or, if you prefer, from Santa Claus.

That’s also true because St. Nicholas doesn’t like being rewarded in any way for his generosity, which is by definition anonymous and gratuitous. There is a specific episode from his life that reminds us of this, and was the origin of the three golden spheres he is associated with. Each sphere represents the gift which Nicholas gave to the three daughters of a man who had fallen on hard times. For three nights, Nicholas, who was heir to great wealth, secretly threw a bag of gold coins into their home. Each of the girls thus had a dowry to get married with, thus escaping poverty and prostitution. Discovered by their father, who couldn’t wait to thank his benefactor, St. Nicholas made him swear to keep the secret as long as he lived. That gave rise to the legend of the mysterious dispenser of gifts who sneaks into houses at night to make children happy. In compliance with his principles, we won’t be offering you any tangible benefits in exchange for your support for MUNBAM. However, we can assure you that it will make you a full-blown St. Nicholas’s assistant, as proven by a certificate that will be sent to you by the Myrabilia association. And together with this, of course, you will be receiving many thanks on our part, from visitors young and old to MUNBAM and last but not least, from San Nicola or, if you prefer, from Santa Claus.

story:
Short Summary

Short Summary

Artists Residency programs are very important communal spaces and networks for artists, thinkers, critics, "artivists", activists, writers, researchers and many more to deliberate and contemplate on their own practices, forms and medium in spirits of creation, reproduction, experimentation and processing. Currently, most artist residencies take place in European, American, and Asian nations, while African nations (including Ghana) support few residencies across the continent.  Yet the art-world is aware that African nations are vibrant sites of creative and artistic production, experimental projects and cultural hub. With the pIAR residency, we hope to establish an African based residency where artists from within and outside of the continent are invited to exclusively concentrate on  performative art projects, collaborations and cross-pollinating conversations. pIAR was thus established to bring artists from all over the world to experience, explore, exploit and refigure the vibrant artistic and cultural winds blowing over Africa continent with Ghana in focus.  It aims to create and expand local and international networks for many emerging and established artists who could share their individual and collective experiences and knowledge

 

perfocraZe International Artist Residency- [pIAR]

perfocraZe International Artist Residency- [pIAR] hosted by “crazinisT artisT studiO” is an interdisciplinary artists' program and a performance ‘hatchery’. It serves as an incubator, laboratory and an interactive platform for artists, activists, researchers, curators and thinkers to develop and engage with one another in a rich variety of artistic research projects. The studio is located in the hub of Kumasi, the second largest city of Ghana and the capital of Ashanti Kingdom.

pIAR has been designed as a site and point of contact for promoting cultural exchange between international and local performers, interactive artists and film/video/photography artists. Participants are encouraged to explore the contemporary spirit and rituals of performativity in multigenerational societies and cultures, as well as questions of race and politics, especially through performance art, installations, music, video, and film/moving images. The residency runs from January to end of August each year. We invite and accept proposals from international and local artists to stay and develop their projects over a period of  4 weeks. By focusing on processes and projects rather than products, we encourage collaborative relationship between local and international practitioners while sharing experiences through discussions, research, workshops, presentations, lectures and experimental performative/participatory works. Projects developed in the residency will be eligible for exhibition at Chale Wote Art Festival, Alliance Francaise, public spaces, schools and other alternative art spaces.

 

Our focus is on performativity while aiming to merge contemporary art, culture and the people through collaborative practices.

   Screenshot: http://manhyiapalace.org/  (The seat of the Asantehene)

 

The Ashanti Kingdom is full of performative expressions, rituals,  festivals and artistic cultures that we believe our artists in residence will gain from collaborating with the people and learning from the cultural experiences.

"I believe performance is an embodiment of life, perhaps subtle but intensive and ephemeral, which could provide an intimate dialogue between the performer/s and the audience (co-performers). It is important using performance as a potent medium to re-examine our own colonial and post colonial history from dynamic experiences and views." crazinisT artisT

reThinking-naZa, performance by crazinisT artisT

(performing at the Asogli Traditional Yam Festival, Ho Ghana)

 

 

Selected Artists for pIAR 2019

Artists in Residence 2019-Sample Portfolio

 

Your donations will directly support the residents and the running of pIAR 2019

Due to our logistical  inability to fully fund our diverse and talented selection of participants, we are appealing to our audience, fans, organisation, art enthusiasts and the general public for gap funding. With this gap funding, pIAR 2019 will be able to move forward and enhance Kumasi and surrounding regions with an influx of creative energies, projects, and dialog from fellow artists from all over the world. Without this support, the residency program will require participating artists  to host themselves, unduly weighting the pool of participants to non-African participants from wealthier nations. We would be glad to accept any contributions so that the program can run effectively and encourage this critical cultural project of artistic development and cultural exchange.

 

What we have already achieved:

  • We rented a six bedroom house with a large open space.
  • We painted all rooms
  • We recruited volunteers to assist and work with the selected artists
  • We renovated the common spaces - bathroom, bedrooms, living room and kitchen
  • Now we're working on the movable wardrobes for each room.
  • In few days Vodafone will complete the installation of new wifi

 

 

 What We Need for pIAR 2019: 

Breakdown detail for over 20 artists from January to August:

  • Travel Cost for artists from African countries who could not afford their travel expenses (Zimbabwe _1, Nigeria_4, Cameroon_2 and Togo_1). Artists coming from outside Africa are advised to seek for funding from alternative organisations for their return flights
  • 6 new beds to be purchased for the newly rented apartments: We have already spent a great deal of funds to rent a large  new space for the residency. We are working on painting, furnishing and equipping the rooms for convenient stay but yet to purchase comfortable mattresses for each room.
  • Feeding of artist and interns daily: Though cost of living in Ghana is not so high it will best to reduce any financial burden on the participating artist and interns by providing them with daily meal should we hit our goal.
  • Material costs: We will be able to cover reasonable production and research cost for artists in residency should we hit our full campaign target.
  • Utilities (Wifi, Gas, Water, Electricity): It will be important for constant internet availability and access to facilitate research and internet activities for the artists. We are on prepaid electricity system that required regular loading of credit for usage.
  • Organising Artist Talk, Public Presentations and Workshops: We understand the financial commitments in organising these activities that demand the provision of refreshment (water, drinks, snacks) and printing of materials.

How can you help?

There are many ways for you to contribute to this project and each of the possibilities would be of great help!

BACK our campaign - You could choose to donate to this campaign by clicking the BACK IT BUTTON at the TOP RIGHT of the page and become part of making it reality!

Share it - You could also share this page by using the Indiegogo share tools and help the project to reach more people!

 

If you are an artist or are interested in our residency, please feel free to contact us at

info@crazinistartist.com or perfocraze@gmail.com   We would be more than happy to talk with you about the process, the past and mostly about the future of pIAR.

Please check our website:

pIAR

 

 

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to share this campaign!

 
 
 
 
All Photos credited to the ARTISTS
(Links to their profile and website will be available soon)

story:
The Story

Since its beginning in 2010, the Graffiti of War Project has been working tirelessly documenting rarely seen art created by veterans, local nationals, and even civilians specifically originating in Iraq, Afghanistan, and Kuwait.  Through our outreach efforts, thousands of images have poured in from all corners of the world submitted via our website and social-media pages. As the interest exploded, project founder, Jaeson Doc Parsons, a former combat medic, traveled to Iraq and Kuwait to document as much as possible before they were destroyed following the withdrawal of Coalition Forces.

This tour will feature the artwork we captured through our expedition overseas which we are presenting on unconventional mediums (Graffiti Canvas) and in astonishing sizes. Many of these murals were created in excess of 40 feet by 20 feet. A truly extraordinary event providing a unique perspective on conflicts which have affected the entire world since September 11th, 2001.

The ultimate aim for this project is to raise awareness for those men and women, soldier and civilian that suffer the silent wounds of war, PTSD & TBI. Our goal is to promote and advance alternative therapies for these unseen wounds such as arts therapy. We believe this book and the tour will be a bridge over the ever-widening gap between military members and civilians providing healing for both the artist and the spectator. Proceeds from every book and piece of art sold will go directly to partnering organizations to help them fund alternative therapies for PTSD.

The Tour will kick off this year Memorial Day Weekend at Canvas Tattoo & Art Gallery in Charlotte, NC.

The Impact

As this war continues, our nation has become silently divided, the widening divide between soldier and civilian grows with each year. It has become more and more difficult to understand the life and trials of a deployed soldier and their family. Although most Americans support our brave men and women, they don’t grasp the magnitude of what effect this conflict and subsequent deployments have on the families as well as the mind and soul of the soldier. 

In documenting and showcasing these images created by soldiers, marines, and airmen as well as local nationals in Iraq and Afghanistan, our aim is to give a unique glimpse into the minds of those who endured these conflicts. To provide America an inside look at what has gone almost entirely unseen to the vast majority of the public. Many of these images are raw and created in the moment on unconventional canvases in a very unconventional war. Exhibiting this artwork will help civilians get a better understanding of how it is to be separated from family, to lose one of your own in a blink of an eye, to get a feel, a taste of what 15 months fighting a very unpopular war is like. To bring understanding to Americans not familiar with the emotions of war.

Risks & Challenges

The bold ambitions and objectives of this Project, like anything worthwhile, will not be accomplished without a price, and the burden of our short-term and long-term goals are too much for our team to shoulder alone if we are to ensure the resounding success of what we have set out to achieve.  

These needs are not ours, but the needs of those brave warriors, this Nation’s citizen soldiers, who were affected by the conflicts of our world.  They willingly answered with service and sacrifice to a Nation that called, and now we united citizens of that Nation must answer the call to help these wounded warfighters in return.  This project is committed to that mission, and we are searching for individuals and organizations throughout the U.S. and the world that are ready to stand with us in that commitment . . . Semper Fidelis.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially that's ok! There are various ways to assist in The Graffiti of War Project’s mission such as supporting our efforts to spread the word on social media to anyone and everyone. You can simply use IndieGoGo's Share Tools and forward our campaign to those who might want to contribute.

For those interested in knowing more about the Graffiti of War Project, our mission, the 2019 expedition and book tour contact info@graffitiofwar.com.  More information can also be found on our websites at www.WallsofWar.com as well as www.GraffitiofWar.com.

story:
The COVID-19 pandemic has been an unprecedented experience in our lives. Art is now more important than ever to help ease our separations and emphasize the values of being connected, especially in response to the negative impacts that have been caused by social distancing.

 

I need your help! I am creating a documentary about the effects of the pandemic in my local community, using the medium of watercolors. This project aims to be a journalistic and anthropological account of this crisis, documented through live-painted watercolors of real people and real locations. 

 

The finished documentary will be published in the form of a book titled: Soul Journal - Pandemic 2020. My hope is that as the world begins to recover, the project will capture the collective resilience of overcoming these difficult times.

 

 

* Full disclosure: This project will be ONLY created while running essential errands alone or with family, such as during grocery shopping or getting gas. I am able to paint people from a very far distance - sometimes up to a several hundred feet away, and will often remain within a vehicle.

The process of creation will be backed by photo/video/and time-lapse recordings.

 

Funding

 

I am hope to raise $1100 in funds for this campaign, which will go to the following costs:

  • Painting materials - $50
  • Photography & video - $100
  • Post production - $200+
  • Prototyping - $50
  • Book printing - $100+
  • Shipping - $60+
  • Transportation - $80+
  • Marketing & distribution - $200+
  • Approximately 30% of funds raised will go toward paying platform fees and federal & state taxes.
  • 10% of all contributions will also go to Global Giving's Corona Relief Fund, a charitable organization helping vulnerable communities with long-term relief and recovery during this crisis. I will donate these funds no matter or not I reach my final campaign goal.

 

People who contribute over a certain amount can opt to get a copy of the book when it’s complete! Softcover, hardcover, signed & unsigned versions will be available. You can also choose to add on my upcoming Soul Journal - New York City - Independence 2019 book to your collection!

 

Who am I?

 

I am a nomadic artist who paints different communities of various cultures. All my are paintings are done real-time and on-location, using only a pocket travel journal and a portable watercolor set.

 

I have already published multiple Soul Journal watercolor documentaries of festival communities. I have also completed a successful Kickstarter campaign that helped me travel to NYC create a book about the people New York City - The book is currently in post production and will be available soon.

 

 

Follow the progress of the book here and on my Instagram and Facebook pages!

IG: @edihsu 

FB: @edihsu.art

story:
Cat's Cradle is the first art piece brought to Midburn festival by a Russian team. It is a metaphor of a human connection with other people and the Universe, even if the whole life they we try to create our own cocoon, shelter to hide from the rest of the world.
It was built it in Israel and here were ask every person, who enjoyed the art piece or feels connected to this idea, to help us.

The philosophy behind

Everyone of us, consciously or not, creates his own cocoon. Our own case, space to hide from the world. But this shelter never can be totally separated: the threads we use to create it are connected with the surrounding world and other people.

They can be obvious or almost intangible, but every time we are hiding in our cocoon, it’s impossible for us not to feel them. Our art piece is a model of this connection. You can see it from the outside, but when you climb inside the cocoon – you will feel it. And that our own small world is not only connected to the big one, but also affects it.


How Cat's Cradle looks like

4 wooden palms connected with each other by threads, like in a game called ‘Cat’s cradle’. Some of the threads have cocoons hanged on them. Anyone can climb inside cocoons to swing, rest or meditate. Movement of each of them will make others to move also, because of that connection they have.
The art piece was open the whole day and night for everyone to rest, swing a little, watch stars and enjoy this feeling of connection with the whole Universe...

The Goal and what the money will go to

Our goal is $3000. Apart from the cost of the materials we need for the construction, as a foreign team, we experienced some extra costs, such as workshop and accommodation, also tools we could not afford to bring with us and the logistics of the art piece from workshop to the Festival. It was build with the money we collected within our team and with the help of Burning Man Russia, but that still keeps us in a quite tangible debt. And here, we need some extra help.

But this help will be extra rewarded – you can check the perks we’ve prepared for those, who wants to become a part of this adventurous journey.

The team

This is not our first project for festivals. At Burning Man we built the art piece called Cradle of Mir in 2013, Russian library and Bolshoi Theater in 2014, Own Way artwork in 2015 and The Moment (aka The Russian egg) for AfrikaBurn in 2016. And in 2017 we want to become a part of Midburn Festival in Israel.

We are in real need of the generous support of crowdfunders – of all of you who may themselves already climbed inside cozy Cat's Cradle cocoons, anyone who appreciates our vision and enjoyed that this idea became real.

Even the smallest contribution will be the great help for us. Even if you can not donate money, send us a message about your Cat's Cradle experience, that also cheers us up a lot!:) here you can find us: https://www.facebook.com/theownway/

Our art piece is about connection and mutual influence. And your help will become a part of the idea itself.

 

Rewards

We've prepared many gifts for those, who want to help our project. They all are made will love by Own Way team members and we hope you will enjoy the one you choose.

Special thanks for marvellous photos to Quentin Crestinu and Own Way team members.

And in 2017 we want to become a part of Midburn Festival in Israel.We are in real need of the generous support of crowdfunders – of all of you who may themselves already climbed inside cozy Cat's Cradle cocoons, anyone who appreciates our vision and enjoyed that this idea became real.Even the smallest contribution will be the great help for us. Even if you can not donate money, send us a message about your Cat's Cradle experience, that also cheers us up a lot!:) here you can find us: https://www.facebook.com/theownway/Our art piece is about connection and mutual influence. And your help will become a part of the idea itself. RewardsWe've prepared many gifts for those, who want to help our project. They all are made will love by Own Way team members and we hope you will enjoy the one you choose.Special thanks for marvellous photos to Quentin Crestinu and Own Way team members.

story:
FREE MADE FOR A CITY SERIES 01 PRINT WITH EACH ORDER

 

WORN OUT - LondonBaby Series 01 Totes

Keep it short. Where am I? Rudeboys, Royals, Residents. Docks, Deliveries, Cash in hand. North, Thames, South. Stick it on a bag and you'll never need the Tube.

MEET THE NEIGHBOURS

Reaching out beyond the art gallery. And connecting people to new artists, and new works of art LondonBaby is an art, design and apparel label launching this Autumn, all about coming together and creative collaboration. 

Kicking things off with a series of specially commissioned artist's prints and Totes, we've teamed up with London art curating duo Brains & Lips to create a broad and varied set of portraits of the city. Twenty works were created by a talented mix of London artists. Artists we like you to know, discover and enjoy.

Each of the artists featured in our Series 01 prints we're asked to provide a piece of work that sums up their unique view on the capital. In the spirit of old skool album cover art, each print is 12" x 12" in size. With key words selected by LondonBaby added to each image.  The end  result is a series of mini billboard-like pieces of art that can be held in the hand, framed or placed anywhere in home or office.

Affordable art

For LondonBaby costs should not get in the way of people owning a great piece of art. And our artworks, printed to a high quality and matt laminated for durability genuinely offer great value not found elsewhere. In regards to artistic value, LondonBaby hopes your choice of prints will give you a lifetime viewing pleasure.

Our Indiegogo campaign target will cover the production of  just 25 xf 20 Series 01 prints. With  three specially designed LondonBaby Tote bags that come with each print also included. 

Made for a city that wears it well

LondonBaby is an idea and a label that couldn't of happened without the help and contribution from an amazing community of artists, friends and family. It is an idea brought to you by born East Londoner and Art Director Gary Alake Riley. And is curated by Alice Steffen and Claire Orme of Brains & Lips. Your backing to our Indiegogo campaign is  all part of bigger collaboration and mission to bring something special to the streets of London and beyond. We thank you greatly for support and interest. And we look forward to keeping you up to date with how our campaign and exciting launch activity is going. 

Thank you

LondonBaby

story:
I’m Sarah Treharne, an artist currently living and working in New Jersey. I went to Mason Gross School of the Arts at Rutgers University, where I graduated in 2014 with a concentration in painting. Since then I have attended residencies such as Chautauqua Institution (both in 2015 and 2017), as well as receiving a fellowship for the Vermont Studio Center.

Recently, I’ve been selected to attend the international artist residency, Can Serrat in El Bruc, Barcelona, Spain. This is an amazing opportunity, and I am beyond excited to see how the duration of this residency shapes my work, as well as contributing to my growth and development as an artist. Going to Can Serrat would allow me to be a part of a tight knit community of artists from all over the world with different backgrounds and experiences.

Residencies are amazing outlets for artists to focus solely on research, experimentation, and production. They’re centered around the studio; to work on just your art, see what happens in the studio without the daily distractions you run into at home, plus the added benefit of doing it in Spain! Attending this residency would mean getting insight, critical feedback, and participating in discussions around views of art and world politics from a supportive community of other artists. My art and practice would be enriched and influenced immensely by this program.

I want to use the time and beautiful studio space provided by Can Serrat to continue to develop, research, and experiment with my art. I want to take advantage of the culture, space, colors, art, and life in Spain. The location of the residency would allow me to visit multiple museums and galleries, taking in an immense amount of art history in nearby Barcelona, as well as Madrid.

I’m currently interested in the idea of vanity and publicized glamour, specifically discussed in John Berger’s book and TV series, “Ways of Seeing.” Between the studio time and surrounding museums, Can Serrat would be an excellent place to begin this series of paintings. I’m interested in using my own body and personal perspective, as well as painting your average blow up “Judy” doll in place of Venetian goddesses or women of wealth in these satirical paintings. I want to play with gaze, the concept of who this “vanity” is actually working for, as well as representation of women and how it continues in mainstream culture today.

These paintings relate to another project I want to begin, based around Instagram/blog photographers, and this new wave “Renaissance” idea of representation of women as art. This project and research plays with the debate of the male gaze, representation of women, the nude, and what makes something "art.” At Can Serrat I plan to continue researching and developing the parameters for this project, and to experiment with whether painting or another medium will function best.

The funding I’m asking for covers the cost of the residency (1140 Euros), airport shuttle (100E), and estimated cost for the flight ($1000), plus the Indiegogo percentage (5% if funds fully raised-8%partial). Anything extra that comes from this campaign will go to extra travel costs (bus and train tickets to Barcelona and Madrid), materials (paints, paper, canvas, etc.), and food. Everything donated to this campaign will go to getting me to Spain. In the event I don’t raise a substantial amount and can not attend, the money raised will go back into my art for studio and supply costs.

In return, I’m offering a range of perks! From social media shout outs, thank you notes with personal photographs from my trip, art cards, prints, studio sketches, and more! Check them out!

By contributing to this campaign, you will help me get to El Bruc, Spain! This will allow me to focus on my practice, continue to experiment in the studio, and question my processes. Working in a community of other artists will help me to think critically about my decisions, step back and reevaluate.

This is the first time that I will be traveling to Europe, and what better way to do it than spend 4 weeks making art in a creative community! I've had to turn down study abroad opportunities in the past, and don't wish to do the same for this residency. Can Serrat is a beautiful non profit program that promotes “art production focused on contemporary practices and research.” All the funds go directly back into the residency for grants, maintaining the grounds, studios, etc. so it's money well spent!

The risk and challenges with this project are financial. Neither the residency, nor the cost of travel, supplies, or living are paid for. With short notice of being accepted, I am having difficulty coming up with the necessary funds to cover the deposit, flight, residency amount, and estimated costs while abroad. On top of bills such as student loans and car payments, paired with costs of graduate applications and visits, this is not an easy amount to cover.

This is an amazing opportunity to travel, and work in a beautiful location in Spain. If I can't raise the necessary funds to attend, I will lose out on my deposit and travel. I’ve never used a crowd funding source before, but I hope that this first experience is a great and successful one! Please help me achieve this goal!

Thank you!
