story:
In Short, What We're Doing:

We've got a crazy idea to build something beautiful for a couple weeks this summer with a curated group of other young people... sort of like an artist's residency, social experiment, exercise in community and intellectual exchange, and more.

We've finalized the group and location, and just need to close out some funding.

In order to make this happen, we need your support. We're raising $5,000 to help fund the program (which will cover materials, transportation, and hefty scholarships to the program).

We know this project must be birthed this summer -- the moment is NOW. With your help, we'll turn this glorious dream into an even more glorious reality.

Here's the vision...

Ethos

Circulate is 2.5-week-long experimentation in radical sharing, anti-hierarchical leadership, and art-making between a uniquely selected group of 7 poc/queer strangers (aged 19-23) excited by and dedicated to anti-conformity, presence, and collective dreaming. We will all live together in a house in upstate NY, and each resident will have an established creative project to start and finish during their stay. “Weekdays” (Mon-Thu) will be structured around independent work time, shared meals, and bi-weekly  workshops led by each individual, respectively. “Weekends” (Fri-Sun) surround creative collaboration (each participant has a designated weekend slot wherein other members are made accessible resources for their project); “hive mind” sessions, a space for sharing progress and feedback on everyone’s work; ceremonious meal time; sleep ins; adventuring and release; movie watching, dance parties, leisure time. Circulate creates a space conducive to self-care, processing and reflection, individual and co-evolution, healthy and constructive criticism of each other’s work and of society, life-affirming creation and connection, and whatever other values we define as a collective come our union. By the end of the experience, everyone will have completed and shared their projects with the collective. Some projects may exist only in this space, while others might extend beyond, into the greater world.

Why This is Important RIGHT NOW

 Through Circulate, we strive to unlock those needs, desires, and passions that many of us have felt deprived of throughout COVID-19. The world of Circulate is full of sweat and beating hearts, void of zoom. We are voices, breath and hums. We acknowledge and celebrate humanity. We are our pair of eyes. We are listeners. We are receptive, we are giving, we are sharing a moment. We are sharing many moments. We are sacred, we are miraculous. We are flawed, we act accordingly. In showing up as we are and coming together in a space foreign and unique to us all, we are demanding a pause within the pause of the pandemic. We are inviting and inspiring each other to see and feel and celebrate and mourn and ponder and scream at what this “time” has been, and to directly and proactively pour, offload, purge it all (or any ounce of it) out, and let this teach and reveal something to us. This is a space to exhale our revelations, grievances, toxins, anything inside of us at the time into concrete artwork and passionate community. 

Through communal living and art making, we are challenging our predispositions, concerned with deconstructing assumptions, norms, and routine life practices. We are hard at work, but it is not the clock that keeps us going. We are rested. We are restless! Everything is alive, everything is a teacher, we are classrooms, we are students.

There is an end result. There is also a journey. Both are magnificent. 

Intentional Limitations

We believe there is liberty in limitation. Here are a few things we're setting as guiding principles from the start:

Presence:

We are interested in fresh and raw and right now. This is an opportunity for a dedication to the environment and experience at present that most of us are profoundly NOT used to in our normal lives. We are freezing time together and creating a micro-world, indulging in a fleeting illusion that only we and now exist. Of course, now is a product of the past, and our respective current make-ups have been hyper informed by the recent past (seeping into present, also still going on) i.e. COVID-19. In short -- we are encouraging ourselves to show up AS WE ARE, and to pour whatever that is and means into this time, this community, this masterpiece.

We are fully committed to this time and space, which means no one can be working on anything else while they're here. No side projects, no internships. No phone calls, no virtual communication with the outside world. 

Technology:

No phones or personal computers for the entire time. No WiFi, texting, or online researching. There will be a shared computer and a typewriter for use (writing, editing, etc.). 

We have finite materials:

Anti-excess, anti google rabbit holes; we have a specific amount of resources. We don’t need an infinite web when we are infinite humans. We will each bring books, music, supplies, and create shared libraries of multimedia. There's a general culture of sharing.

This is what we know for now. Everything else is coevolving with the group.

Who's Behind This?

We are Lola Lafia (20) and Amira Stone (22). We’re friends, co-creators, co-dreamers. 

A lot of our friendship and partnership has existed across space and time. Covid was an ultimate example of this, as we were both jumping between different worlds, observing, feeling and creating amidst the insane happenings of 2020. We managed to reflect and dream together via spontaneous phone calls, email, and other web-spaces, until we saw that there was something urgent and fervent here demanding our attention. We were like... we’re asking such similar questions and longing for such similar things, but we are worlds apart. Why? Let’s do something about this. We took what we’ve experienced this year, and years before, carved out a tiny piece from the middle of this encompassing venn diagram, and started building something together. We discovered that a breathing, multi-dimensional project would be the best medium: an environment that we are fostering together, with others. An experimental ground, a real time living white board. From this, Circulate emerged. 

Circulate is just one iteration of the kinds of spaces, projects and communities we hope to foster and engage with for the rest of our lives. In birthing it into existence, we hope we inspire others to do the same. We dream of Circulate-esque experiences everywhere, always.

But who are we?

Lola Lafia - Who am I?! Gosh. Well, I’m from Brooklyn, spent two years studying Architecture/Computer Science at Columbia, left school in fall 2020 and moved to California. I spent three months living on a property with 20 other women (that I’d never met before) who all decided to be a part of our quasi-think-tank/tech-incubator/college alternative and work on our own projects. In December, I moved to San Francisco and have been living in intentional communities around the city (giant houses with 12 adults where everyone has their own room but shares everything else - not just food and bathrooms, but conversations, salons, workshops, projects, using our shared space as a prototype for how we want to organize and socialize and make decisions). I also run Schefs (a platform for young people like us to lead and join in on intimate, themed conversations on topics of their choice - from climate change to consciousness), intersperse performance art into my daily life, and put on dining experiences with my 15 year old brother.

Amira Stone - Hello hello hello! I’m from Minnesota, but I mostly grew up at summer camp in Northwoods Wisconsin. It’s what formed and solidified most of my character, passions and obsessions. Like… I love community solitude, getting my hands dirty, writing and receiving and never throwing away handwritten notes and letters, radical presence and sharing, book-making, sisterhood, passionate dialogue in magical but uncomfortably warm rooms (body heat, poor ventilation), storytelling and table-pounding and general mischief. It all circles back to this little sphere of grass and lake where phones don’t exist, rules are made to be broken, and college-aged students are your authority figures. This environment instilled in me a relentless and perpetual desire to learn, grow and engage in community, and to create spaces of my own. And ah, here we are. I observe, process and generate through filmmaking, traveling, writing, romance, movement, cooking, and of course, there’s more, more and more. I’m currently living in NYC, working at a k-12 school where my job is mostly to make sure kids don’t tackle each other, and to remind them to say ‘thank you’. I’m on a gap year from NYU Tisch, where I study film and Spanish.

How will we use your contributions? 

Donations will help cover the cost of materials for the group + everyone's individual projects (sculptures, installations, paintings, etc.), transportation to and from location, part of the lodging, and scholarships for those attending.

Connection to Schefs

Circulate is a subproject of Schefs, a platform started by Lola in February 2020, for college students to lead and join in on intimate conversations of topics of their choice, with a larger mission of instilling depth and bravery in young people, inspiring casual intellectual collisions of the mind. Check it out here:

www.schefs.us

Thank you for taking the time to read about us, and for considering a donation. We believe so deeply in this project and its timing. Your contributions make possible the success of Circulate.

Donations will help cover the cost of materials for the group + everyone's individual projects (sculptures, installations, paintings, etc.), transportation to and from location, part of the lodging, and scholarships for those attending.
Connection to Schefs
Circulate is a subproject of Schefs, a platform started by Lola in February 2020, for college students to lead and join in on intimate conversations of topics of their choice, with a larger mission of instilling depth and bravery in young people, inspiring casual intellectual collisions of the mind. Check it out here:
www.schefs.us
Thank you for taking the time to read about us, and for considering a donation. We believe so deeply in this project and its timing. Your contributions make possible the success of Circulate.

story:
In February 2020 I am attending a residency in India and I need your help to make it a success!

Who Is Shamira:

I am a full-time interdisciplinary visual artist based in Indianapolis, IN.

What Shamira Makes:

I create minimal abstract art that explores the repeat patterns of textiles. My work alludes to the storytelling qualities found in narrative textiles and objects across the African Diaspora. Fusing similarities in the language of graphic design, textiles, furniture, and architecture, my compositions express impressions left by the contemporary domestic, built, and natural landscape.

‘How Does Your Garden Grow?: Studies in Pattern and Decoration’

Installation, Gouache on paper mounted to wood panel

How You Can Help:

In February 2020 I'm taking a journey to New Delhi, India for a 3-week international artist residency with Art for Change. In order to make this trip a success, contributions will go towards travel and residency costs, and art materials.

'Diaspora 1' & 'Diaspora 2'

Gouache on rust printed fabric

Why This Matters:

While in India, I and a handful of international artists and mentors will collaborate around the theme ‘What to Do with Difference? - Art and Artist as Bridge’ while making artwork inspired by the cultural exchange.

When I return I will make a new series of prints and paintings resulting from the journey from Indiana to India that will be exhibited locally in September 2020. Indiegogo donors will receive an early release print or painting as a thank you for their contribution.

I would love to have the opportunity to experience the cultural exchange that will happen from my first time traveling outside of the U.S. and I would like to bring the stories from my journey back home to Indiana by sharing them through art. All of the wonderful experiences from traveling will add fresh new flavor to my work, and help me think about ways to continue to build a smart sustainable art practice. This trip will be empowering to me as an artist because it will expand my horizons and imagination, and to you as a donor as you contribute to the local arts culture.

Ways to Help:

Purchase early release artwork inspired by this journey, here on Indiegogo!

Share this project with friends!

A tax-deductible contribution can be mailed to Shamira made out to the 'Harrison Center (fiscal agent) in care of Shamira Wilson'

Thank you in advance for your contribution!

‘Interchange’

Gouache on rust printed linen

 

Learn more about Shamira:

shamirawilson.com

Instagram:@shamirawilson

 Facebook:@shamirawilsonart

story:
Summary of the project and why it's important

My name is Valery, I live in Latvia and one year ago I started my business in organic balloon garlands (balloon installations). One day I saw a cool artistic decoration from balloons and fell in love with it forever. I thought “Wow, this is incredible! I also want to know how to make it”. I tried to find information online on how to make this kind of balloon decor and couldn’t find anything. But my aspiration to make balloon decorations was way stronger and I applied for many live workshops in different countries. I spent a lot of time and money on travelling, visa and the workshops themselves. 

It’s been a year since I started my business in Balloon Installations and now I feel experienced enough to create an online platform for everyone, no matter where they live - it will be possible to learn how to make these trendy and beautiful organic balloon garlands. 

Balloon installations is one of the most demanded and popular kind of decoration. I truly believe that my online school will help people easily learn how mo make creative balloon decor and even start making money on it. 

What We Need & What You'll Get

To open an online school, I need:

  • Buy the materials to film how to make different balloon installations - 900€ 
  • Platform for my website - 240€
  • Domain name - 10€
  • Find a filmmaker to film videos - 200€ per day (6 days of shooting = 1200€)
  • Rent a studio to shoot all the videos - 100€ per day (6 days of shooting = 600€)
  • Pay for editing all the videos - 600€ 
  • Run ads and pay for promotions - 800€ (Ads on Facebook, Google Adwords)
  • Website design and coding - 600€

 

There is a great reward for you. Contributing and helping me at this stage means a lot to me. Those who donate 50€ will get a video from me where I’ll show you how to put together a balloon garland. Those who donate 200€ or more will get access to the full online school. Those who donate more than 500€ will get the full access to the online school and 1:1 personal support and feedback from me over 2 months after finishing the courses.

The Impact on the world

I am sure that my online school will help people easily learn how to make trendy organic balloon garlands no matter where they live. It means that more people will start to create beauty, they will be able to decorate their families’ events or start a business in this industry. 

I truly believe that beauty will save the world. The think that social improvements can occur through the creation of beauty in the material world. And I'm sure you noticed how your emotions change when you get into a beautiful space, where you see the beauty of nature, when you buy a new beautiful dress or element of decor for your house.

Balloon garlands can have impact on our nature and WORLD. Latex balloon garlands are environment-friendly as they are made of 100% natural and biodegradable balloons and are filled with air. These balloons are not helium-filled (they don’t float) which is another benefit to the world. Nowadays, we have helium gas shortage. This gas is used in much more significant industries than balloons. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether it's a donation or sharing my campaign on Instagram and Facebook, I appreciate it very much.

I would really appreciate if you could follow my Instagram page https://www.instagram.com/ballery.lv/ 

It will definitely motivate me to make more beautiful projects.

story:
Il seme

De Humanitate Florae nasce dall'idea di un gruppo di artisti che ha voluto mettersi alla prova, unire le forze e tentare di realizzare un progetto collettivo unico nel suo genere.
Ci sono tanti libri di botanica, tanti che elencano i significati dei fiori ma nessuno di questi ha umanizzato i fiori stessi, lasciando che siano loro a raccontarsi allo spettatore, svelando il loro linguaggio segreto attraverso gesti ed espressioni.
Aiutati da un team scientifico che si è occupato di controllare sia l'aspetto visivo delle piante che quello iconografico del linguaggio dei fiori in uso nel 1500, gli artisti del gruppo hanno trasformato 53 piante in personaggi unici, affascinanti e inediti.
Grazie a De Humanitate Florae sarà possibile riscoprire leggende, miti, messaggi ed emozioni che da più di 500 anni sono nascosti tra i petali dei fiori.
 

Acqua e sole

Abbiamo lavorato duramente per un anno intero, studiando, ideando e disegnando i fiori uno ad uno, con la cura e l'attenzione che si riserva ad un piccole seme, ed ora abbiamo bisogno di tutti voi per far si che questo piccolo seme germogli e cresca fino a dare i suoi frutti.
Aiutateci a stampare l'artbook con tutte le illustrazioni, ecco di cosa abbiamo bisogno:

  • 1000€ - Costi di stampa e spedizione delle copie cartacee del libro
  • 500€  - Costi e tasse della campagna di crowdfunding
  • 500€ - Costi di stampa e spedizione dei gadget
     

I frutti

Il nostro non sarà solo un libro visivo ma anche didattico: sarà possibile insegnare ai più piccoli come agli adulti, a capire cosa un fiore ha da dire senza bisogno di leggere pagine e pagine di descrizione. Un'immagine resta impressa più di mille parole e sarà divertente conoscere i personaggi, imparare da loro e ricominciare a mandare messaggi di ogni tipo donando un fiore senza bisogno di parole.
Il De Humanitate Florae sarà una preziosa aggiunta alla vostra libreria, un dono elegante per amici e parenti e un simpatico modo di imparare per i più piccini.

Lista delle piante realizzate:

Aconito napello - Lisa "Blumye" Fiorillo
Acero saccari - Laura D'Addazio
Anemone - Paola "Helera” Gallo
Arancio - Agnese “Chiku” Radini
Azalea cinese - Michela “Mikipin” Cieri
Caffè - Zanoni Eliah
Calla - Marta “Blue Riza” Porta
Camelia - Laura D'Addazio
Camelia da tè  - Laura D'Addazio
Camomilla - Debora Rivasi
Campanula - Valentina "Pan Rayuki" Plebani
Cedro - Alessandro Gazzoli
Ciliegio - Elena Liberati
Corbezzolo - Chiara “Kacchan” Atzori
Cotone - Debora Rivasi
Crisantemo - Daniela “Princess Neko” Boselli
Dittamo - Claudia “Yukimoe” Manca
Edera - Giulia "Karasu" Pregnolato
Elleboro - Lisa "Blumye" Fiorillo
Erica - Claudia “Yukimoe” Manca
Fiordaliso - Michela “Michiyo” Bari
Gardenia - Tamara “Moontears” Venuto
Garofano frangiato - Silvia “Bess” Bessero
Garofano rosso - Silvia “Bess” Bessero
Gelso - Daniela “Princess Neko” Boselli
Giacinto - MissChroma
Giglio - MEGA-NE
Ginko - Michela “Michiyo” Bari
Girasole - Melissa Falconi
Glicine - Daniela “Princess Neko” Boselli
Grano - Alessandro Gazzoli
Ibisco - Giada Hisui
Ipomea - Tamara “Moontears” Venuto
Loto - Lisa "Blumye" Fiorillo
Magnolia - Tamara “Moontears” Venuto
Mimosa - Riccardo Giardina
Mirtillo - Giulia Frankie Riva
Mughetto - Maria Luisa “semiino” Petrarca
Narciso - Elena Liberati
Ninfea - Michela “Michiyo” Bari
Nocciolo - Zanoni Eliah
Orchidea - Rosalba Palombini
Palma - Marta “Blue Riza” Porta
Papavero bianco - Elena Liberati
Pervinca blu - Chiara “Bimi” Cannistrà
Pervinca lilla - Chiara “Bimi” Cannistrà
Ranuncolo - Paola "Helera” Gallo
Riso - Chiara “Kacchan” Atzori
Rododendro rosa - Lisa "Blumye" Fiorillo
Rosa rossa - Simone "ChibiOrenji" Catania
Susino - Marga “BlackBanshee” Biazzi
Ulivo - Alessandro Gazzoli
Vite - Alessandro Gazzoli

Logo di copertina di Stefano Gelao

 

Le stagioni

Ci abbiamo messo un anno intero per dare forma al nostro progetto: abbiamo scelto il tema, cercato informazioni, chiesto pareri e studiato tanto. Questo è ciò che rende De Humanitate Florae un progetto unico nel suo genere. Abbiamo realizzato tutte le illustrazioni, aiutandoci a vicenda e migliorandole sempre di più ma ora ci serve il vostro aiuto! Manca solo il vostro contributo per far si che tutto diventi reale.
 

Se non puoi innaffiare, condividi!

Noi abbiamo fatto il possibile per dare alla luce un progetto unico e irripetibile, ma da soli non bastiamo: noi siamo solo 29 ma con voi possiamo diventare una foresta! Se non puoi aiutarci finanziariamente ma ritieni che il nostro progetto meriti di vedere la luce, aiutaci condividendo la nostra campagna e parlando del nostro progetto a chi pensi possa essere interessato. Ogni aiuto è una piccola goccia che può aiutarci a crescere.

story:
Welcome to The Denver Vendor!

 

My name is Brenna Bigelow, and I am a Denver native with two passions: art and investing in my community! After seeing an art vending machine in New Mexico, I was determined to bring the concept to my hometown, but with an emphasis on local charity! Thus, The Denver Vendor was born!

The project began in August of 2019 with the purchase of a vintage candy machine (yes, it still works!). The machine has been sitting in my uncle's backyard in the process of becoming a charitable art installation ever since. We now have over 30 Denver artists that are participating in this project.

Progress has been made, however, because the project has primarily been independently funded by myself, the process has been slower than ideal. This is where you come in! The Denver Vendor team would love to have your financial assistance to speed up the process, and alleviate some of the heavy costs off my shoulders.

 

Cost Breakdown

 

So far, the total cost has been $975.65, and more costs are to come. The current costs include but are not limited to:

  • The machine $100
  • Moving costs $120
  • Paying an artist (fairly!) to paint the machine ($200+ continual cost)
  • A card reader ($446.32)
  • Website ($48)

Expected costs are things such as monthly maintenance, moving costs, setting up the card reader, and more. As you can see, The Denver Vendor needs help from the community (you) so we can give back!

The truth is, no matter how long it's gonna take, I'm determined to launch The Denver Vendor project, so any investment you make will not be lost. I have big dreams for this art installation, and plan to plant as many machines around the Denver-metro area as possible. Ideally, donations will surpass the goal so The Denver Vendor can continue to grow.

 

Perks

 

So what do you get out of it for donating? The most rewarding perk of course is enriching our community, but if you need more incentives, there are a few.

Regardless of the amount, if you donate, you will get first dibs at using the machine at our release party AND you get to deduct that charitable donation on your taxes. Woohoo!

If you donate $30-$49, you will get two free tickets to see The 8-Bit Kids comedy show, any show date of your choice.

$50-$99 you will get the previous prizes AND a free gift-bag full of handmade art.

Any donations over $100 will get all that good stuff previously mentioned, AND your name (or name of your choice) on the machine itself! You will also be listed as one of our sponsors on our website.

 

More Ways to Help

 

Even if you cannot help us financially, we would love your help spreading the word! Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools.

We are still accepting offers from indoor locations that want to host the machine. Ideally, the machine will go somewhere with lots of foot traffic.

If you'd like to learn more about The Denver Vendor, or just want to reach out and say hello, or even to become a Denver Vendor artist, visit us on our website thedenvervendor.com or on our social medias @thedenvervendor.

story:
The ShopArt ArtShop Story

As art enthusiasts, we are intrigued by the immense power of art to cross boundaries, build bridges, offer creative solutions and encourage thought. So when we started ShopArt ArtShop (SAAS) in 2013 with the idea to host a residency+festival in our village, we had no doubt that the project would have an enormous effect on a multitude of levels. Yet we were totally surprised by the huge resonance it created. 

 

The concern of SAAS is that in today's world, art has become a commodity; and so, for art to be relevant again beyond the economic aspect, it needs to be taken out of traditional 'art-spaces' such as art galleries, museums etc. and presented in a totally new and accessible manner.

Which is why we take over all the empty shop-spaces in the Himalayan village, Gunehar, and turn these into open ateliers. We invite artists to present us with ideas about a conceptual art project they would like to create in these 'ArtShops' (hence the name of the project, ShopArt ArtShop-- or SAAS in short). The work need to be relevant (and find acceptance) among local people as well as a broader, art-interested public. We fund the selected artists and their projects by inviting them to the village for a month-long residency that culminates in a week-long, village-wide, FREE art festival.

During the first two editions, we ourselves were surprised by the immense success (15000 visitors!). SAAS-1&2 proved that a well thought-out, process-oriented, fully transparent and open art event has the power to transcend pre-existing notions about rural-urban, traditional-modern, first world-third world preconceptions.

This makes it necessary to continue the effort. So here we are now, shortly before the third edition of the trienniale!

Why this project is unique

Art is universal, but it can only be relevant if it is accessible to the larger public indiscriminately and in a manner that transcends boundaries. The unique 'SAAS-Method for Artists' that we have designed and all our artists must follow is created to overcome barriers between art and public, artist and visitor, poor and rich, city folks and villager. 

SAAS is a triennial, month long event that takes place across the entire village, turning the whole village into an art destination. The first 3 weeks is conducted as an open residency, during which the artists work on their individual projects and visitors/villagers get a chance to follow the work process and, if willing, become assistants or even partners of the artists.

The last week is reserved for the Art-Festival, which is village-wide and is accompanied by music concerts, film screenings, discussions, performances etc. 

The whole event is entirely free for public!

During the last two editions of SAAS, more than 15000 people from all walks of life visited the village! Both editions were also highly praised in national media. 

For an impression of what the news media said, here is a link to one of the articles.

 

The curatorial theme of the current edition

The theme this time around is BORDERLINES. You can read the whole elaboration by following this link, and scrolling down. But let's quote a paragraph from the brief, because it is not only relevant to current, world-wide developments, but a natural thematic point we at SAAS have arrived at:

(The above is a post from our Instagram account. We are relatively new on this site, so it would be lovely if you follow us!

We are also on Facebook.)

THE Artists of SAAS-3 and their projects

After a thorough selection process during which artists from all over India were requested to present a concept that would address the curatorial theme "BORDERLINES", we have finally selected 12 artists. These are: Sultana Zana (Multi Media/Film), Imon Raza (Installation), Pramila Chaudhary (Fashion and Textiles), Sarban Choudhury (Ceramics/Sculptures), Asmita Sarkar (Painting), Amritah Sen (Visual Narratives), KM Lo (Film), Frank Schlichtmann (Installation), Found On All Fours (Story-telling/Performance), Devyani Smith (Ceramics/Installation), Gaurav Gokhale (Documentary) and Yash Sahai (Music).

(For short summaries  of each of the artist's concept for SAAS, please go to our Instagram or Facebook pages.)

Impact of ShopArt ArtShop

-- Promote and revive arts

-- Nurture artistic talent

-- Develop responsible tourism

-- Promote interaction between rural and urban Indian

-- Address and work against aesthetic degradation of public spaces

-- Document artistic and transformation processes

What happens next

Our organisation team will assemble in Gunehar in the first week of May to set the stage. After that, all the artists will arrive on the 14th and will be given quarters across the village. On the 15th, the residency will start. 

Our financial situation

For us, keeping SAAS alive is a responsibility, because SAAS fulfils many necessary functions and giving up now is not an option. It feels like in that case, years of hard work will be wasted!

Despite many difficulties, particularly in regards to funds, we have gone ahead with the planning for this edition. Over the years, we have tried and mostly failed to attract sponsors, government and institutional support, grants and such. This is surely because in India, there is still no appreciation or understanding of the arts and no culture yet of supporting arts and artists. We feel that by keeping up what we do, we can, in the long run, also change this perception.

So far, for our four art events, i.e SAAS - 1 and 2 and IN THE WOODS - 1 and 2, we have spent a total of about 4000000,- Indian Rupees, which is just 55000,- US$.

Out of this, around 20% came from crowdfunding, and only 5% from the State Government. The rest of the budget was raised through Frank's private savings (which are now gone!) and the meagre income of our cafe and mud house guest house.

What we need 

These are the three scenarios:

1) If we can not raise the minimum goal: In this case, we will still go ahead with the residency on a budget-on-strings and will have to compromise heavily on materials, logistics and publicity... and most unfortunately, strike the final festival. Luckily, this campaign is flexible, so whatever you donate will help!

2) If, with your help, we can raise the minimum amount: This will take care of all our requirements. Our total budget requirement for SAAS-3 is 1460000 Indian rupees, or 20857 US$. Indiegogo fees and reserve funds roughly make up an additional 10%! So we need to raise a total of 22857 US$. That is only 1904 US$ per artist/individual art project!

3) If, we end up raising more than the minimum amount: In this case, the extra money raised would go towards our next project, IN THE WOODS-3, in 2020. This is why we will keep this campaign alive on Indiegogo InDemand.

In return for your support, we would like you to uniquely become "ours"

First of all, your support could come in many different ways, not just financially. Everybody who reads these words, shares our campaign or even sends across a few words of encouragement becomes a part of our community, because so far, that is how we have grown. So if you read this and want to volunteer, or offer us some hands-on help during SAAS, or simply come over as a visitor, please do get in touch.

Beyond that, our crowd-funding 'perks' are also designed to make you a part of the project. We want you to remember that you were part of this effort to keep SAAS going.  Please go to the 'perks' section to find out more.

Finally, a word of thanks!

Art is the one truly universal language. It does not matter where one is, a piece of music, literature, an installation, a performance, a painting can inspire people regardless of one's country, belief-system, cultural preferences, politics... across borders! Because we believe in this, we are taking our campaign out to the world and not restricting it to India.

By supporting us in whatever way is possible for you, from wherever you are, you are helping us prove our point and making the world a better, and more inclusive, place for everybody! And by supporting Indian artists, and a village, you are welcoming them into the world with open arms!

We thank you, in these polarising times, for your big, open heart.

story:
Francais plus bas !
PoïZilla is a project by Bow ( professional juggler /// fire performer)
and Metlili ( juggling reporter /// juggler )

The Goal :
 4 days of filming to make a beautiful video of Bow’s last research with Poï juggling , and  a poi juggling tutorial serie for beginners and intermediates ( French and English will be available )
 
To achieve this goal we need you ! A project like this requires lots of investments , the money will be used to pay Metlili’s work , as well as the material needed for the project .

A free set of Poï made by Bow will be given away among one of the +12 dollars donators !

as second price for the best donators we give away a 1 month weekly online workshop with Bow !
French :

PoïZilla est un projet vidéo par Bow ( jongleur) et Metlili ( jongleur et reporter ).

L'objectif : réaliser une vidéo des dernières recherches de Bow en Jonglerie Poï, ainsi qu'une série de tutoriels sur la manipulation de cet agrès, pour debutants et intermédiaires .
 

Pour cela nous avons besoin de votre aide ! Un tel projet demande beaucoup d'investissement, Principalement pour pouvoir payer le travail de Metlili ainsi que le matériel nécessaire à la vidéo . plus de 4 jours de tournage ainsi que 4 jours de montage sont prévus.

Toutes donations au delà de 10 euros reçevra un cadeau ( stickers du projet ).

Les donations au delà de 10 euros seront tirées au sort. Le premier gagnant reçevra un set de Poï par Bow, le deuxième prix sera une formule de Workshop en ligne pour une validité d' un mois.

story:
Leaving a sensible career 10 years ago through redundancy I became a self employed Creative Freedom Coach and then 3 years ago reduced my hours to become a p/t art student.

My current project is a study in textile and print of the effects of a rising tide on Britain's coastlines.  The outcome is a beautiful flowing impact textile piece which will be available to view at the Astound exhibition and a beautiful square format book showcasing the photography from the project.

What We Need & What You Get

My project budget for Ebb & Flow  has come in at £335 and I'm looking for help with that.

Materials for experimentation - £45
Materials for final installation - £30
Initial Printing Costs - Books £100
Printing - photography - £50
Travel to Locations (Coastal project, galleries) - £75
Other costs - £35

All donations no  matter how small - even if its just a pound will be appreciated and for certain donations, you will even be able to choose a perk as a thank you.  Many of the perks are one-off pieces of art created for previous exhibitions.  You'll be the owner of something very unique.

Whilst my art will be on sale at the exhibition, raising the funds now takes the pressure off me having to produce commercial art and I can be true to the project.

Any funds raised over and above the target will be used to print more books.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know not everyone can help financially but perhaps if you come across this campaign you can share it on social media or pass it onto someone who may wish to help - you can share via Indiegogo.

story:
Summary

Does Vladimir Putin have video footage of Donald Trump paying Russian escorts to pee on him or on each other, and is Putin using it as leverage to control Trump? Probably.

We don't know for sure, but it would explain a lot of otherwise inexplicable things.

Even if this footage is never found, would it be amusing to see dogs around the world pee on tiny likenesses of Donald Trump? Definitely.

Additionally, there's a very practical use for the Pee-on-me Trump. If you want to encourage dogs to pee somewhere besides your prized flower bed, just place one of these little guys nearby,  spritz them with a doggy potty-training aid or just a few drops of Windex or other ammonia-based cleaner, and you'll be giving neighborhood hounds a perfectly appropriate place to pee. The Pee-on-me Trump is ideal for people who are anti-Trump, pro-dog, and pro-flower.

We have already achieved success with dogs peeing on Trump in New York City, and the handful of statues here have made headlines around the world. We're already making as many as we can to send to other states and other countries, but it has become very clear that we must scale up production to make the dream of peeing on Trump as real as possible for as many as possible.

 

How Funds Will Be Used

Once production is up and running, it will be self-sustaining – but I need the initial capital to get started.

Funds will be used to:

– redesign for efficient mass production

– prototype development

– produce the first run of Trumpee Stumps

– dedicate time to managing production, final assembly and finishing, shipping and PR

– add production staff

– strategically place existing prototypes in key cities around the world 

– bring Pee-on-me Trumps to various art festivals in the US

We have some great perks that also commemorate this shitstorm of a Presidency in other creative ways, including 2019 Trumpspiration calendars, a few one-off Trump-mocking pieces, and some beautiful historical moments and quotes printed on metal.

 

What We Can Achieve

The publicity around the first batch of statues has been really fun. But it has also helped boost interest in other articles about the very real possibility of the pee tapes. So if we can make mass production a reality, we'll be encouraging comedy, performance art, and canine etiquette while also reminding people about a very real issue with international implications.

 

Challenges

The main challenge is just the up-front production costs and making time to manage the operation. But there seems to be enough momentum to make it happen.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the cash to help, you can still help by sharing this campaign as well as links to any of these articles:

https://bit.ly/2OZyO6b

https://bit.ly/2NMX8DA

story:
Hello everyone, my name is Levi Bettwieser.  I’m the founder and film technician for The Rescued Film Project, rescuedfilm.com.  For those who don’t know, The Rescued Film Project is an archive of images that we rescued from lost and forgotten rolls of film, from all over the world.  To date, we’ve rescued over 18,000 images.  We could not have done this without the support of all of you.

We started this campaign, because we need your help again.  Around 1 year ago, we acquired 66 bundles of film.  Each bundle contains anywhere from 8-36 rolls of film, totaling what we’re estimating to be about 1,200 rolls, all shot by the same photographer in the 1950s.  Now that fact in itself is intriguing, but even more interesting is the way in which this film was packaged.  Each roll once shot, was placed back in it’s box with a hand written note detailing what was shot.  Then the box was wrapped in several layers of aluminum foil, then athletic tape.  Then the photographer wrote on the athletic tape what was on the film.  Once the photographer had enough rolls like this, they were packed tightly in a cigar box then the cigar box was wrapped in multiple layers of newspaper, aluminum foil, and athletic tape and then once again labeled with the contents.  Recently I had an amazing group of volunteers come help unpack and catalog the rolls and in 6 hours, 8 of us were only able to get through 22 of the 66 bundles because of this packaging.

I’m asking for your help because this is way more film than I can process myself.  I’ve actually processed one roll and you’ll see that while the film has images, it is degraded.  This film was shot in the 1950s, and every day it goes unprocessed, it deteriorates a little more.  So we’re partnering with Blue Moon Camera in Portland to process the majority of this film for us.  Unlike our project which is just done in our spare time outside of our full time jobs, Blue Moon Camera can add this film to their daily processing queue and rescue this film much faster than we could.  They’ve also been generous enough to grant us a large discount.  But, it still is going to cost money for time, chemicals and disposal, envelopes, archive sleeves, shipping, and travel.  So please help fund this project so we can rescue these images and ensure that the photographers memories and dedication to preserving them aren’t lost.  If everyone who follows us on social media and enjoys seeing the images we rescue gives just $1, we will have more than enough to save this film.

Thank you everyone for the support, please share this video with others.  We will be documenting this process along the way so everyone will know exactly what’s going on.

processed one roll and you’ll see that while the film has images, it is
degraded.  This film was shot in the
1950s, and every day it goes unprocessed, it deteriorates a little more.  So we’re partnering with Blue Moon Camera in
Portland to process the majority of this film for us.  Unlike our project which is just done in our
spare time outside of our full time jobs, Blue Moon Camera can add this film to
their daily processing queue and rescue this film much faster than we
could.  They’ve also been generous enough
to grant us a large discount.  But, it
still is going to cost money for time, chemicals and disposal, envelopes,
archive sleeves, shipping, and travel. 
So please help fund this project so we can rescue these images and
ensure that the photographers memories and dedication to preserving them aren’t
lost.  If everyone who follows us on
social media and enjoys seeing the images we rescue gives just $1, we will have
more than enough to save this film.
Thank you everyone for the support, please share this video
with others.  We will be documenting this
process along the way so everyone will know exactly what’s going on.

story:
Hello, I'm Marta and I'm a Portuguese Biology Student and a small Instagram Artist! ♡

For some context, Indiegogo it's very similar to Kickstarter, however Kickstarter is not available in my country (Portugal). This is my first crowdfunding campaign, and it will serve to raise funds to produce the first range of enamel pins for my new Etsy Shop called Mink PinShop!  

♡ This shop will help me save funds to follow my dreams of being a tattoo artist ♡

After a lot of thinking, I decided to go with Steven Universe collection! I really loved this show, from the animation to the overall story. I fell in love with the designs of anything Rose Quartz related, so i really wanted to make my own cute version of all my favourite elements related to her: shield, sword, gem and lion.

The first 20 Enamel Pin backers will get a FREE Rose Quartz sticker!

The minimum goal amount for a campaign on Indiegogo is 500€. I have decided to go with a fixed funding project, which means that if the 500€ goal is not met, every backer will be refunded but none of the designs will be made.
So for the campaign to be successful the first two designs must be unlocked. 

  • 31 August: Campaign starts and runs for 30 days
  • 29 September: Campaign ends. Funds will be received after about 7-14 days 
  • October: Reward surveys are sent out via Pledgebox for 10 days. You'll get to choose which of the unlocked pin designs you want, provide your shipping address and pay for shipping
  • Late October and Early November: Enamel pins go into production (it should take 4 to 6 weeks)
  • Late November: Rewards are packaged and shipped out to you!

*Please note this is my first Indiegogo campaign and some of these time estimates might be a bit off depending on how manufacturing and other processes go!

I will not profit directly from this campaign, since all the funds will cover exactly the value of production, packaging and Indiegogo fees, which are about 15% including the money transfer fee, since I'm outside of the US.

Below are estimations on shipping costs, since these might change slightly depending on package weight.

Shipping will be available for the following places: Portugal (PT), rest of the World and European Union (EU) and United States of America (US). Each order will have a tracking number for you to follow your package.

*Please note: these shipping prices before you pledge! Shipping is charged AFTER the campaign has ended via Pledgebox.

UK backers - Because of the new VAT system I won't be shipping to the UK. If it ends up being successful the pins will be available on my Etsy Shop! Sorry for the inconvenience and thank you for the understanding

International backers - Please note that you'll be responsible for any customs/VAT fees that may incur. If you do not accept the package and it's returned to me with no damage, I can refund you the costs minus shipping.

Pin production can lead to a few B grade pins (pins with slight flaws) and colours could be slightly different than on-screen due to individual monitor properties, aswell because of the manufacturing process.

The current shipping and order processing is run by me only, and since this is my first ever campaign it may take a while to get all orders ready, depending on the number of backers.

If there are any delays, I will keep all backers updated in my INDIEGOGO UPDATES. I'll make sure backers will be updated at all stages of the production process in the interest of transparency!

You can find me on Instagram @marta.louzeiro and for any questions you can contact me with minkpinshop@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

This beautiful work of art (Oil Painting of two horses) has been donated to Whisper Poetry to raise funds. A donation of R 50.00 gives you a chance to win it.

What We Need & What You Get

 

We need you to donate R 50.00 to stand a chance to win this beautiful work of art.

We also contribute R 500.00 towards a frame for the piece of art

 

The Impact

 

Whisper Poetry is a Family Friendly Club coaching children to write poetry and each year we publish a book of verse and release a video of the Art and Photography received from entrants. We have NO sponsor and do all our own fund raising.

Your support will make it possible for our very poor children to get exposure for their writing (Poems and Short Stories),Art, Music and photography.

Our reputation at schools over the past 11 years will show that we are a Club that delivers and that we are there for our students and members

 

Risks & Challenges

 Your donation of R 50.00($5.00) is the risk BUT we commit to advising ever donor of who has won this beautiful painting

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Besides purchasing a ticket for yourself you can assist us by selling tickets for us and earn a 10% commission for each ticket sold (That is R 5.00 - $0.50)is yours for each ticket you sell)

story:
What is Outrageous Ambition?

At Outrageous Ambition our idea is simplicity itself, we apply imagination and creativity to enterprise, to meet the real needs and aspirations to some of the most vulnerable and disadvantaged people in our society. Our approach is to develop enterprise so as to get people involved in activities that have a real purpose.

                                   

Despite every individual being different we start with soft skills such as communication, team work, confidence, discipline, sense of purpose, improved self-worth. Our work aims to tackle these issues by providing a safe and welcoming environment to develop the necessary skills to increase voluntary and employment opportunities as well as contributing to their local community.

What we need and what you get

We need 5.5K towards a bespoke screen printing press, that will provide employment for marginalised and disabled people in the creative sector. Taking them out of the U.K benefits system, resulting in significant savings within the local council (Lancashire County Council).  The package will include: 

  • Screen Printing Equipment using RISO QS200 Digital Screen Maker

                                     

  • Weiss 4 Colour 4 Station Small Carousel with Side Clamps
  • WPS Mini Dryer
  • WPS Model 1 Flash Dryer
  • WPS Vacuum Board – used for Paper Printing (vacuum not included)
  • Consumables
  • Plastisol and Waterbased Ink for Textile Printing Includes WPS Paper Art inks for Paper / Card Printing
  • Mug Sublimation kit including Ricoh Printer / Paper / Inks / Mug
  • Press and Heat Press

The Team:

The Can Do Man

The can-do man is the man with plan, the origin of the outrageous ambition began with him. He works closely with the head of happiness and the thistle blower to make his ambition shared and possible.

Head Of Happiness

Our head of happiness has the amazing job of improving the health and well-being of the people who come to the hub. Wants to make a positive change to people’s lives through the hub, whilst making all those who come here happy.

Ninja Mouse

The ninja mouse is our digital arts developer, she is extremely adept at manipulating the mouse to create some amazing pieces of art. She helped us design a few areas of the website as well as a few other bits and pieces. Examples of her brilliant work are on our Outrageous Crew page, all the characters on that page were designed by the Mouse Ninja herself, based on the real life individuals.

Head of Smile Distribution

Our Head of Smile Distributions is also one of the inspirations for Outrageous Ambition. You may have read about her on our Outrageous Journey? The head of smile distributions uses her bubbly personality and sense of humour to makes everyone’s day in the space that little bit brighter. If it weren’t for Chloe we may all not have come together at the Outrageous Hub.

The Conductor Of Creations

The Conductor of creations is our on site budding artist with a creative mind. He has made a number of creations which will ultimately be introduced to our store once we are up and running. He has created some brilliant pieces using a wide range of media, from making 80’s retro creations from perler beads to some origami masterpieces. In fact you may recognise a couple pieces of his work as the origami swan and origami tree on our Outrageous hub page.


The Impact

The social impact of our work is measured in the health and well-being of those involved. Many disabled and disadvantaged people lack a sense of purpose, have limited opportunities and face problems such as; a lack of confidence; low aspirations; social isolation; depression and other mental health problems; limited skills and job opportunities.

Other ways you can help

Show support, keep up with our progress or see previous achievements on social media

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/OutrageousAmbition

YouTube: Outrageous Ambition

story:
Over 600,000 households met at Sinai to receive the Ten Commandments - Tradition has it that this event was the covenant upon which Judaism, Christianity and Islam are all based. We will recreate the mystical and transcendent moment of the covenant on Mount Sinai that changed a people into a nation as well as other significant stories from Exodus.

Portraying the connection between the People and their Land, Moses Ten’s recreations will bring together thousands of people from around the world. Participants will be able to tell the story of belonging through an experience that will be recorded and remembered for eternity.


Toby Cohen, a master photographer in Israel whose love of country, history, art and culture combines perfectly with his spirituality and knowledge of biblical narrative. His artistic vision will move the soul.


Moses Ten is Toby Cohen’s largest undertaking yet - for the recreation of these magnificent scenes we not only need thousands of participants; but also costumes, props, and accessories.



The logistics involved in this project are complex and expensive since scenes and props need to be recreated with painstaking detail. Authentic wardrobes need to be created for thousands of participants, as well as tents, accessories, and many other items. We need your help to make it happen.


Being a part of this undertaking will give participants a “revelation” type of experience – They will be able to say “I was there” and “I know first-hand” what it looked like for the Israelites over 3000 years ago…

This project, due to its nature and reach, will refocus the media attention from the familiar tanks & terrorism narrative to a coverage focused on the beautiful places and people in Israel. It will also emphasize the Biblical and historical ties that connect the people to the Land.

“In an age of declining returns, art has been one of the few asset classes to increase in value. Over the past few years, toby Cohens art has gone up in value over 300% since he first began his biblical replications. The value of the works ofThe Moses Ten Project will increase exponentially due to its high visibility and reach” - Gavriel Engel

For backing the project you will receive the following:

$18 - Blessed: receive the Cohen's blessing from Toby and 1 digital screen saver image.

$36 - Doubly Blessed: receive the Cohen's blessing from Toby and a full set of digital screen savers.

$49 - Robed: Exclusive MosesTen T-Shirt 
$54 - Witness: take part in the making of history, secure yourself a position for eternity in one picture of this iconic event, participate in shoot and receive also a set of MosesTen magnets and a digitally signed A4 size image (exclusive only to participants) + all previous awards.
$72 - Pair of Witnesses - secure a position for yourself and a guest + all previous awards.
$180 - Inscribed Witness: secure a position for yourself and 3 guests + 2 robes from the shoot + all witness awards.
$360 - Desert Wanderer: full set of postcard size images.
$720 - Patron: 6 A4 images, reserve 6 guest places in a photo.
$850 - Egg Coat: The iconic egg coat produced by Maskit and utilized in some of the upcoming MosesTen shoots
$1,440 - Benefactor: 6 A4 images + one 35cm x 18.5cm image (edition of 100), reserve 2 VIP and 6 guest places in a photo.
$1,500 - Red Nirit Dress: The exclusive Maskit dress worn by "Miriam" in the "Song of Miriam" shoot.

$2,880 -  Collector: one 75cm x 35cm image (edition of 50), reserve 4 VIP and 8 guest places in a photo.

$5,760 - Avid Collector: 1 collector's image 1.5m x 0.75m, (edition of 25) reserve 6 VIP and 10 guest places in a photo.
$11,520 - Senior Producer: 1 full size image 3m x 1.5m (edition of 12) and reserve 12 VIP places in a photo (can be spread across several photos in total).
$25,200 - Executive Producer: full collector's set of images (10 photos) 1.5m x 0.75m and reserve 24 VIP places in a photo (can be spread across several photos in total).
*Perks do not include airfare, travel, lodging and board.

We have just shot Miriam’s Song with the help of friends, family, partners and the Israeli Jewish Ethiopian community. We have 9 more stories to shoot, each one costing $25,000 to produce. Meeting our initial goal will enable Toby to shoot the next story of MosesTen. Each additional $25,000 brings Toby closer to completing the 10 initial stories selected for MosesTen.

Born in London, Toby earned his BA Degree in Bristol. He began his career in 2001 working as a photojournalist and photographer of society and the stars. He currently lives as an artist between London and Tel Aviv exhibiting in museums and galleries internationally. In Israel he is represented by the Engel Gallery. The Tel Aviv Museum of Art currently has one of his works on display; another is in the private collection of Prince Charles. His latest project is inspired by the Biblical prophet Moses and the important events that occurred during his lifetime. In conjunction with the Moses Ten project an award winning independent filmmaker is making a documentary about the project.

Putting together a project like this requires tremendous logistics, equipment and the bringing together of many people; is subject to weather, permits and other bureaucratic hurdles.

Toby and all others involved in this project are completely committed to making this happen and have over 5 years of experience in setting up such complicated shoots. Even if there are delays we are confident in out ability to complete the project.

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help, here are some ideas:

  • Spread the word! If you support MosesTen please share it on social media!
  • If you know someone in the media who may be interested in covering MosesTen, reach out to them.
  • Please tell your Rabbis, Pastors, Priests, Imams and Clergy, and ask them to share with their congregations

story:
Support Bernie Sanders in style in 2016.

Stick With Sanders is a sticker movement offering voters a creative alternative to support their favorite presidential candidate.





Stick them anywhere & everywhere- your water bottle, your computer, your car, Donald Trump's car... The choice is yours.

100% of the profits will be donated to the 2016 Bernie Sanders Presidential Campaign.

Our Backstory:
In short, we are two students who want to see Bernie Sanders in The Oval Office. We believe in Bernie for standing up and fighting against the corruption and greed contaminating government today. With backgrounds in graphic design and street art, we were inspired by local 'Bernie for President' graffiti that perfectly captured the spirit behind his campaign. Often times people passively glaze over political publicity, so we want to use art and design to create something physical that will attract the eyes of citizens that aren't necessarily politically active. With the primaries approaching rapidly we've turned to social media and crowdfunding in hopes to support on a larger scale. Let's help Bernie together by getting his name out there and winning over one vote at a time. 

How we'll use the money raised on Indiegogo:
Our goal is to raise as much money as possible for the Bernie Sanders Presidential Campaign. Every penny not spent on producing and distributing stickers will go directly to Bernie. We will not pay ourselves and promise to use the most cost-effective services, while maintaining highest possible quality, to maximize donations. All expense and donation information will be disclosed to our donors. 
When we reach our goal we will open up an online store, take on team members (check rewards section!), and continue to grow our community and sticker collection throughout 2016. Again, these will be voluntary efforts and we will use every penny to support Bernie's campaign.

A big THANK YOU in advance to all future donors, Instagram followers, and current Bernie Sanders supporters out there! 

Follow us on Instagram @StickWithSanders !
Contact Us at StickWithSanders2016@gmail.com !

If you support Bernie but decide not to donate today, help us spread the word about our Indiegogo page! Let's put Bernie Sanders in the White House!

Sticker Dimensions:



Not sold on our stickers but still want Sanders swag? Check out the Bernie Sanders store at https://store.berniesanders.com/

Often times people passively glaze over political publicity, so we want to use art and design to create something physical that will attract the eyes of citizens that aren't necessarily politically active. With the primaries approaching rapidly we've turned to social media and crowdfunding in hopes to support on a larger scale. Let's help Bernie together by getting his name out there and winning over one vote at a time. How we'll use the money raised on Indiegogo:Our goal is to raise as much money as possible for the Bernie Sanders Presidential Campaign. Every penny not spent on producing and distributing stickers will go directly to Bernie. We will not pay ourselves and promise to use the most cost-effective services, while maintaining highest possible quality, to maximize donations. All expense and donation information will be disclosed to our donors. When we reach our goal we will open up an online store, take on team members (check rewards section!), and continue to grow our community and sticker collection throughout 2016. Again, these will be voluntary efforts and we will use every penny to support Bernie's campaign.A big THANK YOU in advance to all future donors, Instagram followers, and current Bernie Sanders supporters out there! Follow us on Instagram @StickWithSanders !Contact Us at StickWithSanders2016@gmail.com !If you support Bernie but decide not to donate today, help us spread the word about our Indiegogo page! Let's put Bernie Sanders in the White House!Sticker Dimensions:Not sold on our stickers but still want Sanders swag? Check out the Bernie Sanders store at https://store.berniesanders.com/

story:
About us:
We’re a rad lesbian couple living in New York City who decided to make pins that encourage people to be better and/or smash the patriarchy. This is our first pin, but we have plenty of ideas coming soon. Follow us @fine_artery

We love to create things, whether it’s art or stories, we are always making something. And thanks to your contributions, one day we’ll become full time creators.

 

NOTE: THIS IS A PRE-ORDER
This means pins will be produced right after the campaign ends and is funded.
Production time is around 4 weeks. Allow time for shipping. Thank you!


Be Kind, Rewind - Pin Mock Up
This soft enamel pin measures 28mmx30mm and is composed of 6 colors. Upon obtaining funds this pin will be produced by a third party supplier. The funding is $500 (since that is the minimum required by Indiegogo.) We are determined to make this pin no matter what, and any contribution is greatly appreciated.

See the specs below:

Want to know more about Fine Artery?
Follow us on Instagram @fine_artery
Or visit our Etsy shop at: https://www.etsy.com/shop/FineArtery
 

Do you know someone who could use this pin?
Great! We can ship it to them too. Also, don't forget to share our campaign with your friends and family. The more people that wear this pin, the more chances we have of making an impact.

story:
AURi

The entertainment industry has been monopolized! But we can end that with your help.

Okay. Imagine a place where Artists all over the world can come together.

A place where we can learn from one another. Network. Inspire. And collaborate.

That place is AURi.

Artists United Radio is an internet radio station designed to give a voice to the voiceless.

A platform for the invisible.

AURi is the bridge between the connected and the disconnected. 

With AURi you will be able to exponentially grow your network. Increase your exposure.

Share your craft with the world.

AURi is for artists by artists. And all artists are welcome.

Authors.

Illustrators.

Graphic Designers.

Poets.

Expressionists.

Street Poets.

Spoken Wordsmiths.

Ghost Writers.

Dancers.

Singers.

Rappers.

Bands.

Musicians.

Music Producers.

Studio Engineers.

Playwrights.

Screen writers.

Film Producers.

Cinematographers.

Photographers.

If you're dissatisfied with the current wave of the entertainment industry, or if you feel as if you can do better, make your splash with AURi starting today.

Please, donate to help make this a reality.

Welcome to AURi…

"The place where U and I come together."

If Spike Lee can fund an entire film on here, we can come together and make this a reality for the rest of us.

Thank you for your time and consideration!

Wait! There's more!

Many people ask, "What's in it for me?" Well this is the campaign that gives back and then some!

*Sharing is Caring Sweepstakes

-Send us a screenshot of you sharing this campaign and you will qualify to win $25 as our thanks to you! Send your screenshot to artistsunitedradio@gmail.com today!

**First Donor

-Be the first to donate to this campaign and win an autographed copy of the novel "Blind Loyalty" or the children's book "Sleepy, No Sheepy" and an interview on our first live radio show or podcast!

***It's Levels to This Campaign

-Help us raise our first $6,024 and you qualify to win your share of $100 (4 winners)

-Help us raise $12,048 and you qualify to win your share of $200 (4 winners)

-Help us raise the full $18,072 and you qualify to win your share of $400 (4 winners)

****Largest donor will choose the first Featured Artist of the Month on our website in addition to qualifying for all the prizes listed above. 

Thank you so much. 

AURi Staff

Courtney Trowman - twitter @ccbella_says

Tre Sixsix - twitter @Room918book

story:
Short Summary

After the 15/07/08 Tornado, the XVI century Venetian Villa, Villa Fini was destroyed.
This campaign is raising 2.5 M euro to rebuild completely this wonderfull villa.
HelpMeFriend, our company dedicated to manage emergency situation for people, decided to promote this worldwide campaign to save a historic villa.
This will be the first online share campaign: all our action to rebuild villa Fini will be completely online so our Contributors can see working progress online.

What We Need & What You Get

2.5 M euro will be dedicated to rebuild with original materials, or the nearest quality, all parts of Villa Fini.

We will manage a professional team, and you will can see profile on website. All decision, project and activity will be posted online....so you can became a active part of campaign

The Impact

Your name will be remembered forever as Villa Fini's Angel.

Risks & Challenges

No risks...because you can see directly to website day by day operations to make this villa at the previous beauty.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our funding campaing on Facebook, Twitter, Google Plus. Thanks

story:
Con tu ayuda podremos darles un impulso a nuevos y establecidos talentos, afectados por la crisis humanitaria

  • Los venezolanos contamos con una increíble riqueza cultural y un talento artístico digno de compartir y tenemos mucho que dar y agradecerle al Perú, así mismo el Perú cuenta con una riqueza cultural grandiosa y tenemos mucho que aprender de ella, en ARTE X LA PAZ podremos realizar nuestros proyectos artísticos y dictar talleres y cursos especializados a todos los que deseen iniciarse en ambas culturas, y así redituar un poco la gran generosidad que hemos encontrado en el Perú.
  • Muchos artistas llegan al Perú laborando en lo primero que consiguen, cualquier trabajo es bueno para comenzar de cero, atienden mesas en restaurantes, en cocina, haciendo mantenimiento, vendiendo comida en parques y avenidas, etc, sin embargo ARTE X LA PAZ podrá darles el espacio laboral y de crecimiento que necesitan para continuar su desarrollo creativo y profesional, ampliar las posibilidades económicas básicas de ayuda a sus familias en Venezuela y podremos generar fondos para otros, enviando ayuda humanitaria. 
  • Confiamos en que nacerá un movimiento intercultural y artístico, y que el exilio aportará a nuestra expresión creativa y vivencial particular, una dosis de globalidad, que será muy interesante.

 

QUIÉN SOY? 

Beth Cruz (Betty) 

  • Hija de Luis Cruz, músico, compositor y productor musical venezolano, ya fallecido, conocido por su canción emblemática AY QUE NOCHE TAN PRECIOSA, cantada en todos los cumpleaños venezolanos.  Aquí puedes escucharlo -  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-dLb8YknUk4&list=PL98909DDC797B9E3C
  • De Bethylde Carrillo, pintora y modista de Broadway, NY, donde vivió por más de 30 años hasta su muerte.
  • Fui criada entre cantantes, poetas, músicos, pintores y artesanos, influenciada por esto, decidí formarme y emprender camino profesional hacía la publicidad y el cine, lo cual fue muy satisfactorio porque tuve la gran fortuna de lograr trabajar en unos 10 largometrajes nacionales e internacionales y en muchos spots publicitarios en mi país. Algunos de ellos están registrados en este link  http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1680887/?ref_=fn_al_... 
  • Como artista visual y promotora de arte he expuesto obras en París, Caracas, Ciudad de México y Lima.
  • He dictado cursos de Dirección de arte para cine y de artes plásticas e ilustración en Caracas, Ciudad de México y Lima. 
  • Estoy fuera de Venezuela desde 1997 cuando viajé a París para exponer arte popular venezolano. Tal vez de alguna forma intuí lo que ahora esta pasando en Venezuela y me marché. He vivido en 4 países y todas estas vivencias me traen ahora hasta este puerto, dedicarme a luchar por ayudar a quienes más lo necesitan. 

ARTE X LA PAZ será un aporte de reivindicación moral y social 

  • La creación de ARTE X LA PAZ llegó como una respuesta a esa necesidad y mi mejor manera es a través del arte, porque para mi el arte es la expresión del alma humana y por eso debemos valorarla y permitirle crecer en nuestras sociedades tan deterioradas moralmente.
  • ARTE X LA PAZ será fundada por gente como tú y como yo que sabemos que el dinero sirve para algo más que enriquecerse materialmente. 
  • Cada uno aportará de acuerdo a sus posibilidades y podrá participar de esta manera en la creación de este proyecto colectivo de arte y migración.

 

 Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes por tus donaciones
 

Calculo que necesitamos $15.000 para rentar una casa con al menos 5 habitaciones. La cual nos permitirá tener un salón de clases, un salón de usos múltiples para ensayos, danza, etc, espacios exteriores e interiores para taller, dos habitaciones como primer refugio para los que llegan, y una oficina. Y por supuesto una vitrina - tienda para exposición y venta de obras artísticas. Además a parte de lo que ya tengo en mi taller personal, necesitamos mas mobiliario, al menos una computadora adicional, caballetes y muchos materiales y herramientas.  

Como recompensa por tus donaciones recibirás constantes actualizaciones regulares y fotos de las actividades y los proyectos, tu nombre aparecerá como un miembro fundador, Daremos postales, afiches y obra original. Y también hemos pensado que nos encantaría invitarte a la inauguración de ARTE X LA PAZ ¡Guauu! ¿qué te parece? nos visitas? 

 

Riesgos y desafíos
 

Estamos claros en que es un proyecto ambicioso pero también estamos seguros de lo necesario que es. Así que nuestro gran desafío es que los artistas respondan con compromiso al llamado y que logremos orientar sus proyectos hacia tierra. Que aterricen sus ideas y elaboren sus planes para verlos concretados.

  • Si no llegamos a cumplir la meta completa que nos hemos propuesto, igual destinaremos el dinero que llegue para cambiarnos a un espacio casa taller mas grande y seleccionaremos proyectos de fácil realización para irlo desarrollando en tiempos determinados, dando clases y buscando rentar espacios para ensayos, etc y así generar dinero para continuar. Tengo tanta fe en este proyecto que sé que lo vamos a lograr!
  • Tenemos una alianza con MOEBIUS, ideas sin fin, productora de artes escénicas, que ofrece mas seguridad para enfrentar los riesgos, porque ella brindará un soporte asociado a ARTE X LA PAZ, juntos vamos a encontrar siempre una salida para recibir a los artistas y ofrecerles una fuente de trabajo mas acorde con sus habilidades. Algunos podrán laborar en escenografías, utilería, asistir en el diseño de iluminación, de sonido, vestuario, maquillaje, conciertos, diseño gráfico, etc. 
 

 El impacto

En Venezuela hasta los años 90's logramos un nivel cultural importante y avanzado, teníamos una excelente plataforma cultural que generó muchos talentos que ahora están regados por el mundo, músicos , actores, dramaturgos, directores de orquesta, pintores y muchos otros llevan esta cultura al mundo, con nuestro método orquestal "EL SISTEMA" de donde salió el gran Dudamel por ejemplo, y que ahora se utiliza para enseñar en varios países, nuestros ritmos musicales, nuestra danza y teatro son reconocidos. Por eso estamos seguros de que si logramos reunirnos en otros países podremos dar continuidad a este legado, que como exiliados de un gran país como Venezuela, debemos conservar.
 

 

Todos pueden colaborar, existen muchas otras formas

Algunas personas simplemente no pueden contribuir, pero eso no significa que no pueda ayudar:

Por favor, atiende nuestro llamado y has ruido sobre esta campaña. Envía por correo electrónico a tus amigos, a tus colegas, a los donadores conocidos, a los coleccionistas de arte, a las galeristas, a los artistas, a los pintores, a tus padres, y a tu primo lejano que le gusta mucho el arte y siempre quiere ayudar, a los que quisieron ser artistas pero nunca pudieron, a todos! Hazles saber sobre esta oportunidad. Los incentivos son geniales!

Utiliza las herramientas de compartir de Indiegogo. Aparte de las presentaciones directas, las redes sociales serán la mejor opción para el éxito de la campaña.

Si eres artista venezolano o de otra nacionalidad, quieres unirte y estás en Perú, acércate, llámanos, escríbenos! También estás invitado! 

Y eso es todo por ahora ... te gustó nuestra campaña? entonces Listo! Ya puedes Donar!

story:
As school students , we run into one difficulty after another in the process of learning . Everyone has their own ways to deal with them . Here I would like to share mine.

When I am faced with a difficulty , I usually choose to refer to relevant learning materials or web pages . In this way , I can not only work it out but also improve my ability to overcome problems all by myself .

However , when it is something beyond my competence , I turn to my classmates or teachers for help . Sometimes I also ask my parents for advice . As a result , I have made steady progress in my studies .

However , when it is something beyond my competence , I turn to my classmates or teachers for help . Sometimes I also ask my parents for advice . As a result , I have made steady progress in my studies .

 

As school students , we run into one difficulty after another in the process of learning . Everyone has their own ways to deal with them . Here I would like to share mine.

　　When I am faced with a difficulty , I usually choose to refer to relevant learning materials or web pages . In this way , I can not only work it out but also improve my ability to overcome problems all by myself .

　　However , when it is something beyond my competence , I turn to my classmates or teachers for help . Sometimes I also ask my parents for advice . As a result , I have made steady progress in my studies .

story:
WHO AM I?

Hello fellow Rider fans!  My name is Jeremy Bresciani.  I am a professional sports artist with a love for Rider football.  I grew up in Regina, in a large, hardcore Rider family and despite moving to Edmonton 30 years ago, and the Vancouver area 6 years ago, I am still, and ALWAYS WILL BE, a Rider Fan!  

I have been drawing Rider pieces since 2010 with a focus on creating pieces that bring the fans to the forefront.  All of my artwork is based on REAL fans.  I have spent as much as 900 hours working on a single piece of art and have drawn as many as 504 real fans in full, recognizable detail, into a single piece of art. 

WHAT IS THIS PROJECT?

I want to create the ultimate Rider Pride piece of art and give YOU and your fellow Rider fans the chance to be a part of it!  This will be my most customizable piece to date, giving Rider fans many different ways to be a part of the artwork and personalizing it just for them!  Ideally, I would like all of you to own a unique piece (a one-off just for you!) that is unlike any artwork your fellow Rider fan's may own.  I will explain that in more detail below.  

The first Rider piece of art I ever drew was titled "Three Generations of Pride".  Although, I am very happy with that piece, I want to take the concept of "Game Day" to a new level.  We have another Grey Cup, a new stadium and a lot of history I didn't touch on in my previous work.  My goal is to incorporate every historical moment, pay tribute to every Legend and celebrate every detail of what it means to be a part of Rider Nation and have RIDER PRIDE!  Help me make this possible Rider Nation!  

PERSONALIZATION (YOU'RE GOING TO DRAW ONE JUST FOR ME?)

Yes.  Here are SEVERAL ways I can make this artwork just for you!

(1) YOU AND YOUR LOVED ONES WALKING TO THE GAME!  The first one is pretty simple.  EVERYONE that supports this project will have the opportunity submit photos of themselves walking away from the camera while wearing their Rider gear.  I will draw them into the artwork as if they were walking to the game.  No exclusions.  EVERYONE that supports this project WILL be in the artwork!

(2) YOUR NAMES ON JERSEYS!  EVERYONE that supports this project can ask for names to be added to the jerseys on up to 5 fans in the artwork they ordered.  Once the prints are made, I will personally add your family names onto the backs of the fans in your print(s).  

(3) YOUR FACE ON THE BIG SCREEN!  If you support this project by purchasing an XL 24"x30" print, you can submit any photo you'd like and I will draw you onto the Jumbo Video Screen in the stadium!   Yes, your artwork would be the only one that has YOU on the big screen!  OR it could be a Game highlight of your choosing! 

(4) Personalize it to YOUR OWN HISTORY!  If you support this project by purchasing an XL 24"x30" print, you can ask me to draw any Rider player, game stats, game score and opponent on the appropriate areas of the jumbo tron video screen!  You can make this GAME DAY any game you wish!  It could be any of the Grey Cup games in our history, or maybe a Labour Day classic, or maybe a special game you shared with a loved one! 

AUTOGRAPHED BY RIDER LEGENDS!

I am honoured to say that Ray Elgaard, Jeff Fairholm, Don Narcisse, Roger Aldag, Tim McCray, Dale West, Al Ford and Dave "Robokicker" Ridgway will be signing 100 of the XL 24"x30" Personalized Limited Edition Prints!  Anyone supporting this project by purchasing one of these prints will receive ALL 8 LEGEND AUTOGRAPHS on their print!  GO RIDERS!!!!!

HOW LONG WILL THIS TAKE TO DRAW?

This piece will take me 3-6 months to draw and you will be updated on its progress every step of the way.  I will do many Facebook Live feeds while I draw it and I will post photo updates on my Facebook page as well.  You can opt in to receive these updates by e-mail, if you'd prefer.

HOW CAN YOU HELP ME?

This is a very large project to undertake.  Having completed many even larger projects in the past for the Riders and many hockey teams, I know the time commitment that lay before me.  This is the reason I set up this Indiegogo page.  With a 2-year old son and a second baby on his or her way, I cannot afford the luxury of drawing for months on end without knowing if anyone is interested in purchasing the artwork or prints when I have completed it.  If this campaign reaches its funding goal, I will be able to put the time into drawing this complex piece with the piece of mind that I can still support my family while I do so.

Please note that I am licensed by the Saskatchewan Roughriders which means a portion of all sales goes directly to the team.  

If you are not able to support this project through funding, PLEASE help my sharing it via Indiegogo's sharing tools,  other social media or word of mouth.  Thank-you VERY MUCH Rider Nation!  GO RIDERS!!!!!
