story:
"Oakland CA”
Keeping The Beats Alive!

Arthur Monroe
Abstract Expressionist Painter Smithsonian Institute 2020 Inductee

Born in Brooklyn’s Bedford Stuyvesant District, Arthur Monroe attended Boys High and spent his formative years in New York City. A close friend of Charlie “Bird” Parker, Arthur also mingled with other heavyweights such as Harvey Tristan Cropper, Amiri Baraka and Max Roach, the latter of whom advised him “to know his axe”: that is, to know his craft, advice that he has adhered to ever since.

Abstract Expressionism was the prevailing American art style in the 1950s and was generally recognized as being the most important modernist art to have occurred after World War II. As a young artist, Arthur Monroe immersed himself in the exciting milieu of Manhattan’s East Village. He had a studio facing Willem De Kooning's. He hung around the Cedar Street Bar, where he knew some of the most acclaimed Abstract Expressionists, including Franz Klein.

As an artist educator in Oakland, California, Arthur worked to gain official cooperation to stabilize live-work spaces for artists, and was the chief registrar for the Oakland Museum of California. Arthur helped develop the first state-wide conference of black artists and co-produced the first World Black and African Festival of Arts and Culture "FESTAC 75” in Lagos, Nigeria.

Arthur will be inducted into the Smithsonian Institute of African American History
and Culture, alongside four other Oakland-based artists, including his dear friends

Evangeline EJ Montgomery, Mary “Lovelace” O’Neal, Raymond Holbert and Lewis Watts, all for African American Artist Lifetime Achievements.

Arthur’s life journey will be displayed, as a Live-Work Artist Studio, in preparation for the Smithsonian Institute, at Jack London Square in Oakland CA February 1-May 31st. Their works will be shown at this monumental exhibition as a lifetime achievement celebration for these local artists. Arthur Monroe was the pioneer to convert Oakland’s first Live-Work artist studio.

Produced by Alistair Monroe
As an inner-city, community-based, cultural arts producers, Alistair founded
the North beach Jazz Festival, San Francisco and Oakland’s newest cultural arts festival “FESTAC”. Alistair’s works to enrich and beautify urban environments to educate the public about the process and history through humanitarian and education platform. Working with a wide variety of neighborhoods Alistair has inherited the creative process through community arts organizations.

Jack London Square

The-Beat-Generation-Exhibition 
54 Washington Street
Oakland CA 94607

Arthur Monroe current exhibitions:

Beat Collection: Oslo, Norway

Free Admission
Dates: February 14-May 31,, 2019

Hours: Wednesday – Sunday 11-6pm

Contact: Alistair Monroe (Info@theoaklandcannery.com)

*Dr. Reidar Wennesland Beat Art Collection University of Agder www.minervanett.no/den/utslatte-kunsten www.beat-art.no/en/index3.htm

*Portland Oregon: http://www.elizabethleach.com/

*Berkeley CA: http://www.thelmaharrisartgallery.com

Smithsonian Institute Inductee’s:

*Evangeline EJ Montgomery

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evangeline_Montgo...

*Mary Lovelace O’Neal

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Lovelace_O%2...

*Raymond Holbert

http://memorybanque.com/

*Lewis Watts

https://lewiswatts.sites.ucsc.edu/

story:
Michael Jevon Demps

B. 1976, Detroit, MI

 

Living and working in New Haven, CT


The Fountainhead Residency (2018)

“Fictions” Exhibition at the Studio Museum of Harlem (2017)

The Skowhegan School for Painting and Sculpture (2017)

MFA in Sculpture from the Yale School of Art  (2017)

BFA in Fine Art from the California Institute of the Arts (2015)

 

Hello,

My name is Michael and I am a multi-disciplinary artist and musician currently based in New Haven, CT.

Through my 20 years as a touring musician and visual artist, I’ve learned first hand how important building and fostering collaborative relationships are to an individual artistic practice and a strong creative community. I am honored to share that I’ve been granted the opportunity to participate in an art residency / collaboration that will take me to Johannesburg South Africa, Harare Zimbabwe, and Addis Ababa Ethiopia with the collective Reading Zimbabwe and my friend and collaborator Wes Taylor.

Our project entitled “Black Portals” will take us to these three cities to meet and collaborate with artists and writers on performance, podcasts, zine workshops, and round table discussions on contemporary art and activism issues we are facing in our communities. All of these events will be documented and shared with you. I believe this is an amazing opportunity to share ideas, exchange cultural perspectives, and explore where our interests and concerns overlap through collaboration.



 

I am coming to you for help in raising $10,000 to fund equipment and material costs, travel expenses, and production costs for this trip. These expenses include:

 

Airfare

Vaccinations

Audio and Video equipment budget

Recording equipment / recording budget

Materials (paper, fabric, wood, steel,etc)

Food and Lodging

Filming production budget

Studio upkeep expenses


I am putting forward many items that will be rewarded for supporting this campaign including a series of monoprints and drawings entitled “Toward Folding Space: Connecting Over, Under, Around, Through.” This work is inspired by the conversation Wes and I have been having leading up to this trip about the importance of connecting with artists, musicians, and writers with different perspectives and issues fueling our work. There will also be an assortment of t-shirts, candles, and other objects available. Thank you for your time and consideration.

 

Much Love,

Michael

story:
About the Exhibition

This is a limited-run installation, running from April 9th-19th at the EnclaveLab in London. Emma Reinhardt is an American independent curator based in London. She has previously partnered with  Marc Straus gallery in New York City, Maccarone Los Angeles,  and the Hong Kong Contemporary Art Foundation as part of her curatorial practice. Currently, she is studying Masters of Fine Art in Curating at Goldsmiths, University of London. For this exhibition, she has teamed up with artists Louis Mason and Zoe Jackson to create a one-of-a-kind show which brings together the mediums of painting, drawing, sculpture, and written word. This exhibition features a series of performances during the opening night, where Mason and British artist Lorde Selys will read aloud the pieces they have written in response to the works. 

 

Artist's Bios

Louis Mason is a Polish-Australian artist and writer based in London. He has shown and published extensively in Australia and the UK, and is currently engaged in postgraduate study at Goldsmiths College. In 2012 he was a co-founder of Knight St Art Space, and was the director of that space over the course of its operation. Examples of his writing and previous artworks can be found at http://www.louis-mason.com/. 

Zoe Jackson is a practicing artist from Melbourne, Australia. She finished her BAFA this year at RMIT University. She primarily uses drawing and various textile approaches to manipulate and come to terms with images of women she sources from Instagram and popular culture. Actualised in their installation and display, the works push and pull between attraction and repulsion, acceptance and refusal.

Lorde Selys is an artist working collaboratively with words, lenses, multi-definitions of space, their users and inhabitants. Her works, including texts, screenings, performances, and installations were presented internationally. Between 2006 and 2010 she collaborated with the Aether9 group – an online platform for transnational story-telling and real-time performance – as a scriptwriter, actor, and photographer. She currently researches human versus nonhuman logics of memory, their dramaturgic, and political form of cohabitation at the Visual Culture department at Goldsmith College, London.
 

Budget Breakdown

£400

This is to pay me and each of my artists £100 each. We are all contributing tireless hours to this exhibition and even if I cannot pay myself, I owe it to my artists to cover the cost of their labour. They deserve so much more than this small amount. 

£140

This is to cover shipping costs. Zoe Jackson is based out of Melbourne, Australia and in a perfect world, this campaign would be able to make enough money to cover her flights. However, at the very least the cost of sending her magnificent drawings to and from London needs to be covered if this exhibition is to be rendered whole.

£100

This is to cover material fees. That includes: exhibition books, flyers, construction materials, power cables, and more. The small, behind-the-scenes things that are necessary but not always pretty.

£60

This covers opening night costs which most importantly covers drinks and photography.

story:
About

After a  lot of consideration and a warm feedback from the cosplay and persona community, I've decided to make a cosplay / fashion looks / aesthetic book as Makoto Niijima from Persona 5!

The book will feature various outfits of her, plus street fashion and more, with my own personal touch! 

I look forward to this project, and to more in the future!

Please note that for the rewards to be fulfilled, I need to reach the campaign goal! After the campaign is successfully funded, a form will be sent out about the rewards and about any stretch goals ones if they are reached, as well!

Please note that this is a fan made book to show my love and support to Makoto, the Persona series and community! 

What We Need & What You Get!

 

For the magazine/book, we'll need 3300 euros to cover the costs.

This includes transportation to the photoshoot locations; materials, shipping costs and production costs as well.

 ♡ Magazine/Book specifications ♡

• 100+ pages of aesthetic and cosplay photography,carefully edited (not including cover and back cover)  and signed with lots of love!
•Printed in a 23cmx15cm format. 
• Perfect Bind 
•Full color 
• Silk Touch cover

♡ Included photoshoots ♡

• Swimsuit | Beach themed.

• Winter Shujin School Uniform | Library themed | Street themed.

•Summer Shujin School Uniform | Library themed | Street themed.

•Winter Casual Attire | Café themed | Street themed.

•Queen | Metaverse and Aesthethic themed.

•Persona Dancing Star Night Outfit | Arcade, Disco themed.

*** Some will include shots with special guests as Futaba, Akiren, Ann. Ryuji and Yusuke might make an appearance as well.***

If the goal is reached, there will be stretch goals! ♡

♡ Stretch Goals ♡

#1 

4500 euros

♡ If this goal is reached, three additional photoshoots will be added to the book:

• Masquerade Blue Dress

• Buchimaru Pijama

• Lingerie

#2

6000 euros

♡ If this goal is reached, three additional photoshoots will be added to the book:

• Makoto dressing as Panther

• Makoto dressing as Joker

• Makoto dressing as 2B.

 

♡Additional Stretch Goals to be added later.♡

Depending on how much you pledge, you will get as rewards:

♡ Exclusive sets of prints with photos from the book! ♡

♡ Polaroids of photos from the book, chosen by yourself and signed with love ! ♡

♡ HR set of photos from the various photoshoots! ♡

♡ Exclusive set of badges and charm! ♡

Makoto is a very dear character to me who I can relate a lot with, and she taught me so much, and thanks to her I got to know amazing people who changed my life forever. ♡

I hope this book will show you how much I cherish her and bring out her essence in an artistic, beautiful way.

  •  ♡ Frequently Asked Questions ♡ 

    When will I get my book?

    I set August as the shipment date to insure that we take into account manufacturing times for the various products, as well as the length of the campaign. My goal is to send them out as soon as possible, but please be aware that there may be some delays!

    How is the money going to be used?

    Most of the money will be used to pay the manufacturing costs, as well as the shipping from the manufacturer to Portugal.

    Indiegogo and the payment processor will take 10% of funds raised as their fee!

    The remaining funds will be used to pay for shipping materials, as well as the bonus items.

    Any funds left  after the project is fully funded will go towards my next projects!

    Contact Information

    Please be sure to check your emails for updates after the campaign is over, since I will send  important information about choosing your rewards!

    You can message me either here on indiegogo or through my twitter @Queen_Adrya if you have any questions!

Risks and challenges

  • Please be aware that this project is only being run by myself so there may be some delays when it comes to shipping everything. I will work my hardest to ensure everything is shipped on schedule, though!!!
story_txt:
About
After a  lot of consideration and a warm feedback from the cosplay and persona community, I've decided to make a cosplay / fashion looks / aesthetic book as Makoto Niijima from Persona 5!
The book will feature various outfits of her, plus street fashion and more, with my own personal touch! 
I look forward to this project, and to more in the future!
Please note that for the rewards to be fulfilled, I need to reach the campaign goal! After the campaign is successfully funded, a form will be sent out about the rewards and about any stretch goals ones if they are reached, as well!
Please note that this is a fan made book to show my love and support to Makoto, the Persona series and community! 

What We Need & What You Get!
 
For the magazine/book, we'll need 3300 euros to cover the costs.
This includes transportation to the photoshoot locations; materials, shipping costs and production costs as well.
 ♡ Magazine/Book specifications ♡
• 100+ pages of aesthetic and cosplay photography,carefully edited (not including cover and back cover)  and signed with lots of love!•Printed in a 23cmx15cm format. • Perfect Bind •Full color • Silk Touch cover
♡ Included photoshoots ♡
• Swimsuit | Beach themed.
• Winter Shujin School Uniform | Library themed | Street themed.
•Summer Shujin School Uniform | Library themed | Street themed.
•Winter Casual Attire | Café themed | Street themed.
•Queen | Metaverse and Aesthethic themed.
•Persona Dancing Star Night Outfit | Arcade, Disco themed.
*** Some will include shots with special guests as Futaba, Akiren, Ann. Ryuji and Yusuke might make an appearance as well.***
If the goal is reached, there will be stretch goals! ♡
♡ Stretch Goals ♡
#1 
4500 euros
♡ If this goal is reached, three additional photoshoots will be added to the book:
• Masquerade Blue Dress
• Buchimaru Pijama
• Lingerie
#2
6000 euros
♡ If this goal is reached, three additional photoshoots will be added to the book:
• Makoto dressing as Panther
• Makoto dressing as Joker
• Makoto dressing as 2B.
 
♡Additional Stretch Goals to be added later.♡
Depending on how much you pledge, you will get as rewards:
♡ Exclusive sets of prints with photos from the book! ♡
♡ Polaroids of photos from the book, chosen by yourself and signed with love ! ♡
♡ HR set of photos from the various photoshoots! ♡
♡ Exclusive set of badges and charm! ♡
Makoto is a very dear character to me who I can relate a lot with, and she taught me so much, and thanks to her I got to know amazing people who changed my life forever. ♡
I hope this book will show you how much I cherish her and bring out her essence in an artistic, beautiful way.


 ♡ Frequently Asked Questions ♡ 
When will I get my book?
I set August as the shipment date to insure that we take into account manufacturing times for the various products, as well as the length of the campaign. My goal is to send them out as soon as possible, but please be aware that there may be some delays!
How is the money going to be used?
Most of the money will be used to pay the manufacturing costs, as well as the shipping from the manufacturer to Portugal.
Indiegogo and the payment processor will take 10% of funds raised as their fee!
The remaining funds will be used to pay for shipping materials, as well as the bonus items.
Any funds left  after the project is fully funded will go towards my next projects!
Contact Information
Please be sure to check your emails for updates after the campaign is over, since I will send  important information about choosing your rewards!
You can message me either here on indiegogo or through my twitter @Queen_Adrya if you have any questions!

Risks and challenges
Please be aware that this project is only being run by myself so there may be some delays when it comes to shipping everything. I will work my hardest to ensure everything is shipped on schedule, though!!!

• Description

    Fabric Bias Binding Tape Maker Kit Binder Foot Sewing Quilting Sew Case Tool Set Bias Tape Maker Kits OF 4 Sizes 1/4" 1/2" 3/4" 1" (6mm 12mm 18mm 25mm). You will get 1pc binder foot and awl ,10pcs quilting pins, 4 different size bias tape maker. Bias tape maker can be widely used in various leathercraft, tailor patchwork, DIY and much more. The binder foot will fit for Brother, Babylock, Janome, Kenmore, Singer and many more sewing machines that use a snap on foot. How To Use 1. Cut the bias strips across the fabric at 45°. 2. Wrong side up the tape maker, use awl to pull the fabric through. 3. Pull tape maker and press in folds iron, ready for sewing on or gluing. Product Specification Type Bias Tape Maker Kit Set 4 Sizes 1/4" 1/2" 3/4" 1" (6mm 12mm 18mm 25mm) Package Included 4pcs x Fabric Bias Tape Makers (4 sizes) 1pc x Wooden Awl 1pc x Adjustable Bias Binder Foot 10pcs x Ball Point Pins

story:
The Book/El Libro 

I just published an artbook with all the best sketches, illustrations and studies (I call them: "push ups") from the past three years, in a format that emulates a sketchbook with a stunning print quality at a reasonable price. This book is a compilation of the best pages of all the sketchbooks that I have filled during these years. The result of creative freedom and quitness (or not), just drawing for the sake of drawing, prime reason why I decided to make all this my profession.

The book has a format of 15x21cm, 144 pages with a great paper quality and hardback cover in black cloth. Is a facsimile, as close as possible to the format and appearance of the sketchbooks I normally use for drawing. Its content includes pencil sketches, character designs, oniric scenes, ink studies, acrylic paintings, ideas and drawings.

Acabo de publicar un libro con los mejores bocetos, ilustraciones y estudios (a los que yo llamo: "push ups", "flexiones" en inglés) de los últimos tres años, en un formato que emula un cuaderno de bocetos con una gran calidad de impresión a un precio razonable. Este libro es una compilación de las mejores páginas de todas las libretas que he rellenado durante estos años, fruto de la libertad creativa y la tranquilidad (o no) del dibujar por el placer de dibujar, razón primordial del porqué decidí hacer de esto mi profesión. 

El libro tiene un formato de 15x21cm, 144 páginas de buen gramaje a todo color y tapa dura forrada con tela negra y un bajorrelieve con un stamping a color en la portada. Es un facsímil lo más parecido posible al formato y apariencia de las libretas donde dibujo normalmente. El contenido incluye bocetos a lápiz, diseño de personajes, escenas oníricas, estudios de tinta, originales a color, bocetos de murales, pinturas en acrílico, ideas y dibujos varios.

 

ARTBOOK PUSH UPS - VOL. II (20€)

Here's the artbook. A5 (15x21cm) size, 144 full color pages, 125grs interior paper, hardcover, cover with debossing and color stamping, signed and your name in the credits. It comes with a screenprinted vinyl sticker.

Y aquí está el artbook. A5 (15x21cm), 144 páginas a todo color, papel interior de 125grs, tapa dura con bajorrelieve y stamping a color, firmado y con tu nombre en los créditos. Viene con un sticker de vinilo impreso en serigrafía.

 

ARTBOOK PUSH UPS (VOL. II + VOL. I) (40€)

The Push Ups - Vol II artbook plus the first Push Ups - Vol I artbook together. check for more information about the first book here: http://aleixgoho.com/shop/en/libros/8-push-ups-bocetos-dibujos-suenos-aleix-gordo-artbook.html

El artbook Push Ups - Vol II más el primer libro Push Ups - Vol I artbook juntos. Si quieres saber más sobre el primer libro clica aquí: http://aleixgoho.com/shop/es/libros/8-push-ups-bocetos-dibujos-suenos-aleix-gordo-artbook.html 

 

ARTBOOK + "ATLAS" PRINT (100€)

The artbook plus "Atlas" limited print (75 copies). 50x70cm size, three colors (grey, red & black) screenprint, 370grs paper, dry sealed, signed and numbered. If you want to check more about the print, please visit: http://aleixgoho.com/shop/en/inicio/28-atlas-print-aleix-gordo-hostau.html

El artbook más el print "Atlas" de serie limitada (75 copias). 50x70cm, serigrafía a tres colores (gris, rojo y negro), papel de 370 grs, sello en seco, firmado y numerado. Si quieres saber más sobre el print visita este link: http://aleixgoho.com/shop/es/inicio/28-atlas-print-aleix-gordo-hostau.html 

 

And to finish, some more images from the artbook: / Y para terminar, algunas imágenes más del artbook:

story:
Short Summary

My name is Patrick J. Reilly. I've been drawing dicks my whole life, professionally for 6 years. I would like to counter Mr. Haring's book with my own book. Instead of Manhattan, I'll draw what I know, Brooklyn. I'll let my home inspire me. With dicks.

What We Need & What You Get

It says $500 but, I really need something like $80... I mean the drawings will be easy, it's more for printing. Give me money for this.

The Impact

This is make America great again. Promise.

Risks & Challenge

The only risk is my mom will probably be like " Hey, don't do that." but where was Keith Haring's mom, right? The Challenge will be for me to get her to donate.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell my mom to chill and I don't know, tell your friends.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

I am Joel, a Digital Artist without a working computer. I had built a custom computer to support all my 3D and 2D needs. I have been developing art for many years and recently unable to due to my computer hardware crash. You can see my artwork (blaidtaod.tumblr.com) or check out my online store (http://www.designbyhumans.com/shop/Blaid/). All i ask is for a little help so i can continue doing what i love the most.

What We Need & What You Get

Currently i have a few parts in mind to purchase. I need a new video card and possibly a new cpu. The price will cover both of the products i need. I understand the sales for video cards are outrageous, but i know a couple decent cards i can work with. Once i have reached my goals all who contribute will be mentioned in my live stream (twitch.tv/blaid) and have a dedicated art series in their honor. (if possible send a free product) 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Art Tuscany Style   

 

Are you interested in owning one of the fabulous pieces of ancient art from Florence, the city of Leonardo and Michelangelo? And what about coming a modern Patron of the Arts as in 1500 was Lorenzo the Magnificent?

Then come and experience this wonderful adventure with us…

 

We are Florentine entrepreneurs, specialized in art, furniture and interior design; we work together with artists and master craftsmen. The research, care and respect for the roots and etymology of these forms of ancient art are guaranteed by the direct involvement and supervision of Art History Professors.

 

If Italy is the birthplace of the Renaissance, then Florence is the city that above all has embodied the essence.

 

A story that the entire world looks at with admiration: almost half of the masterpieces of the 1500s around the world are kept here in Florence. Leonardo, Dante, Michelangelo, Cellini, Giotto, Botticelli, Masaccio, Brunelleschi... they were all here.

To become a successful painter or sculptor, it was necessary to enroll from a young age in a Studio: a large workshop building, in which the master apart from practicing his own craft could also consider it to be his own home.

Basically, all of the famous artists mentioned have attended the Studios: in the one of Andrea Del Verrocchio would then grow the universal genius of Leonardo da Vinci, along with other young apprentices including Botticelli e il Perugino; in the one of Ghirlandaio the great Michelangelo Buonarroti will make his first experiences.

Lorenzo de' Medici, also called Lorenzo the Magnificent, exponent of the family “de 'Medici” and head of the city’s lordship, was the first to understand the importance of art and its interpreters for Florence and the world. Thanks to patronage and his thirst for culture, he managed to surround himself with quite influential intellectuals and artists. In some ways it is to him that we pay tribute: there is no doubt that today Lorenzo would use crowdfunding, to make the Florentine artists known.

 

All around us, only few hundred meters away, there are still Artists who use ancient forms of art: in painting, in furnaces, in jewelry. From there comes the idea of ​​"opening" our own Studio like those of the Renaissance so that anyone, in every corner of the world, would have the luck we have: touching by hand every day, breathing the smell of that cradle of civilization and art that was Florence between 1500 and 1600.

With a big difference compared to the past: that the Atelier of Art Tuscany Style will have an international breath and will look out on the World ...

For this reason we’ve chosen the most evolved and democratic tool currently available: Crowdfunding. Thanks to this tool, anyone of you, with a minimum investment, can contribute to the rebirth of these forms of ancient art and, in exchange, will own a piece, in the form of an original wood painting of 1600, in terracotta and with sculptures created by an internationally recognized master or possess a jewel structured in the same forge as those worn by the Florentine Renaissance Madonnas, made in pure bronze with engraved Murano glass and antique porcelains intaglio, with our jewelry line by “T”.

In short, it is a unique opportunity to be part, together, of the most important recovery community of these lost arts becoming, at the same time, members of the most exclusive club in the world: Art Tuscany Style. We guarantee to everybody of you the possibility to become Collectors of a good that, otherwise, you could only see behind the display case of a Museum…

                                  

THE REWARDS

The backers will receive the reward depending on the kind of donation and type chosen: each piece will be handcrafted by hand by Florentine artists and will be a unique piece. This donation will allow every backer to create an art production, respecting the Florentine Renaissance tradition. For the Crafts, using not only ancient techniques but also wooden supports, original from the 1500s and 1600s.  Terracotta items, instead, are created by Masters of the Impruneta fornaces- where the myth of Florentine terracotta was born, still appreciated and known all over the world - and the clay comes from the same quarries to which Brunelleschi drew to realize the roofing tiles and the bricks of the dome of the Cathedral of Florence. Finally, the Jewels by “T” will be made studying the images about ancient ornaments worn during the Renaissance, using the same engraving techniques at the time.

 

CONCLUSIONS

Art Tuscany Style it allows everyone, in every corner of the world, with a very limited expense, to own a piece of that history that we all admire in museums. At home, so that you can watch it, touch it and smell it every day, sharing it with your friends.

We are talking about a new kind of Crowdfunding: it is not just an initiative linked to the world of art, the revival of lost forms of ancient crafts; in the future we foresee new actions and proposals for our members.

The members of our Community will later be involved later in a series of initiatives related to Tuscany and to Florence in particular. Our traveling companions will find out that this is just the beginning of a fantastic adventure, which starts in 1500 and arrives to the our present days ...

 

Can’t you  buy on ATS item right now? You can help us anyway!

If you think our Project is a great Project (and it is really: it allows to many Artisans to craft and handle ancient arts which otherwise could be lost…), you can help us: get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Share with your friends on your Community the link to Indiegogo, make happy somebody else!

Basically, all of the famous artists mentioned have attended the Studios: in the one of Andrea Del Verrocchio would then grow the universal genius of Leonardo da Vinci, along with other young apprentices including Botticelli e il Perugino; in the one of Ghirlandaio the great Michelangelo Buonarroti will make his first experiences.
Lorenzo de' Medici, also called Lorenzo the Magnificent, exponent of the family “de 'Medici” and head of the city’s lordship, was the first to understand the importance of art and its interpreters for Florence and the world. Thanks to patronage and his thirst for culture, he managed to surround himself with quite influential intellectuals and artists. In some ways it is to him that we pay tribute: there is no doubt that today Lorenzo would use crowdfunding, to make the Florentine artists known.
 
All around us, only few hundred meters away, there are still Artists who use ancient forms of art: in painting, in furnaces, in jewelry. From there comes the idea of ​​"opening" our own Studio like those of the Renaissance so that anyone, in every corner of the world, would have the luck we have: touching by hand every day, breathing the smell of that cradle of civilization and art that was Florence between 1500 and 1600.
With a big difference compared to the past: that the Atelier of Art Tuscany Style will have an international breath and will look out on the World ...
For this reason we’ve chosen the most evolved and democratic tool currently available: Crowdfunding. Thanks to this tool, anyone of you, with a minimum investment, can contribute to the rebirth of these forms of ancient art and, in exchange, will own a piece, in the form of an original wood painting of 1600, in terracotta and with sculptures created by an internationally recognized master or possess a jewel structured in the same forge as those worn by the Florentine Renaissance Madonnas, made in pure bronze with engraved Murano glass and antique porcelains intaglio, with our jewelry line by “T”.
In short, it is a unique opportunity to be part, together, of the most important recovery community of these lost arts becoming, at the same time, members of the most exclusive club in the world: Art Tuscany Style. We guarantee to everybody of you the possibility to become Collectors of a good that, otherwise, you could only see behind the display case of a Museum…
                                  
THE REWARDS
The backers will receive the reward depending on the kind of donation and type chosen: each piece will be handcrafted by hand by Florentine artists and will be a unique piece. This donation will allow every backer to create an art production, respecting the Florentine Renaissance tradition. For the Crafts, using not only ancient techniques but also wooden supports, original from the 1500s and 1600s.  Terracotta items, instead, are created by Masters of the Impruneta fornaces- where the myth of Florentine terracotta was born, still appreciated and known all over the world - and the clay comes from the same quarries to which Brunelleschi drew to realize the roofing tiles and the bricks of the dome of the Cathedral of Florence. Finally, the Jewels by “T” will be made studying the images about ancient ornaments worn during the Renaissance, using the same engraving techniques at the time.
 
CONCLUSIONS
Art Tuscany Style it allows everyone, in every corner of the world, with a very limited expense, to own a piece of that history that we all admire in museums. At home, so that you can watch it, touch it and smell it every day, sharing it with your friends.
We are talking about a new kind of Crowdfunding: it is not just an initiative linked to the world of art, the revival of lost forms of ancient crafts; in the future we foresee new actions and proposals for our members.
The members of our Community will later be involved later in a series of initiatives related to Tuscany and to Florence in particular. Our traveling companions will find out that this is just the beginning of a fantastic adventure, which starts in 1500 and arrives to the our present days ...
 
Can’t you  buy on ATS item right now? You can help us anyway!
If you think our Project is a great Project (and it is really: it allows to many Artisans to craft and handle ancient arts which otherwise could be lost…), you can help us: get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Share with your friends on your Community the link to Indiegogo, make happy somebody else!

story:
THE TRIBALEGLOBALE'S INTIMATE MUSEUM: FROM CHESTS TO YOUR DRESSER...

They are exactly what they claim to be: artworks intended to be displayed on a table or on a dresser, by subject, size and number,If the function of art is at first to evoke states of consciousness, I hope it keeps the dignity and the suggestion of a "real" show. 

The artworks are present in the Tribaleglobale collection : over 1000 pieces in terracotta, wood, metals, stones, organic materials such as human hair, bony skins, carved bones, toothpicks, collected in thirty years by Giuliano Arnaldi, organized in the format TRIBALEGLOBALE: the smallest artwork measure 2 cm, the largest several meters, the oldest is more than five thousand years old, the most recent just few months, the cheapest cost a few tens of euros, the most expensive today would be unavailable .. each has the great archetypal value of what it is about the human being, his questions, and the beauty of the path of life. 

The Tribaleglobale's Museum is closed in chests because it takes too much space and too much money to show them all together... but this problem can become an opportunity.

Why should artworks be exhibited only in traditional defined spaces? And why should they only be destined for a collective enjoyment? Starting from this second consideration, it can be said that it is exactly the opposite: the artwork often arises to be seen (and not looked at ...) exclusively by those who create it, which later undergoes an external look and bit by bit to a wider observation. If the work has the "quid", as it is said today, it still continues to talk to each human being who is reacting with it, and not to all people together: it is the archetype that manifests itself.

So why don't we exhibit with few objects, and "at home"?

Exhibiting many works together creates a logistical problems and  the risk of some sort of drunkenness ... then I thought of giving structure and continuity to a gesture I have so far done for myself. For a while, I've been pulling out a few pieces of work from a chest  and put them on desk to see them constantly and always in a new perspective. It's a common gesture for every collector. I realized that I pay great attention to other aspects, such as the number of objects, which is always symbolic: 1, 3, 7, 9 ... In addition to an implicit harmony that you feel, it must be the poem of the numbers that is talking. I also discovered discrete monumentalism that certain objects emanate: they are only a few inches long but they could be meters... monuments in power that turn into action just by changing the look ... In fact, I organize exhibitions on my desk,  con/fusing myself in the game of proportions. 

So the idea of ​​the table exhibition was born.  If you like our look at art you can rent them for short periods, you will soon find the different proposals online: it will work like delivery pizza, a kind of "artistic catering", with 'themed menus and an exquisite "CARD MENU" that you can consult on https://www.flickr.com/photos/tribaleglobale/co... Thus  you will help our project, that walks only with its legs... Each exhibition is accompanied by a small information catalog that provides useful information to understand the origin and history of the works: if you would like I will come and show them to you , but I believe that the taste of beauty will stop on your tables to stay with you even when the works that have summoned  it will be back in the chests ...

story:
About

This piece originally started as a social political piece about American archetypes and their effect on our current social and political landscape. My previous work investigates how the the figure of the cowboy has deeply implanted itself into the subconscious of the working class. How the stoic figure who works himself to death and sleeps in the dirt and would never need health insurance is not an icon of the working class, but a convenient propaganda tool for a late capitalism. We have a culture that encourages people to vote against their own interests and icons that glorify their suffering. These narratives are not only tools of obedience but templates that are easily impersonated by the ruling class to bluff a false comradely with the American public.  At first I approached the public figure of Evel Knievel as an extension of this idea. There is a glorified masochism, nationalism and heroic epic embedded in the collective public memory of Evel that aligns with the long lineage of the cowboy. The children who tuned in to watch the great American hero risk his life in his red white and blue jumpsuit are now grown and voting. I still believe that his image has contributed to this prescribed narrative of the masses, however the preliminary research of the performance piece took on a life of its own and things are far more complicated than I could have predicted.

 

Iv read most available biographies, watched countless documentaries, searched every interview and then finally began communication with those who were close to Evel. I realized that the hero comes equipped with all of the complexes as the rest of us trying to exist here as humans. His legacy started to take form of real people in my own life. I now wince when watching his crashes. I cry when the biographies eventually get to the part where he passes in 2007. You can't spend this much time with a person and not feel close to them. He was an extremely complicated man who’s life was not the gilded image he laboriously tried to promote. He broke nearly every bone in his body and spent most of his life in pain for the entertainment of the American people who eventually abandoned him when he started landing safely. He was a man who later suffered from what can be described as PTSD from the sound of engines. He said he would do a stunt and he did it, whether he really wanted to or not. Keeping his word was everything.

 

I don't envision this as an embodiment of a hero or a villain, i'm more invested in the mire of multidimensional grey area and the failures that are inherently built into the piece. I'm interested in the closest version of a truthful embodiment. He was a man of many intricacies, a person who hurt some people but is still loved and protected by many who were a part of his life. For me, this is a performance of not only investigation, but reconciliation

story:
We are going to open an independent felting studio. 

We want to save and spread an amazing ancient craft of felting. Therefore we will create a workshop series and realtime online skype classes. 

As a result, you will get not only beautiful and unusual felted carpet modules which you can combine as desired but also an ispiration and knowledge for making your life more interesting, colourful, cozy and magnificent. 

We want to felt dreams!

About the future studio

My name is Polina Kudelkina. I'm an artist, designer and decorator. I want to open an independent felting studio for you, creative people, and your beautiful home, for saving and spreading an amazing ancient craft of felting, for felting dreams in the end.

To share my experience in felting I will create a workshop series as well as realtime online skype classes. In the independent felting studio me and you could create an amazing decor and accessories, also clothes, and even soft and cozy places
for pets. 

Recently, I have designed the very usefull modular rugs, which are not only rugs by the way but also modules for different things. For example, a hat, storage containers, a purse, a bag... your imagination. This beautiful rugs I will create in felting studio for you!


Why are we doing this campaign?

However, to live we need to eat. Therefore, I have to work as a designer seller in Kerama Marazzi shops, that's why I haven't enough time to make my felting dreams and the felting studio comes true. 
The second reason to open the studio is to give to our lifes a great chance to participate in something really interesting and important. 
Finally, having this studio I could bring more creativity, colors, cosiness, warm and laugh to your life.


What We Need & What You Get

We need nearly 3123 dollars to buy materials (wool, tissue, soap, bubble wrap, findings etc.) for 300 rug modules.  We need nearly 4654 dollars for living during half a year (food, utilities, Internet, transport and so on).
If we don't reach our entire goal we will complete orders received by buying necessary materials and tools. Perhaps, we won't get a possibility of openning an independent felting studio because of deficiency of finance and may be even of starting online classes because of shortage of time. It will be sad because I want not only to make beautiful carpet modules but also to share my knowledge and experience about felting craft. However, such a situation will not hurt us to complete the orders.

Risks & Challenges

The risk of this campaign is that I will get not enough money to open an independent studio and/or to live and work without employment. This will cause the shortage of free time for felting and not too significant increase
of time necesssary for completing orders received.

How you can also help.

1. Buy a carpet module!
With your purchase, you'll be making a contribution to the revival, preservation and spreading of the amazing ancient craft.

2. Tell your friends about us!
Share the link to this site on all your social media platforms. Give everyone a chance to be a part of something really interesting and important.

3. Support us.
We need your help to work. Follow the news of the project here on this site and re-tweet the messages. Together, we can inspire the world and make it more beautiful!

story:
We are a group of artists from Canada, UK, Singapore, USA and Viva Mexico!!!

Our Mantra is to RECYCLE, REUSE and REDUCE.
70% of materials will be from recycled resources, and wind generated sound to make music.

We need SUPPORT in SOLAR ENERGY to power our art installation. 
Your contribution will help in our camp funds.

This work in a small way is a manifestation of our collective GreenKarma.
Let's motivate each other to contribute to shaping our planet for the better collectively!

Thank you

story:
Who we are

The team Sculpting Democracy hopes to bring levity and humor into an otherwise bleak political world.  We hope that our sculptures are viewed as an artist interpretation of fun facts, fake news, and insane politics.  We like to say we are starting a brand new wave of POP culture politics!

#popculturepolitics

Our campaign goals

America is reeling from tragedy…we need unity more than ever…45 is exploiting anxiety

Our campaign's primary goal is twofold, to create a humorous platform that also brings a serious but irreverent level of focus on our current political landscape. Another goal is to use our platform to always contribute to society in a meaningful way. With each campaign we plan to donate 5% of all net profits earned spread over following cause-worthy organizations:

A.C.L.U.

Planned Parenthood

Save the Children

Trevor Project

The Sierra Club

Anti-Defamation League

She Should Run

Naral Pro-Choice America

Disability Rights Education & Defense Fund

NAACP Legal Defense

National Immigration Law Center

International Refugee Assistance Project

AND MANY MORE...

What your contribution will mean

By contributing, you will not only be a patron of the arts you will also be an entrepreneur with the vision of helping to start a new era of pop culture politics #popculturepolitics.  By supporting the Sculpting Democracy team and our goal, you will not only help us produce our very first commemorative statue, Christmas stockings, and Christmas ornaments. You will help us raise money to donate to a worthy social cause.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The Sculpting democracy team needs a total of about $65,000 to cover the cost of production of our commemorative sculpt and our commemorative gold ornament.  The cost would also cover shipping of the product from  CH-EYE-NA (CHINA). 

Also, no matter what we get, 5% of our earnings will go to the good causes we mentioned above.

So a quick breakdown on cost, we need roughly:

$35,000 to pay to tool the main sculpt.

$10,000 to tool the ornament.  The balance funds will be used to pay for shipping and production of each unit ordered.

So what do you get?  Well, some pretty awesome stuff!

 

We just LOVE these campaign contributors.  5.00

This level is just a donation level for those patrons and visionaries out there who want to contribute to our campaign, but selflessly don't want to have a gorgeous sculpt sitting on their dresser or mantle. 

Our  It Was a Stormy Night Perk.  5.00

You will receive a fully colored illustration of our 45 and... um, one of his good friends in a heated err, political debate. 

OK here is a SUPER SPECIAL "IN CAMPAIGN" DEAL!  

The BEST Christmas Stocking EVER Perk 20.00!!!

This is Truly the BEST Christmas stocking you will ever own.  It's GOLD! 45's favorite color!
It features gold on gold embroidered image of old gold 45 and Stormy.  Own this amazing
conversation piece! for just 20.00! First 1000 to order before November 30th, 2018 can
get it on time for this Christmas!

Our GOLD 45 Ornament Perk.  35.00

This contributor is one who wants to hang old Gold 45... on their tree for some fun holiday cheer. Packaged in a red gift box this gold painted piece is sure to start fun conversations at home during your holidays with the family!

Our FAKE NEWS Perk 150.00 

FAKE NEWS Edition contributors will get our 9" Sculpt, beautifully sculpted and detailed. This piece is designed with a Washington monument stone "look and feel"  This amazing limited sculpt will only be produced once for this campaign!  It will come packed in a beautifully designed collector styled box.  

 

Our GOLDEN..umm Moments Perk 150.00

 

For those contributors who love GOLD as much as our 45, this all golden edition is sure to shower you with its brilliance and detail.   Painted in a lustrous gold color anyone who loves gold as much as 45 is sure to love this piece.  Also included in this contributor level is the collector style box, contribute to this level if you want your very own, every limited commemorative gold statue of 45 Putin on a show! 

Our GREATEST BRONZE Statue Ever Perk  100.00

This is simply the GREATEST BRONZE Statue EVER, its the BEST Bronze Statue you will ever

own, its the Greatest Bronze Statue you will ever see! You have to own this piece!

Our NO COLLUSION, FROM RUSSIA with LOVE Perk 199.00

This full colored detail piece truly captures the details of the sculpt.  Created with a whimsical flair, but also full of detail and humor this piece is for the lover of detail and politics.  Contributors to this piece will receive this amazing sculpt in a highly detailed full-color paint and packed in a gorgeous collector edition box.   You will be able to sit back and enjoy a WHITE RUSSIAN while staring blissfully at this work of art that is the conversation piece of all pieces!  Whether you are into politics or not this is an amazing collectors edition piece.

The WHOLE COVFEVE Contributor Perk  550. 00

Contributors who like our 45 just want it all!  This is the level is for you!  You get it all!  The Litho, the Fake News level stone edition sculpt. The Golden...ummm Moments edition sculpt, the No Collusion, From Russia with Love contributor level sculpt, and the Gold 45 ornament!

 

Here are some more detailed sculpt views:

Some additional details for the Statues Each of the perks statues.  Each piece stands about 9" tall from head to the base area.

 

 

Each piece is sculpted with a focus on detail, design and character accuracy so the piece you received is not only an awesome political satirical statement, buts a pretty cool piece of art!

 

Here as some awesome detail shots of the actual sculpts decorated. ..

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our Campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • #tagging is a huge too!

    Here are some #tags that can help!

    #Sculptingdemocracy, #popculturepolitics , #45, #TrumpPutin #Stormytrump, #Thewholecovfefe, #Nocollusion #Nocollusioncampaign, #Nocollusionsculpt #fromrussiawithlovesculpt

The Impact We hope to have with our Campaign is simple:

  • We are in a new world of politics where things are happening that you wouldn't believe if they were written for in a sitcom or Horror film! So why not add a new era of pop culture in politics by creating some irreverence in art!  You can be part of a new era in ART politics and in making a statement the visual sparks important conversation.

Risks & Challenges

  • The biggest risk we will run into is if we cannot meet our Tooling minimum if we can't then we simply won't be able to produce the product.
  • If for any reason we cannot meet our tooling minimum we will alert our contributors at that time with our alternative strategy on making our statues.  But, we have faith in you guys!

The Impact We hope to have with our Campaign is simple:
We are in a new world of politics where things are happening that you wouldn't believe if they were written for in a sitcom or Horror film! So why not add a new era of pop culture in politics by creating some irreverence in art!  You can be part of a new era in ART politics and in making a statement the visual sparks important conversation.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk we will run into is if we cannot meet our Tooling minimum if we can't then we simply won't be able to produce the product.
If for any reason we cannot meet our tooling minimum we will alert our contributors at that time with our alternative strategy on making our statues.  But, we have faith in you guys!
